original: sangs rgyas kyis kyang gzigs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis kyang gzigs mi 'gyur //
translated: Even the Buddha cannot see it.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di zhes yongs su dpyod par mi nus te rang rig pa mthar thug pa'i phyir ye shes la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di zhes yongs su dpyod par mi nus te rang rig pa mthar thug pa'i phyir ye shes la gnas pa'o //
translated: This cannot be analyzed as “this,” because it is based on gnosis, due to the ultimate nature of self-awareness.

original: 'dis ni mi snang ba'i sbyor ba yang @215a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi snang ba'i sbyor ba yang @215a * //
translated: This also explains the application of invisibility

original: lha thams cad kyi thun mong du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi thun mong du bshad pa'o //
translated: in common for all the deities.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje mi mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin de las byung bar 'gyur bas nam mkha'i snying po de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje mi mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin de las byung bar 'gyur bas nam mkha'i snying po de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since he arises from the meditative absorption in which he does not see the vajra body and so forth, he is called Ākāśagarbha.

original: de'i bkod pa'i phreng ba ni spro bas sprul pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bkod pa'i phreng ba ni spro bas sprul pa ste /
translated: His garland of arrays is the emanation through his emanations.

original: gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who has that is so called.

original: rang sngags skyes bu rab bsams la //
analyzed: rang sngags skyes bu rab bsams la //
translated: Having well contemplated the being of one’s mantra,

original: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du kun du bzang po bskyed nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du kun du bzang po bskyed nas so //
translated: having generated Samantabhadra just like the Akṣobhya maṇḍala,

original: de'i snying gar ham yig rdo rjer grags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i snying gar ham yig rdo rjer grags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: at his heart the syllable haṃ, renowned as the vajra,

original: chos thams cad ni rgyu dang bral ba ste tha mi dad pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis te bsgoms nas zhes bya bar 'brel bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rgyu dang bral ba ste tha mi dad pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis te bsgoms nas zhes bya bar 'brel bar bya'o //
translated: All dharmas are devoid of cause, by the nature of non-different intuition. The connection is to be made with “having meditated.”

original: byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la spro ba la sogs pa sngon du song bas kun du bzang por 'gyur ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la spro ba la sogs pa sngon du song bas kun du bzang por 'gyur ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having done, etc. — it is said that by the prior going of the emanation, etc., one becomes Samantabhadra.

original: 'jam dpal gyi sgras 'dir kun du bzang po nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi sgras 'dir kun du bzang po nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gsungs so //
translated: The word “Manjusri” here is said to be the reason for entering into Samantabhadra himself.

original: sgra gtso bo ma yin pa'i brjod pa ni ji ltar gleng gzhir gsungs pa 'dir sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du gzhan yang bsgrub par bya bar rigs kyi dbye bas zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: sgra gtso bo ma yin pa'i brjod pa ni ji ltar gleng gzhir gsungs pa 'dir sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du gzhan yang bsgrub par bya bar rigs kyi dbye bas zhes ston pa'o //
translated: The statement that the sound is not primary is to be established here as in the nidana. Just as it is to be established, so it is to be understood by the division.

original: sa bcu dag la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang /
analyzed: sa bcu dag la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang /
translated: “Dwelling on the ten stages” is the Joyous, the Stainless, the Radiant, the Brilliant, the Hard-to-conquer, the Approaching, the Gone-far, the Immovable, the Excellent-in-wisdom, and the Cloud-of-Dharma.

original: mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin gyi mtshan nyid sa bcu dag la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin gyi mtshan nyid sa bcu dag la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes established on the ten stages, which are characterized by the Joyous, the Stainless, the Shining, the Brighter, the Hard-to-conquer, the Approaching, the Gone-far, the Immovable, the Excellent-mind, and the Cloud-of-Dharma.

original: yang na spyan la sogs pa ni 'dir sa bcu ste de rnams la gnas pa yin la de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bsnyen par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na spyan la sogs pa ni 'dir sa bcu ste de rnams la gnas pa yin la de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bsnyen par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, the ten stages are the Eye and so forth, and one becomes established on them. The meaning is that one should approach them just as they are.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes ni sa bcu pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes ni sa bcu pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of the Bodhisattvas arises from the ten stages.

original: de dag yang dag par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag yang dag par rtogs pa ste /
translated: They are the perfect realizations.

original: zla ba dang rdo rje rim pa'i ting 'dzin de nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang rdo rje rim pa'i ting 'dzin de nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who has that very concentration of the Moon and Vajra stages is so-called.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus su bsam //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus su bsam //
translated: One should imagine him in the middle of the realm of space.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi sngags kyi skyes bu dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bsam zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi sngags kyi skyes bu dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bsam zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should imagine the excellent being of one's own mantra in the middle of the mandala of the pledge.

original: 'od zer 'bar ba'i yi ge thlim snying gar blta bar bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer 'bar ba'i yi ge thlim snying gar blta bar bya zhes bya'o //
translated: One should see the syllable THLĪM blazing with light-rays in the heart.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi zhags pa yang dag par gcod pa'i ye shes kyi mtshon cha'i sbyor ba las mchog ste sgrib @215b pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi zhags pa yang dag par gcod pa'i ye shes kyi mtshon cha'i sbyor ba las mchog ste sgrib @215b pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
translated: The supreme application of the weapon of wisdom that completely severs the noose of all afflictions is Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin.

original: sku rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi sku rdo rje dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: sku rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi sku rdo rje dang 'dra bas so //
translated: Vajrakāya means that his body is like a vajra, the nature of indivisible wisdom.

original: don yod grub pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don yod grub pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes like Amoghasiddhi.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir 'dir thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir 'dir thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, he is not the nature of all, because he is in the form of a bodhisattva.

original: la la dag 'dir de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis kyang 'jam dpal gyi sbyor bas bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: la la dag 'dir de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis kyang 'jam dpal gyi sbyor bas bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Some here desire to perform the practice of Mañjuśrī with the two immediately preceding samādhis.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa la /
translated: In the consecration of the body and so forth,

original: rang sngags skyes bu bsams nas ni //
analyzed: rang sngags skyes bu bsams nas ni //
translated: contemplating the being born from one's mantra,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de /
translated: and so forth,

original: da ni mngon par shes pa'i gnas skabs su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni mngon par shes pa'i gnas skabs su bstan par bya'o //
translated: now it should be explained in the context of the higher perceptions.

original: sangs rgyas mngon shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mngon shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The Buddha's superknowledge, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa ni zag pa zad pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa ni zag pa zad pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The Buddha's superknowledge is the intuition of the extinction of the contaminants.

original: de'i dam tshig mchog ni lha'i mi la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig mchog ni lha'i mi la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga'o //
translated: Its supreme commitment is the five superknowledges of the gods, humans, etc.

original: 'di dag mngon du song ba nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag mngon du song ba nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: Because they have gone beyond, they are the Buddha's superknowledges.

original: de'i phyir lta'i mig gis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lta'i mig gis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa lnga'o //
translated: Therefore, because they are endowed with the superknowledge of the divine eye, etc., they are the five superknowledges.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa lnga nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa lnga nyid do //
translated: This refers to the five superknowledges.

original: sangs rgyas mngon shes mchog bsgrub pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mngon shes mchog bsgrub pa //
translated: The supreme attainment of the Buddha's superknowledge

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs kyis mngon par shes pa drug pa rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs kyis mngon par shes pa drug pa rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the perfection of the six superknowledges of the Buddha family.

original: da ni mngon par shes pa rdzogs pa'i don gyi rim pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni mngon par shes pa rdzogs pa'i don gyi rim pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the sequence of the meaning of the perfection of the superknowledges is stated:

original: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the realm of space and so forth.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'am rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'am rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is Akshobhya or Vajradhara.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Knowledge is the utterly pure knowledge.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi sku rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi sku rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it perfects the body that is of the nature of that [knowledge],

original: de nyid yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: de nyid yi ge aom mo //
translated: it is the syllable OM.

original: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni sku byin gyis brlab pa'i don du'o //🔽ji lta bu zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni sku byin gyis brlab pa'i don du'o // ji lta bu zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Meditate means for the sake of blessing the body.

original: rdo rje dam tshig gsum bsgoms pas //
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig gsum bsgoms pas //
translated: How? He says, Meditating on the three vajra commitments.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin lha'i gzugs nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin lha'i gzugs nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is by the very form of the deity as it is.

original: de yang brjod pa dam tshig sems dpa'i gzugs kyi sku rdo rje bskyed la gsungs pa'i rim pas byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa bya'o //🔽'dis cir 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang brjod pa dam tshig sems dpa'i gzugs kyi sku rdo rje bskyed la gsungs pa'i rim pas byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa bya'o // 'dis cir 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, having generated the vajra body of the commitment being, which is the expression, one should bless it and so forth in the stages taught.

original: mi bskyod pa rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad @216a * //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad @216a * //
translated: What is the result of this? He says, The three vajras of Akshobhya, and so forth.

original: gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: sku la sogs pa mi bskyod pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa mi bskyod pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body, etc. are like Akṣobhya.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Vairocana is to be explained.

original: rin chen bdag po re zhig gsungs pa /
analyzed: rin chen bdag po re zhig gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord of Jewels, for the time being, says:

original: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the realm of space, etc.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du rdo rje'i ye shes gang la yod pa 'di mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni rin chen dbang ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du rdo rje'i ye shes gang la yod pa 'di mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni rin chen dbang ngo //
translated: This is Ratnasambhava, the nature of the gnosis of equality, who has the vajra-gnosis like space.

original: rin chen aom ni zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sku bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rin chen aom ni zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sku bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The Om of the jewel, because it generates the body of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The three vajras, etc. are as explained above.

original: byang chub ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i blo'o //
translated: Awakening is the mind of the purity of nature, the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: de nyid bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: That itself is the secret of the gnosis of selflessness.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni mnyam pa'o //
translated: Similarity is equality.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni bzhi ste de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni bzhi ste de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The abode is the four suchnesses.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One attains the wisdom of equality.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi sbyor ba gsungs pa ;
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi sbyor ba gsungs pa ;
translated: The application to Amitābha is stated:

original: chos kyi aom zhes bya ba ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi sku bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi aom zhes bya ba ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi sku bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The dharma-oṃ is the cause of generating the body of Amitābha.

original: theg chen lam gyi zhes bya ba ni rang gis rtogs pa'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan la bstan pa las bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg chen lam gyi zhes bya ba ni rang gis rtogs pa'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan la bstan pa las bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The Mahāyāna path is the cause of generating the path of the bodhisattva with its result of realization, which is taught to others according to one’s own realization.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams kyi rdo rje'i mthu ste thams cad zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams kyi rdo rje'i mthu ste thams cad zil gyis mnan te /
translated: The vajra power of the qualities of the Buddha Amitābha is the splendor of all.

original: 'jug pa de nyid dpal te /
analyzed: 'jug pa de nyid dpal te /
translated: That very engagement is glorious.

original: phun sum tshogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That samādhi which has that is so-called.

original: don yod grub pa'i gsungs pa /
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i gsungs pa /
translated: The statement of Amoghasiddhi is:

original: nam mkha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The sky, etc.

original: autpala zhes bya ba ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: autpala zhes bya ba ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The lotus is Amoghasiddhi.

original: dam tshig aom zhes bya ba ni don yod grub pa'i sku rnyed pa'o //🔽sems can kun don 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dam tshig aom zhes bya ba ni don yod grub pa'i sku rnyed pa'o // sems can kun don 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: The commitment is the syllable Om, which is the attainment of the body of Amoghasiddhi.

original: zhes bya ba ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes thob pas sems can thams cad kyi don 'byung ba 'di las 'gyur ba de la de skad ces bya'o//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes thob pas sems can thams cad kyi don 'byung ba 'di las 'gyur ba de la de skad ces bya'o//
translated: The source of the welfare of all beings is the attainment of the knowledge of successful action, from which the welfare of all beings arises. It is so called because of that.

original: gdon mi za ba'i dam tshig de'i sku sgrub pa yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba'i dam tshig de'i sku sgrub pa yi ge aom mo //
translated: The commitment is the syllable Om, which is the attainment of the body of Amoghasiddhi.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams las ye shes kyi mchog nyid kyi sku byin gyis brlab pa nyid 'byung ba'i phyir sku zhes de skad brjod do //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams las ye shes kyi mchog nyid kyi sku byin gyis brlab pa nyid 'byung ba'i phyir sku zhes de skad brjod do //
translated: The body is so called because the consecration of the body of the supreme knowledge itself arises from its light-rays.

original: de ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samadhi which reveals that is also called by that name.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku byin gyis brlab @216b pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku byin gyis brlab @216b pa gsungs pa /
translated: The consecration of the body of Vairocana is stated:

original: sku gsum aom zhes bya ba ni sku gsum tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku gsum aom zhes bya ba ni sku gsum tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
translated: The three bodies are Om means that the three bodies are of the nature of non-differentiation.

original: ye shes rdzogs byang chub ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes rdzogs byang chub ces bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of knowledge and enlightenment is the consecration of the body of Akshobhya.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes nyid kyis mngon par byang chub par 'gyur pa nyid do //🔽de bzhin du a'a: h'um zhes bya ba'i sa bon gnyis kyis go rims bzhin thams cad la gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i don du /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes nyid kyis mngon par byang chub par 'gyur pa nyid do // de bzhin du a'a: h'um zhes bya ba'i sa bon gnyis kyis go rims bzhin thams cad la gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i don du /
translated: by the mirror-like pristine awareness itself, one becomes fully enlightened.

original: dam tshig sems dpa'i gzugs nyid kyis gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa'i gzugs nyid kyis gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, with the two seed syllables A: and HŪ: , one should generate the Speech and Mind Vajras in the form of the Commitment Being itself, in order to consecrate all of them in the Speech and Mind.

original: de bzhin du bskyed pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor pas mngon par shes pa grub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du bskyed pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor pas mngon par shes pa grub pa gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the mantra adept who has generated the deity should accomplish the superknowledges.

original: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The superknowledges are taught, beginning with “Akshobhya, etc.”

original: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: “Jñānavajra” is Vairochana.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa /

original: de la ji ltar de bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ba de ltar da ni ri lu bsgrub pa la sngon du bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa rang gi sngags kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad gsungs🔽pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ji ltar de bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ba de ltar da ni ri lu bsgrub pa la sngon du bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa rang gi sngags kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad gsungs🔽pa yin te /
translated: There, just as one attains the vajra body and so forth, now, in the practice of the pill, it is said that through the preliminary approach and so forth, with one's own mantra and so forth, it is stated thus:

analyzed: glus bskul ba'i de ma thag tu yi ge aom gyi sa bon dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad par bsgoms nas /

original: spro ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis rnam par snang mdzad du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi bar du byas la /
analyzed: spro ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis rnam par snang mdzad du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi bar du byas la /
translated: Then, through the stages of emanating and so forth, one should perform the three meditative stabilizations, becoming Vairocana.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas te /
translated: One should abide in the commitments and vows just as they are.

original: ri lu sgrub pa'i don du ji srid mtshan ma byung ba la sogs pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ri lu sgrub pa'i don du ji srid mtshan ma byung ba la sogs pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the pill, one should meditate for as long as the signs arise and so forth.

original: de nas sgrub pa la 'jug par byas te /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa la 'jug par byas te /
translated: Then, one should enter into the practice.

original: gang yang / dngos grub sgrub pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas ni //
analyzed: gang yang / dngos grub sgrub pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas ni //
translated: And also: Having seen the signs of accomplishing the powers,

original: de nyid gsum mchod byas nas rang gi sems //
analyzed: de nyid gsum mchod byas nas rang gi sems //
translated: one should worship the three realities, and one’s mind

analyzed: sngar bshad dkyil 'khor la ni gnas nas su //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub rab tu bsgrub par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: and one should accomplish the desired powers.

original: de bzhin du rang gi sa bon dang mtshan ma rnams kyis gsung dang thugs rdo rje dag kyang ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi sa bon dang mtshan ma rnams kyis gsung dang thugs rdo rje dag kyang ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed do //
translated: Likewise, one should generate the Speech and Mind Vajras in the same way, by means of one's own seed and sign.

original: de yang nye bar mtshon pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang nye bar mtshon pa'i don to //
translated: And that is the illustrative meaning.

original: thams cad du rang gi sa bon dang // mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rim pa rnams kyis lha rnams bskyed par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rang gi sa bon dang // mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rim pa rnams kyis lha rnams bskyed par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Everywhere, one should see the generation of the deities by means of the stages of one's own seed, sign, and so forth.

original: ral gri la sogs pa'i dngos grub bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ral gri la sogs pa'i dngos grub bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach the accomplishments of the sword and so forth, it is said:

original: rang gi sngags kyi sa ral gri bsgom //
analyzed: rang gi sngags kyi sa ral gri bsgom //
translated: Meditate on the sword of one's mantra.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ral gri grub pa'i dus su ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi sa bon gyis ral gri bskyed la nam zhig grub pa na de blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ral gri grub pa'i dus su ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi sa bon gyis ral gri bskyed la nam zhig grub pa na de blang bar bya'o //
translated: And so forth. At the time of accomplishing the sword, one should generate the sword by means of one's own seed as before. When it is accomplished, one should take it.

original: de bzhin du 'khor lo la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor lo la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should see the accomplishments of the wheel and so forth.

original: da ni ji skad gsungs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas rmi lam la sogs par yang dag pa'i mtshan ma thob pa ni sngar gyi ri lu sgrub pa'i sa bon gyi khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni ji skad gsungs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas rmi lam la sogs par yang dag pa'i mtshan ma thob pa ni sngar gyi ri lu sgrub pa'i sa bon gyi khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the yogī/nī of Vairocana, etc. , as taught, who has attained the true signs even in dreams, etc. , is taught the special seed-syllable for the previously-mentioned pill practice:

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: Oṃ, etc.

original: tsa na ka yi 'bru tshod tsam //
analyzed: tsa na ka yi 'bru tshod tsam //

original: zhes bya ba ni ri lu thams cad kyi thun mong ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ri lu thams cad kyi thun mong ngo //

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'od 'dra ba //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'od 'dra ba //

original: zhes bya ba ni gsungs ma thag pa'i 'jam dpal la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsungs ma thag pa'i 'jam dpal la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: This is the form of Mañjuśrī, etc. , just taught.

original: 'di nyid nyi ma 'char ba la @220b sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid nyi ma 'char ba la @220b sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: This is taught by the rising sun, etc.

original: rdo rje sku ni 'dra ba'i 'od //
analyzed: rdo rje sku ni 'dra ba'i 'od //
translated: The light like the vajra body.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig la ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan dang ldan pa'i sku thob pa las rnam par snang mdzad bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig la ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan dang ldan pa'i sku thob pa las rnam par snang mdzad bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the words “having attained the body endowed with the marks of all the Tathāgatas” is “having attained the nature of Vairocana.”

original: de bzhin du gsung dang thugs rdo rje la sogs pa dag kyang ri lu'i sgrub pa las ji ltar rang gi sa bon la sogs pa'i khyad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung dang thugs rdo rje la sogs pa dag kyang ri lu'i sgrub pa las ji ltar rang gi sa bon la sogs pa'i khyad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should see the differences in the seed-syllable, etc. of the vajra body, speech, mind, etc. in the pill practice.

original: thugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir thams cad du ri lu dang po gser gyis dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: thugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir thams cad du ri lu dang po gser gyis dkri bar bya'o //
translated: Since the mind is primary, the first pill should be wrapped in gold everywhere.

original: de bzhin du ri lu'i sgrub pa brjod nas //
analyzed: de bzhin du ri lu'i sgrub pa brjod nas //
translated: Having thus described the pill practice,

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i sgrub pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i sgrub pa gsungs pa //
translated: he describes the practice of the wheel, etc.

original: mkha' dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mkha' dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the sky-realm, etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad rab tu bsgom //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad rab tu bsgom //

original: zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du sa bon dang mtshan ma'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du sa bon dang mtshan ma'i rim gyis so //
translated: This is according to the sequence of the seed-syllable and the sign.

original: lag tu 'khor lo rang bsgoms nas //
analyzed: lag tu 'khor lo rang bsgoms nas //
translated: Having meditated on the wheel in the hand,

original: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: sngar bsnyen par bya bas ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su lcags rnon po'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: sngar bsnyen par bya bas ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su lcags rnon po'i rang bzhin nam /

analyzed: gser dang dngul gyi 'khor lo byang chub kyi shing gi 'dab ma la gnas pa yi ge aom gyis 'bar ba dang bcas pa bskyed la //
translated: One should generate a golden or silver wheel, blazing with the syllable oṃ, located on the leaf of a Bodhi tree.

original: ri lu bzhin du de'i nang du song ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spro ba la sogs pa'i cho gas de srid bsgom pa dang bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: ri lu bzhin du de'i nang du song ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spro ba la sogs pa'i cho gas de srid bsgom pa dang bzlas par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on and repeat this [wheel] for as long as one wishes, with the rite of emanating and so forth the Tathāgatas who have entered into it like a lump of clay.

original: ji srid 'bar ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'bar ba'i bar du'o //
translated: [One should do this] until it blazes.

original: 'dir yang sngar gyi bzhin 'bar ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o /
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar gyi bzhin 'bar ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o /
translated: Here also, one should understand the three types of powers, such as blazing and so forth, as before.

original: de nas spyan gyi sngags bzlas shing blang ngo //
analyzed: de nas spyan gyi sngags bzlas shing blang ngo //
translated: Then, one should take it, repeating the eye mantra.

original: gang gi tshe shin tu steng du 'bar ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shin tu steng du 'bar ba de'i tshe /
translated: When it blazes extremely high,

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho gas mnan te bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho gas mnan te bzlog par bya'o //
translated: one should suppress it with the rite of the earth mandala and reverse [the wheel].

analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge h'um gis lcags gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje'o //
translated: In the same way, with the syllable hūṃ, [one should generate] a vajra with the nature of the three metals.

analyzed: yi ge sv'as margad dam gser gyi rang bzhin du rin po che'o //
translated: With the syllable svā, [one should generate] a jewel with the nature of an emerald or gold.

analyzed: yi ge a'a: sa dkar po'am dmar po'i tsan dan gyi rang bzhin nam /

analyzed: padma r'a ga'i rin po che'i rang bzhin nam /

analyzed: zangs kyi rang bzhin padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma'o //

analyzed: yi ge has lcags rnon po'i rang bzhin nam lcags gzhan gyi rang bzhin la ral gri rdzogs par bya ste /

original: sngar gyi bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: as before, one should meditate on it.

original: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma mthong nas //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma mthong nas //
translated: Having seen the sign of spiritual power,

original: rang rang gi rig ma'i sngags kyis blang bar bya'o //🔽rin po che yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs @221a * //
analyzed: rang rang gi rig ma'i sngags kyis blang bar bya'o // rin po che yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs @221a * //
translated: one should take it with the mantra of one's knowledge consort.

analyzed: kyi yum nyid kyi phyir m'a ma k'i'i sngags kyis blang bar bya'o //
translated: Also, the jewel is taken with the mantra of Māmakī, because she is the mother of the family of all the Tathāgatas.

original: yang na nam mkha' rdo rje ma'i sngags kyis blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na nam mkha' rdo rje ma'i sngags kyis blang bar bya ste /
translated: Or it is taken with the mantra of Ākāśa-vajriṇī.

analyzed: aom k'a ma badzri ni siddh'a s'i bi shuddha s'i sv'a bh'a ba ga gan autbh'a ba yo ge na siddha mam pa ra maksha re /

analyzed: ta bya th'a ga ga na autbh'a be ga ga na bi shuddhe /
translated: tadyathā: tha tha gagana utbhāva gagana viśudde

analyzed: sarba aa bhi pra ya pa ri p'u ra ni sv'a h'a /
translated: sarvābhipraya paripūraṇa svāhā.

original: zhes bya'o // yang na rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i lag pa g-yas par bzhag la rang gi sngags las byung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs rang gi rigs nang du zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba bsgom par bya ste /

translated: Or, having placed it in one's right hand, which is located in one's maṇḍala, one should meditate on the wheel, etc. , arisen from one's mantra, which has entered into one's family, preceded by the rite.

original: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma ma byung gi bar du'o //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma ma byung gi bar du'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma gzhan gyi yang bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: rtse gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sbyor bas bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ye shes kyi kyo ba'o //

analyzed: 'di nyid rtse gsum la sogs pa rnams kyi yang khyad par ro //

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni zhags pa la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
translated: The word 'etc.' includes the noose, etc.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:🔽 🔽The noose, etc. , are for the accomplishment of the vajra speech, etc.

original: rdo rje khyad par gyis bsgrub na //
analyzed: rdo rje khyad par gyis bsgrub na //
translated: If one accomplishes with the vajra,

original: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: it is said that

translated: having previously performed the yoga of one's desired deity by the rite taught for the accomplishment of the vajra and so forth, one will become a knowledge-holder of the triple-pronged vajra and so forth by the accomplishment of the triple-pronged vajra and so forth.

translated: Alternatively, it is said that in order to complete the activities of subjugation and protection, one should accomplish the triple-pronged vajra and so forth by the yoga of Maheśvara and so forth, by the rite taught for the triple-pronged vajra and so forth.

analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dgug pa'i don du rdo rje kyo ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa gsungs pa ;

analyzed: lam gyi bzhi mdo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: rdo rje dgug pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje kyo ba'o //

original: sbyor gsum sngags kyis skyes bur bsam //
analyzed: sbyor gsum sngags kyis skyes bur bsam //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gsum dang bcas pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i sbyor ba byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: sbyor gsum rdo rje can rnams kyi ;

analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi sangs rgyas rnams //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pas byin gyis brlab pa'o //

analyzed: kha cig ni @221b yi ge gsum gyis rdzogs pa'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some maintain that one should complete with the three syllables.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor mchog gnas pa //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor mchog gnas pa //
translated: The supreme wind mandala is located,

original: zhes bya ba la 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: means the following.

analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sbyor bas mtshan ma thob pas rdo rje ba kug pa sgrub pa'i don du yang /

analyzed: lam gyi bzhi mdo la sogs par ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su brtags nas /

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms pa'i de ma thag tu ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i zla ba la yi ge h'um gis rdo rje kyo ba bskyed nas de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po lta bu rtsa ba'i phyag gis rdo rje lcags kyu
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms pa'i de ma thag tu ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i zla ba la yi ge h'um gis rdo rje kyo ba bskyed nas de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po lta bu rtsa ba'i phyag gis rdo rje lcags kyu
translated: immediately after cultivating the three meditative stabilizations, having generated the vajra hook from the syllable hūṃ on the moon in the heart of the gnosis being, having transformed that, one should complete the form of the great vajra-holder, with the principal pair of hands holding a vajra hook and a noose,

original: 'dzin pa sku rdo rje la sogs pas byin gyis brlab pa dang ; mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i cod pan can khro bo'i nyams dang bcas pa de nyid du rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa sku rdo rje la sogs pas byin gyis brlab pa dang ; mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i cod pan can khro bo'i nyams dang bcas pa de nyid du rdzogs par byas te /
translated: blessed by the vajra body, etc., with the purity of the eyes, etc., with the crown of the vajra-holder, and with the expression of wrath.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du gdon pa byas nas mdun du rlung dang zla ba'i gdan la gnas nas bka' nod cing spro ba la sogs pa ji srid du sgom par byed pa /🔽mngon sum du dmigs par 'gyur ba de srid du'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du gdon pa byas nas mdun du rlung dang zla ba'i gdan la gnas nas bka' nod cing spro ba la sogs pa ji srid du sgom par byed pa /🔽mngon sum du dmigs par 'gyur ba de srid du'o //
translated: Having recited the mantra just as it is, one should meditate on the hook-vajra standing on a wind and moon seat in front, receiving the command, and so on, until it is visualized directly.

original: 'di nyid kyis thams cad du sangs rgyas dgug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis thams cad du sangs rgyas dgug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: By this alone, one should summon all the Buddhas.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas dgug pa'i mchog ces so //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas dgug pa'i mchog ces so //
translated: This is the supreme summoning of the Buddhas.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: In the ten directions, etc.

original: phyogs bcu'i dam tshig rdo rje 'dzin pa las spros pa'i rnam pa yang dag par byung ba rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i dam tshig rdo rje 'dzin pa las spros pa'i rnam pa yang dag par byung ba rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams so //
translated: The forms of Vairochana, etc., are the emanations that arise from the pledge-holders of the ten directions.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lcags kyu yin la bkug nas ni bskul nas te /
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lcags kyu yin la bkug nas ni bskul nas te /
translated: The vajra is the vajra hook. Having summoned, having incited,

original: byon par byas nas nye bar spyod //
analyzed: byon par byas nas nye bar spyod //
translated: having caused to come, one should enjoy.

original: ces bya ba ni dngos grub ster ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dngos grub ster ba la sogs pas so //
translated: This is the attainment, etc.

original: la la dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i lha'i bu mo rnams kyang 'dis dgug par bya'o zhes pa'i don /
analyzed: la la dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i lha'i bu mo rnams kyang 'dis dgug par bya'o zhes pa'i don /
translated: Some think that the meaning is that one should summon the celestial maidens, as one wishes.

original: 'dir phyogs bcu la sogs pa'i gzhung dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir phyogs bcu la sogs pa'i gzhung dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the text of the ten directions, etc., is applied.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dam tshig rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dam tshig rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //

original: de'i dgug pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de'i dgug pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The so-called “summoning of him” is the remainder.

original: ji lta bu zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is it like? He says:

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa dang // rdo rje padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa dang // rdo rje padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Vairochana, etc. , and Vajra Padman, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rin po che la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rin po che la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes Ratnasambhava, etc.

original: dam tshig dgug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /🔽rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin @222a * //
analyzed: dam tshig dgug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di skad gsungs pa yin te / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin @222a * //
translated: The so-called “summoning of the pledge” is what is said.🔽The wheel hook, etc. , of the Vairochana, etc.

original: gyis sgrub pa'i 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa yang dgug par ro //
analyzed: gyis sgrub pa'i 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa yang dgug par ro //
translated: absorptions summon even the Vajra Holder.

original: sbyor ba gzhan bshad pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan bshad pa /
translated: The other application is explained.

original: sngon du song ba rdo rje kyo ba'i sgrub pa gsal bar bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngon du song ba rdo rje kyo ba'i sgrub pa gsal bar bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: The one who has gone before, the Vajra Hook, is clarified by saying:

original: rnam kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “In every way” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas sku zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku'o //
translated: The “Buddha body” is the body of the Vajra Holder.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin par bshad //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin par bshad //
translated: The Buddha is explained as the Vajra Holder.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig las so //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig las so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: lag tu zhes bya ba ni lag pa g-yas pa'o //
analyzed: lag tu zhes bya ba ni lag pa g-yas pa'o //
translated: “In the hand” means in the right hand.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig gi sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig gi sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
translated: “Body, speech, and mind” indicates that one should not only employ the practice of Vajradhara,

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyor ba yang bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyor ba yang bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: but also the practice of Vairochana.

original: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.🔽One who has attained the signs, by means of the samadhi of Vajradhara, etc.,

original: mtshan ma thob pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i lag pa g-yas par dngos su lcags rnon po las brdungs pa'i lcags kyu 'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i lag pa g-yas par dngos su lcags rnon po las brdungs pa'i lcags kyu 'am /
translated: should visualize in one’s right hand an actual iron hook forged from sharp iron,

original: bsgoms pas yi ge h'um la sogs pa'i sa bon gyis rdzogs nas spro ba la sogs pa de srid du bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pas yi ge h'um la sogs pa'i sa bon gyis rdzogs nas spro ba la sogs pa de srid du bsgom par bya ste /
translated: or one that is perfected by the seed syllable hūṃ, etc., and then meditate on the emission, etc., until the signs are seen in actuality.

original: ji srid mtshan ma mngon sum du 'bar bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ji srid mtshan ma mngon sum du 'bar bar mthong ba'o //
translated: This is done until the signs are seen in actuality, blazing forth.

original: des gang 'dod pa ste 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: des gang 'dod pa ste 'gugs par byed do //
translated: By that, one attracts whomever one wishes.

original: gang gsungs pa le'u bcu gcig par /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa le'u bcu gcig par /
translated: As it is said in the eleventh chapter:

original: nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas par //
analyzed: nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas par //
translated: In the middle of the sky realm,

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dam pa bsam //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dam pa bsam //
translated: The sacred maṇḍala of the Buddha is imagined.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug rab bsgoms te //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug rab bsgoms te //
translated: The Lord of the World is well meditated upon,

original: chos kyi aom ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: chos kyi aom ni bsgom par bya //
translated: and the dharma-oṃ is meditated upon.

original: zhes pa de ni ngag gi dngos grub la sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa de ni ngag gi dngos grub la sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: This is said to be the application to the power of speech.

original: 'di dag lta bu'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: 'di dag lta bu'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By means of these applications,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This, it is said, is what is to be explained.

original: tshig las byed pa zhes bya ba ni ngag tsam nyid kyis de thams cad dgug pa la sogs pa'i las byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig las byed pa zhes bya ba ni ngag tsam nyid kyis de thams cad dgug pa la sogs pa'i las byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The activity of speech is the activity of summoning and so on of all that by mere speech.

original: cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The rite is taught:

original: kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: All, and so on.

original: rdo rje sku zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i sku rdo rjer bdag nyid bsams nas /
analyzed: rdo rje sku zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i sku rdo rjer bdag nyid bsams nas /
translated: The vajra body is the vajra body of one’s deity, imagined as oneself.

original: rdo rje'i sbyor bas lce bsgoms nas //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sbyor bas lce bsgoms nas //
translated: Having meditated on the vajra tongue,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: rdo rje lce ni 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: rdo rje lce ni 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
translated: The vajra tongue is the Lord of the World.

original: de sgom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de sgom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one meditates on that.

original: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor du rang gi lha'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du lce 'jig rten dbang phyug tu bskyed pa de'i snying gar yi ge aom 'od zer lnga'i tshogs 'phro ba la
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor du rang gi lha'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du lce 'jig rten dbang phyug tu bskyed pa de'i snying gar yi ge aom 'od zer lnga'i tshogs 'phro ba la
translated: The yogi/nī who has attained the signs, endowed with the yoga of the three meditative stabilizations of one’s deity, just as before, generates the tongue as Lokeśvara, and at his heart is the syllable oṃ radiating a mass of five-colored light rays.

original: @222b sogs pa'i rim gyis de srid du bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: @222b sogs pa'i rim gyis de srid du bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on that until the signs of smoke and so forth arise.

original: ji srid du 'od zer gyi snang ba la sogs pas rtags thob par 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: ji srid du 'od zer gyi snang ba la sogs pas rtags thob par 'gyur bar ro //
translated: As long as the signs of smoke and so forth arise due to the appearance of the light rays and so forth, one should meditate on that.

original: de'i phyir / rdo rje gsung dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rdo rje gsung dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, “one becomes like vajra speech.”

original: zhes bya ba ni ngag nyid rdo rje ste gsungs pa'i don la mi slu bas mi phyed pas gang rnams kyis de bzhin du brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngag nyid rdo rje ste gsungs pa'i don la mi slu bas mi phyed pas gang rnams kyis de bzhin du brjod pa ste /
translated: Speech itself is a vajra, because it is indestructible, since it is undeceiving with respect to the meaning of the statement.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang mnyam par 'gyur ro zhes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang mnyam par 'gyur ro zhes te /
translated: One becomes equal to the Bhagavān Buddhas,🔽who are endowed with vajra speech.

original: thogs pa med pa'i dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i dag tu 'gyur //
translated: One becomes unobstructed.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: kha cig ni gzhung 'di rig ma rjes su chags pa dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhung 'di rig ma rjes su chags pa dang sbyor ro //
translated: Some apply this text to the practice of the consort of awareness.

original: gsang ba dang cig shos kyis mchod pa sngon du song bas dngos grub thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsang ba dang cig shos kyis mchod pa sngon du song bas dngos grub thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Having first made offerings with the secret and the other, one should accomplish all powers.

original: gsang ba gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gsang ba gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The three secrets and so forth are stated.

original: gsang ba gsum dam tshig ni rang gi lha mo de nyid do //
analyzed: gsang ba gsum dam tshig ni rang gi lha mo de nyid do //
translated: The three secrets are the pledge of that very goddess.

original: mchod pa'i gtso bo byed pa nyid kyis mchod pa'i mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod pa'i gtso bo byed pa nyid kyis mchod pa'i mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme offering is the chief offering by means of the nature of the supreme offering.

original: byed pa'i gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa'i gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The second is the meaning of the second.

original: mchod pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su chags par byed pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mchod pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su chags par byed pa'i ngo bo'o //

original: mchod nas zhes bya ba ni 'di byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchod nas zhes bya ba ni 'di byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having offered is the meaning of having done this.

original: rab tu bsgrub ces bya ba ni dngos grub kyi tshogs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu bsgrub ces bya ba ni dngos grub kyi tshogs su shes par bya ste /
translated: One should accomplish is to be understood as the collection of powers.

original: de'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the occasion for that.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ston par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ston par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is stated.

original: dngos grub thams cad ces bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ces bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams kyi'o //
translated: All powers means the powers of Body-Vajra, etc.

analyzed: dngos grub sna tshogs bsgrub pa la dbang ba rnams kyi phyogs gcig tu gsungs pa nyid kyis gsang ba rnams kyi dam tshig bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: The pledges of the secret ones are the ones that are taught as one part of the powers of the various powers.

original: de nyid dngos grub kyi bye brag gi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid dngos grub kyi bye brag gi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: He teaches the application of the various powers:

original: sha chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //🔽'di dag kyang sems can rnams bsad pa ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sha chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o // 'di dag kyang sems can rnams bsad pa ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The great flesh and so on are easy to understand.

analyzed: snying rje rtsa ba nyid las rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should see that these are not the killing of sentient beings, because compassion is the root of enlightenment.

original: 'di yang rdo rje bdud rtsi las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di yang rdo rje bdud rtsi las gsungs pa /
translated: This is also taught in the Vajra-Amṛta:

original: btsan thabs kyis gsad nags nas rnyed //
analyzed: btsan thabs kyis gsad nags nas rnyed //
translated: One should kill by force, and find in the forest,

original: sha chen yang dag zas su za //
analyzed: sha chen yang dag zas su za //
translated: and eat the great flesh as the right food.🔽One should eat the food of the deep and firm,

original: mdung la btsugs dang dpyangs pa dang // g-yul dang rgyal pos bsad pa dag / zab cing brtan pas zas zos nas //
analyzed: mdung la btsugs dang dpyangs pa dang // g-yul dang rgyal pos bsad pa dag / zab cing brtan pas zas zos nas //

original: nad med tshe ni 'phel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nad med tshe ni 'phel bar 'gyur //
translated: and the life of one without disease increases.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽yang na gnyis su med pa'i rnal @223a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // yang na gnyis su med pa'i rnal @223a * //
translated: and so forth.

analyzed: 'byor bsgom pa nyid dam tshig thams cad bsgrub pa ste /

analyzed: gang yang dpal bde ba dam pa rtogs pa las /

analyzed: khrag dang khu ba de bzhin sha //

translated: the great kindness, and the urine,

analyzed: gang zhig gsang ba bdag gis bshad //
translated: which I, the secret one, have explained,

original: dam tshig ces bya 'bad pa yis //
analyzed: dam tshig ces bya 'bad pa yis //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de thams cad //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de thams cad //

original: mi gsal ba yi tha snyad la //

original: dam tshig ces ni gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: dam tshig ces ni gsungs pa yang //

original: sems can la phan 'jug pas so //
analyzed: sems can la phan 'jug pas so //

analyzed: khrag ces pa ni zos par 'gyur //

analyzed: gang zhig chos rnams ma skyes pa //

analyzed: khu ba yi ni sgra yis brjod //

analyzed: gang zhig dngos po mnyam pa yang //

analyzed: mi dmigs pa yi sbyor ba yi //

analyzed: gang tshe shin tu sbyangs pa'i sems //

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i de ma thag tu'o //

analyzed: de nyid sbyor ba ste thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid rang gi lha'i gzugs so //

analyzed: byang chub mchog ni bsgom par bya //

analyzed: nye bar bsgrub pa'i yan lag gsungs pa /

translated: The analysis of those is that the six beginning with the eye are by the forms of Kṣitigarbha, and so on; the six beginning with the form vajra are by the form vajra, and so on; the seed syllables, and so on, are by the natures of Locanā, and so on;

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis gzugs la @224b sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams la nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis gzugs la @224b sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams la nges par byed pa'o //

original: bsgrub pa'i yan lag gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i yan lag gsungs pa /
translated: The branch of the means of achievement is stated:

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “The means of achievement,” and so on.

analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du 'od zer rnams dang / tshigs bcad kyis thugs rdo rje la sogs pa bskul ba'o //
translated: The invocation of Cittavajra, and so on, is by the light rays and verses, just as before.

original: sngags kyi bdag po bsgoms pa yis //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag po bsgoms pa yis //
translated: “The meditation on the lord of the mantra”

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i dam tshig sems dpa'i gzugs rnams rdzogs pa'o //
translated: is the completion of the forms of the pledge beings, Cittavajra, and so on, just as before.

original: sgrub pa chen po'i yan lag gsungs pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po'i yan lag gsungs pa /
translated: The branch of the great means of achievement is stated:

original: sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The great accomplishment and so forth.

original: sgrub pa chen po'i dus su ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po'i dus su ni /
translated: At the time of the great accomplishment,

original: rang sngags rdo rje can ni rang gi lha rnams so //
analyzed: rang sngags rdo rje can ni rang gi lha rnams so //
translated: one's own mantras and vajras are one's own deities.

original: bdag po ni gzugs te /
analyzed: bdag po ni gzugs te /
