analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyis cod pan du bsgoms nas so //
translated: having meditated on the crown with the form of the great seal.

original: ye shes rdo rje can 'grub 'gyur //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje can 'grub 'gyur //
translated: The one with the wisdom vajra is accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means endowed with the wisdom of method and wisdom.🔽The nectar of the knowledge of the approach

original: bsnyen pa'i ye shes bdud rtsi dag / ces bya ba ni skad cig la rab tu sgrub pa thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid lha'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i ye shes bdud rtsi dag / ces bya ba ni skad cig la rab tu sgrub pa thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid lha'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the union of the deity with the nature of method and wisdom, accomplished in an instant.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad las so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad las so //
translated: All means from all.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni thun mtshams kyi nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni thun mtshams kyi nges pa med pa'o //
translated: Always means without the restriction of a session.

original: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sbyor bas thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes rdzogs pa g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i bdag nyid du bdag nyid nges pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rim pas sbyor bas sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsnyen pa la sogs
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sbyor bas thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes rdzogs pa g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i bdag nyid du bdag nyid nges pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rim pas sbyor bas sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsnyen pa la sogs
translated: By the yoga of the stage of completion just as it is, the gnosis of method and wisdom is complete, and by the yoga of the stage of uninterruptedness, one meditates on the complete approach and so forth, by ascertaining oneself as the nature of the moving and unmoving.🔽🔽

original: pa'i yan lag bzhi bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i yan lag bzhi bya'o //
translated: By the process of the perfection stage, just as it is, one should perform the four branches of approach and close approach, which are the complete meditation of the gnosis of method and wisdom, the nature of the moving and unmoving, by the process of the uninterrupted union.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
translated: The generation stage is stated:

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang po'i yan lag zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi byang chub po //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang po'i yan lag zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi byang chub po //
translated: Or else, the first branch is the enlightenment of emptiness by the form of the melted moon.

original: gnyis pa lha mo'i glus bskul ba sngon du song ba rang gi lha'i sa bon dang phyag mtshan gyi gzugs su zhu ba bsdus pa'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa lha mo'i glus bskul ba sngon du song ba rang gi lha'i sa bon dang phyag mtshan gyi gzugs su zhu ba bsdus pa'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The second is the nature of the gathered assembly, the melting into the form of the seed and insignia of one's deity, preceded by the urging song of the goddesses.

original: gsum pa phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyis gzugs rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyis gzugs rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The third is the complete form by the form of the great seal.

original: bzhi pa chos kyi dbyings su mos pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa chos kyi dbyings su mos pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the conviction of the dharmadhatu.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje bzhi'i lha rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje bzhi'i lha rdzogs pa'o //
translated: By this, the deity of the four vajras is complete.

original: yang na sngon du bsnyen pa byas te /
analyzed: yang na sngon du bsnyen pa byas te /
translated: Or else, having performed the prior approximation,

original: brtul zhugs brtan pa zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i rig pa'i brtul zhugs la gnas pas so //🔽sku gsum dam tshig de nyid kyis //
analyzed: brtul zhugs brtan pa zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i rig pa'i brtul zhugs la gnas pas so // sku gsum dam tshig de nyid kyis //
translated: “firm in the observances” means abiding in the indivisible awareness observance.🔽“By means of the reality pledge of the three bodies”

original: zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi dam tshig rnams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi dam tshig rnams te /
translated: means the pledges of the three bodies.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa de rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa de rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: They are the consecrations by those, Body Vajra and so forth.

original: @225a * // dus bzhi dag tu rab sbyor bas //
analyzed: @225a * // dus bzhi dag tu rab sbyor bas //
translated: “In the four times, applying well”

original: zhes bya ba ni thun bzhi'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thun bzhi'i rim gyis so //
translated: means by the process of the four periods.

original: gnas lngar zhes bya ba ni rigs lnga tshogs pa nyid shes rab tu brjod do //
analyzed: gnas lngar zhes bya ba ni rigs lnga tshogs pa nyid shes rab tu brjod do //
translated: “In the five places” means the five families, which are called the “assemblies. ”

original: ye shes rdo rje yi ge aom //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje yi ge aom //
translated: “The syllable OṀ of the vajra of pristine

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje nor bu'i cha aom gyi yi ges bskyed nas shes rab kyi gnas skabs su bsgom pa'i don du dran par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje nor bu'i cha aom gyi yi ges bskyed nas shes rab kyi gnas skabs su bsgom pa'i don du dran par bya'o zhes so //
translated: awareness” means that having generated the syllable OṀ in the part of the vajra gem, one should remember it for the purpose of meditation in the state of the wisdom consort.🔽Some apply the passage

original: la la dag / de nas rdo rje bzhi dag gis //
analyzed: la la dag / de nas rdo rje bzhi dag gis //
translated: “Then, by means of the four vajras”

original: zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni dkyil 'khor gyi don rdzogs pa la sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni dkyil 'khor gyi don rdzogs pa la sbyar ro //
translated: to the completion of the meaning of the mandala.

original: zhag bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngon du bsnyen pa byas pa la sogs pa gang gi tshe sgrub pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: zhag bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngon du bsnyen pa byas pa la sogs pa gang gi tshe sgrub pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Seven days and so on. When one who has done the preliminary service and so on enters into the means of accomplishment,

original: zhugs pas ma grub na yang sgrub pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhugs pas ma grub na yang sgrub pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur te /
translated: and having entered, is not successful, he should strive for the means of accomplishment.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byin gyis brlab pa'i don du ji lta bar bskul bar ston to //
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byin gyis brlab pa'i don du ji lta bar bskul bar ston to //
translated: At that time, the Tathagatas exhort him in order to bless him.

original: de nyid kyi dgongs pa gsungs pa /🔽de la 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsgrub par bya ba ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dgongs pa gsungs pa / de la 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsgrub par bya ba ni //
translated: He declares the intention of that:🔽Therein, this and so on. The means of accomplishment is the accomplishment of the nature of Body-Vajra.

original: sku rdo rje nyid 'dis bsgrubs pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'di nyid byin gyis brlabs pas de nyid mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu nyid kyis nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje nyid 'dis bsgrubs pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'di nyid byin gyis brlabs pas de nyid mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu nyid kyis nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar sgrub pa'o //
translated: By blessing this Body-Vajra, etc., it becomes proximate because it is the cause of manifest enlightenment.

original: sku'i nyes pa thams cad sdom pa nyid kyi phyir na sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i nyes pa thams cad sdom pa nyid kyi phyir na sdom pa'o //
translated: It is a vow because it is the restraint of all the faults of the body.

original: de'i yul ni gsol ba btab pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul ni gsol ba btab pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: The object of that is the actualization of the Body-Vajra, etc., by the supplication.

original: de nyid gsungs pa sangs rgyas sku 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid de'i sku de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin par byed pas na sku rdo rje 'dzin pa ste de sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa sangs rgyas sku 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid de'i sku de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin par byed pas na sku rdo rje 'dzin pa ste de sku rdo rje'o //
translated: The one who is called the “Holder of the Vajra Body of the Buddhas” is the Holder of the Vajra Body, because he holds the body of that nature, the nature of indivisible intuition.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi phun sum tshogs pa'i sbyor ba las dpal ldan no //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi phun sum tshogs pa'i sbyor ba las dpal ldan no //
translated: He is glorious because of his endowment with the perfection of merit and intuition.

original: rdo rje gsum rnams ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum rnams ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The three vajras are the vajra body, etc.

original: mi phyed pa ni gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The indivisible is the reality of nonduality.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bdag nyid ni bdag gi rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bdag nyid ni bdag gi rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
translated: The one who has arisen by the nature of that is the one who has the yoga of the self.

original: sgom pas zhes bya ba'i tshig la ni rdzogs pa'i sku'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgom pas zhes bya ba'i tshig la ni rdzogs pa'i sku'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The one who meditates is the one who is the Holder of the Vajra Body of the perfect Buddha.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni sku rdo rje nyid la sogs rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni sku rdo rje nyid la sogs rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The consecration is the perfection of the vajra body, etc.

original: deng zhes bya ba ni da lta ste /
analyzed: deng zhes bya ba ni da lta ste /
translated: Now is the present time.

original: rdo rje sku zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rjes te byin gyis brlab pa'i don du gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sku zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rjes te byin gyis brlab pa'i don du gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: The “vajra body” is the body vajra, for the sake of consecration.

original: de ltar bye brag tu gsol ba btab nas /
analyzed: de ltar bye brag tu gsol ba btab nas /
translated: Having thus made a specific request,

original: spyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlab par gsol @225b ba gdab pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: spyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlab par gsol @225b ba gdab pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: in order to make a general request for consecration by all the buddhas, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: phyogs bcu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: “In the ten directions” and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du bskul ba las nges par byin gyis rlob par go bar byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du bskul ba las nges par byin gyis rlob par go bar byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, in order to make it understood that [the buddhas] will definitely consecrate [you] when you exhort them, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: phyogs bcu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i zhes bya ba ni sngags pa'i'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i zhes bya ba ni sngags pa'i'o //
translated: “In the ten directions” and so on. “ There” means “of the mantrin.”

original: sku yis mtshan pas zhes bya ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa nyid kyi phyir mdzes par snang ba'o //
analyzed: sku yis mtshan pas zhes bya ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa nyid kyi phyir mdzes par snang ba'o //
translated: “ Adorned with the body marks” means that [the buddhas] appear beautiful because they are adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: ngag rdo rje byin gyis brlab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yang de'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya ste bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngag rdo rje byin gyis brlab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yang de'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya ste bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: The verse on the consecration of vajra speech should be understood in the same way, but it is not taught [here].

original: de bzhin byas nas nges par byin gyis brlab pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin byas nas nges par byin gyis brlab pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having done it that way, he teaches the consecration:

original: sangs rgyas sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshal bar 'gas pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis su bsgrub pa las nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshal bar 'gas pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis su bsgrub pa las nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one says Buddha and so on, one's head will split means one will fall from the accomplishment of the two.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la sogs pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la sogs pa rnams yin la /
translated: The vajra of all the Tathagatas is the Great Vajradhara and so on.

original: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi gzugs rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi gzugs rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Their union is the form of the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de yang mi 'da' ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: de yang mi 'da' ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i mchog go //
translated: That is the supreme accomplishment, because it is the cause of not passing beyond.

original: yi ge aom la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams de rnams kyi nges par bstan pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: yi ge aom la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams de rnams kyi nges par bstan pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The seed syllables of the letters Om and so on are taught to be them.

original: de yang le'u 'di'o //
analyzed: de yang le'u 'di'o //
translated: That is this chapter.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dka' 'grel rgyal bas byin pas mdzad pa las le'u bcu gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dka' 'grel rgyal bas byin pas mdzad pa las le'u bcu gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the twelfth chapter in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra called “The Vajra of All the Tathagatas.”

original: // / de ltar chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi'i rim gyis bskyed pa'i lha la sogs pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i bzlas pa dang / rang gi lha'i bsgrub pa dang / las kyi tshogs rjes su bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de ltar chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi'i rim gyis bskyed pa'i lha la sogs pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i bzlas pa dang / rang gi lha'i bsgrub pa dang / las kyi tshogs rjes su bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by the sequence of the four branches of the near attainment and so on, which are lesser, middling, and greater, one should perform the repetition of Vajra Body and so on, the practice of one's deity, and the performance of the mass of rites, by means of the yogas of the deities and so on that are generated.

original: de nas rdo rje bkod pa'i dam tshig de kho na nyid kyi don du sgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje bkod pa'i dam tshig de kho na nyid kyi don du sgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u gsungs pa /
translated: Then, the chapter on the concentration of meditation on the reality of the pledge of the Vajra Array is stated, beginning with THEREAFTER.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thereupon, the Blessed One, the Tathagata Vajrapani,

original: ye shes rdo rje mchog 'dzin pa //🔽zhes bya ba la ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa ste /🔽de nyid mi phyed pa dang 'byed par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje mchog 'dzin pa // zhes bya ba la ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa ste / de nyid mi phyed pa dang 'byed par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
translated: the supreme holder of the vajra of wisdom,

original: nyan thos la sogs thams cad kyi ye shes las gtso bo nyid kyi phyir mchog go //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs thams cad kyi ye shes las gtso bo nyid kyi phyir mchog go //
translated: entered the samadhi called Vajra of the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas.🔽As soon as he had entered that samadhi, there came forth from the heart of the Blessed One, the Tathagata Vajrapani,

original: de 'dzin par byed pa ni ye shes ni rdo rje mchog 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa ni ye shes ni rdo rje mchog 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: The one who holds that is the one who holds the supreme vajra intuition,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //🔽sems can kun don ni thabs dang shes rab kyi @226a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so // sems can kun don ni thabs dang shes rab kyi @226a * //
translated: the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: ye shes rdzogs pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes rdzogs pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The meaning of all beings is the intuition arisen from the perfection of means and insight.

original: sems can kun gyi longs spyod mchog / ces bya ba'i tshig la ni sems can kun te byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi longs spyod mchog / ces bya ba'i tshig la ni sems can kun te byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The phrase “the supreme enjoyment of all beings” means that all beings are the bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyi dngos la sogs pa la longs spyod cing nye bar spyod pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dngos la sogs pa la longs spyod cing nye bar spyod pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: They enjoy and experience the things of those bodhisattvas, and so on.

original: 'dis rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi don grub pa phun sum tshogs par gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi don grub pa phun sum tshogs par gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is said to be the perfection of the accomplishment of one’s own and others’ aims.

original: de 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: And not only that,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pas so //
translated: but also together with the bodhisattvas.

original: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni rab tu rtog pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni rab tu rtog pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The “wise” are those skilled in discernment.

original: ston pa chen po zhes bya ba ni yong ba dang med pa las 'das pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa'i phyir ser skya la sogs pa'i ston pa thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir ston pa chen po ste yang
analyzed: ston pa chen po zhes bya ba ni yong ba dang med pa las 'das pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa'i phyir ser skya la sogs pa'i ston pa thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir ston pa chen po ste yang
translated: The great teacher is so called because he is the best of all teachers, such as Kapila, because he teaches dependent origination just as it is, the meaning that transcends existence and nonexistence.

original: dag par mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: dag par mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: He is to be worshipped properly.

original: sku la sogs pa thub pa'i phyir thub pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa thub pa'i phyir thub pa'o //
translated: He is a sage because he is restrained in body and so forth.

original: don kun zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: don kun zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams yin la /
translated: All objects means the aggregates and so forth.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang de'i bdag nyid gang la yod pa de ni don kun rdo rje can no //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang de'i bdag nyid gang la yod pa de ni don kun rdo rje can no //
translated: He who has the nature of that vajra, the nature of the Tathagatas and so forth, and whose nature is that, is the one who has all objects as his vajra.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi phyir dam tshig ni de kho na nyid kyi mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi phyir dam tshig ni de kho na nyid kyi mkhyen pa'o //
translated: His pledge is the knowledge of reality, because he has the wisdom of the dharmadhatu, which is without beginning or end.

original: rdo rje dbyangs ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i tshig gsungs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyangs ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i tshig gsungs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Vajra melody is the possession of the speech that elucidates the meaning of vajra repetition.

original: de ji ltar yin zhe na /🔽ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ji ltar yin zhe na / ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: How is that?🔽He declares, “Amazing!

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Amazing!

original: sangs rgyas ni 'dir sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni 'dir sku rdo rje'o //
translated: Here, Buddha is the vajra body.

original: de'i tshul ni bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam mo ;
analyzed: de'i tshul ni bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam mo ;
translated: His method is the path having the character of repetition.

original: / don dam par bzlas pa la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir tha snyad kyis rab tu shes par byas pas bzang pa'o //
analyzed: / don dam par bzlas pa la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir tha snyad kyis rab tu shes par byas pas bzang pa'o //
translated: It is good because it is understood conventionally, since ultimately the repetitions, etc., are not perceived.

original: la la ngag mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtho ris su 'byung pa'i phyir bzang po'o zhes 'dod do //🔽byang chub ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: la la ngag mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtho ris su 'byung pa'i phyir bzang po'o zhes 'dod do // byang chub ces bya ba ni /
translated: Some assert that it is good because it is the arising of the heaven of non-abiding nirvana.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ngag rdo rje nyid do //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ngag rdo rje nyid do //
translated: Enlightenment is the nature of speech vajra, because it has the character of discerning wisdom.

original: de'i tshul gyi mchog ces bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du brtson 'grus brtsams pas skye ba 'di la rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshul gyi mchog ces bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du brtson 'grus brtsams pas skye ba 'di la rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The method of that supreme is the perfection of the wisdom hero in this life by the practice of the correct striving.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir //
translated: The Dharma is the nature of all things.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi @226b ye shes sems dpa' ste de'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi @226b ye shes sems dpa' ste de'i tshul lo //
translated: The wisdom hero is the nature of the wisdom of suchness. That is the method.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa thams cad kyi nye bar 'tshe ba dang bral bas so //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa thams cad kyi nye bar 'tshe ba dang bral bas so //
translated: Peace is the freedom from the harm of all non-apprehension.

original: gcig tu 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par ltung bar byed pa nyid las yid skyob par byed pa'i phyir sngags ni thugs rdo rje ste de'i tshul lo //
analyzed: gcig tu 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par ltung bar byed pa nyid las yid skyob par byed pa'i phyir sngags ni thugs rdo rje ste de'i tshul lo //
translated: The mantra is the mind vajra, which protects the mind from the one that causes the fall into only samsara and nirvana. That is the method.

original: brtan zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thams cad kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thams cad kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Firm is the mind that is not divided by any conception.

original: ci'i phyir ngo mtshar ba yin zhe na ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin las 'das pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par can yang yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ngo mtshar ba yin zhe na ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin las 'das pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par can yang yin no //
translated: Why is it amazing? It is called “unborn,” etc. It is also a special nature because it transcends the nature of all things characterized by suchness.

original: yang dag pa zhes pa la de ltar chos thams cad la ye shes nyid sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'byung bar bshad ces bya bar rab tu bstan ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes pa la de ltar chos thams cad la ye shes nyid sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'byung bar bshad ces bya bar rab tu bstan ba'o //
translated: “Real” means that thusness is taught to be the nature of all phenomena, and that gnosis itself arises in the form of Vajra Body, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i ngo bo nyid lha thams cad kyi thun mong pa nyid kyis mdor byas pa lta bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i ngo bo nyid lha thams cad kyi thun mong pa nyid kyis mdor byas pa lta bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that its nature is like a summary common to all deities,

original: sngags rnams kun bsdus pa bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: sngags rnams kun bsdus pa bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: it is connected with “Please explain the summary of all mantras.”

original: gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is it? It is stated:

original: rdo rje zhes bya pa la sogs pa la rdo rje rnams ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya pa la sogs pa la rdo rje rnams ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “Vajra” and so forth. The vajras are the recitations of Vajra Body, etc.

original: ye shes chen po zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes chen po zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The so-called great intuition is the cause of the perfection of the intuition of omniscience.🔽The mandala of the indivisible three bodies, etc.

original: sku gsum mi phyed dkyil 'khor dang // zhes bya ba ni sprul pa la sogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang / mi phyed pa'i dkyil 'khor ni lus te gong du bzlas pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku gsum mi phyed dkyil 'khor dang // zhes bya ba ni sprul pa la sogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang / mi phyed pa'i dkyil 'khor ni lus te gong du bzlas pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that the mandala of the body, etc., which is the nature of the body, etc., of the emanation body, etc., is the body vajra, etc., and the indivisible mandala is the body, as stated above.

original: dkyil 'khor lus su gsungs pa ste //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor lus su gsungs pa ste //
translated: The mandala is said to be the body.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: 'bras bu gsungs pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu gsungs pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: The result is said to be attained.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rang gi bdag po'i rnal 'byor gyis gnyis su med pa'i mos pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis bzlas par bya ba ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa 'byung bas zhes spyir gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rang gi bdag po'i rnal 'byor gyis gnyis su med pa'i mos pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis bzlas par bya ba ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa 'byung bas zhes spyir gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: In the center of one's own mandala, by the yoga of one's own lord, the recitation by the method of non-dual imagination, as will be explained, is the arising of the mirror-like intuition, etc. This is the general request.

original: bye brag gsungs pa /
analyzed: bye brag gsungs pa /
translated: The specific is stated:

original: rigs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rigs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The family and so on are as follows.

original: rigs ni snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'o //
translated: The family is Amitabha and so on.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dang // yid bzhin dam tshigs nor bu ste //🔽rigs ni rnam pa lnga ru bshad //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dang // yid bzhin dam tshigs nor bu ste // rigs ni rnam pa lnga ru bshad //
translated: Attachment, aversion, delusion, and the wish-fulfilling gem are the pledges of the family of desire, and so on.

original: ces gsungs pas so //🔽sngags @227a * //
analyzed: ces gsungs pas so // sngags @227a * //
translated: The family is explained as being of five types.

original: zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes kyis mdzes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //🔽sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mtshan //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes kyis mdzes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams so // sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mtshan //
translated: The mantra is the bodhisattvas, because they are adorned with the wisdom of method and wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The sign of body, speech, and mind is the essence of the nondual wisdom of the ultimate.

original: ji skad du le'u drug pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du le'u drug pa las /
translated: As it says in the sixth chapter:

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs dmigs nas //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs dmigs nas //
translated: Having observed body, speech, and mind,

original: ngo bo nyid ni dmigs su med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni dmigs su med // ces gsungs so //
translated: the essence is not observed.

original: ye shes rgya che bas ye shes rgya mtsho sta sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ye shes rgya che bas ye shes rgya mtsho sta sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The ocean of wisdom is the buddhas and so on, because their wisdom is vast.

original: rdo rje sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas nyid kyis rgyu gzhan ma yin par gyur pa ste /🔽rdo rje sngags ni rab bsgoms pa ;
analyzed: rdo rje sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas nyid kyis rgyu gzhan ma yin par gyur pa ste / rdo rje sngags ni rab bsgoms pa ;
translated: By vajra mantra and so on, he shows that it is not a different cause for buddhahood.

original: / zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: / zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: For it is said, The vajra mantra is well cultivated.

original: 'dis sgom pa dang bral bas de kho na nyid yod kyang sangs rgyas nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis sgom pa dang bral bas de kho na nyid yod kyang sangs rgyas nyid du gsungs so //
translated: By this, he shows that even though reality exists, there is no buddhahood without cultivation.

original: bzlas pa rgyas par bstan pa gsungs pa /🔽kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽sngags thams cad don dam par bzlas pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa rgyas par bstan pa gsungs pa / kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / sngags thams cad don dam par bzlas pa rnams la'o //
translated: He states the extensive teaching on the recitation:

original: rdo rje gsum rnams kyi mi phyed pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid dpyod par byed pa nyid bzlas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum rnams kyi mi phyed pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid dpyod par byed pa nyid bzlas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: All recitations of all mantras are in the three vajras, which are indivisible, nondual in nature, and are the very recitation.

original: de yang gsungs pa rdo rje snying po'i rgyan las /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa rdo rje snying po'i rgyan las /
translated: And that is stated in the Ornament of the Vajra Essence:

original: snying ga mgrin pa mchu dang lce //
analyzed: snying ga mgrin pa mchu dang lce //
translated: The heart, the throat, the lips and the tongue,

original: rkan dang mgo bo yang ma yin //
analyzed: rkan dang mgo bo yang ma yin //
translated: the palate and the head are not it.

original: nang dang phyi las ma yin te //
analyzed: nang dang phyi las ma yin te //
translated: It is not from within or without,

original: gnyis ka dbus kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbus kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it in the middle of the two.

original: chos kyang 'ba' zhig yin pa ste //
analyzed: chos kyang 'ba' zhig yin pa ste //
translated: It is only the Dharma,

original: bzlas pa'i sgra la mi brten to //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i sgra la mi brten to //
translated: He does not rely on the sound of repetition.

original: zhes so // 'dis ni rnal 'byor gyi bzlas pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // 'dis ni rnal 'byor gyi bzlas pa bshad pa'o //
translated: This explains the repetition of yoga.

original: gzugs kyi bzlas pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi bzlas pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: With reference to the repetition of form, it is said:

original: rdo rje dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdo rje dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The vajra division, etc.

original: dbye ba gsum gyis rdo rje'i mthar thug pa gang du bkod pa de ni rdo rje gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: dbye ba gsum gyis rdo rje'i mthar thug pa gang du bkod pa de ni rdo rje gsum du brjod do //
translated: That which is set down to the end of the vajra by the three divisions is called the three vajras.

original: 'di ni gsal bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni gsal bar bshad do //
translated: This is explained clearly.

original: gsum po rnams kyis rim pa dang // rim pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis gang spro ba sngon du song ba'i bsdu ba de'i rdo rje'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gsum po rnams kyis rim pa dang // rim pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis gang spro ba sngon du song ba'i bsdu ba de'i rdo rje'i mtha'o //
translated: By the three, with the distinction of sequential and non-sequential, that which is the gathering that precedes the emanation is the end of the vajra.

original: rang gi gnas su dgod par bya ba'i phyir 'dir bkod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su dgod par bya ba'i phyir 'dir bkod pa'o //
translated: It is set down here in order to be set down in one's own place.

original: sku la sogs pa bdag med pa'i sgo nas rdo rje gsum rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa bdag med pa'i sgo nas rdo rje gsum rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: Because it is the perfection of the three vajras by way of the selflessness of body, etc., it is the three vajras.

original: 'dis spro ba la sogs pa bzhi bstan to zhes la dag 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dis spro ba la sogs pa bzhi bstan to zhes la dag 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that this teaches the four, emanation, etc.

original: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With the three aspects, etc.

original: gzugs kyi bzlas pa la rim gyis re zhig spro ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi bzlas pa la rim gyis re zhig spro ba gsungs pa /
translated: The recitation of the form is taught gradually, and for a while, the emanation.

original: sku gsung @227b thugs dang nye ba ru //🔽zhes bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi thugs ka'i mtshan ma'i sa bon gyi yi ge las /
analyzed: sku gsung @227b thugs dang nye ba ru // zhes bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi thugs ka'i mtshan ma'i sa bon gyi yi ge las /
translated: Approaching the body, speech, and mind,

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sku rdo rje la sogs pa spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should emanate the body vajra, etc., in the proper order, from the seed syllable of the sign in the heart of the body vajra, etc.

original: 'di nyid sangs rgyas kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs su bsgoms pas gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams spro ba'i gzugs kyis mchod pa rab tu brtag ste de rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid sangs rgyas kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs su bsgoms pas gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams spro ba'i gzugs kyis mchod pa rab tu brtag ste de rnams la bya'o //
translated: This very [recitation] is the meditation on the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas. The goddesses such as Rūpavajrā emanate in the form of offerings, and one should do that to them.

original: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: The vajra of wisdom is the wisdom without an object.

original: phyogs gzhan cig car spro ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan cig car spro ba gsungs pa /
translated: The emanation in another direction is taught all at once.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The or and so forth.

original: so sor sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams las cig car nyid du sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams spro bar bya ste de rnams las gzhan yin la de las kyang gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams dang de'i dkyil 'khor thams cad spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: so sor sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams las cig car nyid du sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams spro bar bya ste de rnams las gzhan yin la de las kyang gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams dang de'i dkyil 'khor thams cad spro bar bya'o //
translated: One should emanate from each of the body, speech, and mind, simultaneously, the Body Vajra and so forth. From those, one should emanate the Form Vajra and so forth, and all the maṇḍalas.

original: ye shes sems dpa' gsungs pa /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' gsungs pa /
translated: The wisdom being is stated:

original: sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: [The mantra] “body” and so forth.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon yongs su brtags nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad las 'od zer spros pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon yongs su brtags nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad las 'od zer spros pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Having imagined the seed of one’s wisdom being, the nature of all entities, the nature of the realm of reality, one should do the recitation that is the nature of the light rays emanated from all the tathāgatas.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: yang na bzlas na rtse gcig sems nyid ni //
analyzed: yang na bzlas na rtse gcig sems nyid ni //
translated: If one recites, the mind itself is one-pointed,

original: dngos kun bdag nyid rang gi sems dbang ngo //
analyzed: dngos kun bdag nyid rang gi sems dbang ngo //
translated: the nature of all entities, under the power of one’s mind.

original: rang gi sngags ni sna tshogs 'od ldan par //
analyzed: rang gi sngags ni sna tshogs 'od ldan par //
translated: One’s mantra, endowed with various lights,

original: byas pa blo dang ldan par bsgom par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byas pa blo dang ldan par bsgom par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: is created and contemplated by the wise.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams rang gi mos pas rang bzhin spyad pa sngon du song ba'i rnal 'byor gyis bzlas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams rang gi mos pas rang bzhin spyad pa sngon du song ba'i rnal 'byor gyis bzlas pa gsungs pa /
translated: The recitation of the vajras of body and so on is taught by the yoga of one's own practice of the nature, preceded by one's own devotion.

original: sku'i rdo rje mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽rdzogs byang chub ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sku'i rdo rje mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa la / rdzogs byang chub ces bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme vajra of body and so on is taught by the verse beginning with the supreme vajra of body.🔽The term perfect enlightenment

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
translated: refers to perfect complete enlightenment.

original: dngos dang dngos med rnam dpyad pa //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rnam dpyad pa //
translated: The analysis of entity and non-entity

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is taught by the verse beginning with entity and non-entity.

original: gcig dang / du ma dang / gnyis ka'i bye brag gis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig dang / du ma dang / gnyis ka'i bye brag gis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is empty of the distinctions of one, many, and both,

original: de kho na nyid kyi dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the entity of reality is not observed.

original: de'i phyir dgag bya yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma dag gis mi 'thad pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang ma 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag bya yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma dag gis mi 'thad pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang ma 'grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the object of negation does not exist, and since valid cognitions are not tenable, non-entity is also not established.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid dang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid dang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of both does not exist,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni /
translated: because entity and non-entity

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: are mutually contradictory.

original: de yang @228a * //
analyzed: de yang @228a * //
translated: That is also

original: gsungs pa / dngos las 'jug pa don gzhan min //
analyzed: gsungs pa / dngos las 'jug pa don gzhan min //
translated: The engagement is not a different object from the entity.🔽It is not asserted to be a different object,

original: don gzhan min pa'ang min par 'dod //
analyzed: don gzhan min pa'ang min par 'dod //
translated: nor is it not a different object.

original: don gzhan yin na rtag par 'gyur //
analyzed: don gzhan yin na rtag par 'gyur //
translated: If it were a different object, it would be permanent.

original: don gzhan min pa'ang dngos po min //
analyzed: don gzhan min pa'ang dngos po min //
translated: If it were not a different object, it would not be an entity.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dpyad pa ni //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dpyad pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the analysis of entity and non-entity

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa zhes nges pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa zhes nges pa'o //
translated: is ascertained as the non-arising of all entities.

original: 'di yang chos nyid kyi so sor rig pa'i ngo bo nyid sku'i bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang chos nyid kyi so sor rig pa'i ngo bo nyid sku'i bzlas pa ste /
translated: This is also the recitation of the svabhāvikakāya, which is the essence of the individual knowledge of reality.

original: sangs rgyas kyi skur brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi skur brjod pa'o //
translated: It is called the buddha body.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As is said:

original: sangs rgyas chos nyid kyi blta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos nyid kyi blta ste /
translated: The view of the reality of the buddhas

original: chos kyi sku ni gtso bo yin //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni gtso bo yin //
translated: is the foremost dharmakāya.

original: chos nyid shes par bya min pas //
analyzed: chos nyid shes par bya min pas //
translated: Reality is not to be known,

original: de ni rnam par shes mi nus ;🔽/ zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes mi nus ; / zhes gsungs so //
translated: so it cannot be cognized.

original: gsung gis bzlas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsung gis bzlas pa gsungs pa /
translated: The recitation of speech is stated:

original: gsung zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: gsung zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: Speech and so forth.

original: sgra rnams ni rdul phra rab la sogs pa dang bral bas shes pa'i snang ba'i bdag nyid de sgra dang don dag gcig yin na /
analyzed: sgra rnams ni rdul phra rab la sogs pa dang bral bas shes pa'i snang ba'i bdag nyid de sgra dang don dag gcig yin na /
translated: Sounds are devoid of atoms, etc. , and are of the nature of the appearance of consciousness. If sound and meaning were one,

original: me yis kha ni tshig par 'gyur //
analyzed: me yis kha ni tshig par 'gyur //
translated: the mouth would be burned by fire.

original: gzhan nyid yin na rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na rtogs ma yin //
translated: If they were different, there would be no understanding.

original: zhes pa'i rig pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rig pas so //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: sgra ma yin pa ste brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ma yin pa ste brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi dpyad pa'o //
