analyzed: gtsug tor chen po yi ge gcig / ces bya ba'i nges par bstan pa'i zhal la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis so //
translated: is the one who has the great Uṣṇīṣa, the one who has the one-syllable mantra, and so forth, by the specifications of the face and so forth that are taught.

original: sa bon la sogs pa yang khyad par med pa'i phyir gtsug tor can rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa yang khyad par med pa'i phyir gtsug tor can rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yod dam zhe na /

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

analyzed: dpag med ces bya ba la sogs pa la / sems can dpag tu med pa'i bsam pa'i bye brag gis dpag tu med pa'i gnyen po'i bye @238a * //

analyzed: brag rnams la dmigs pas grangs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //

translated: The mantras are the particular syllables of the deities, etc., which are to be known as the realm of phenomena and which protect the realm of sentient beings.

original: khro bo dag ni re re yang //
analyzed: khro bo dag ni re re yang //
translated: Each of the wrathful ones

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor can 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi //

analyzed: khro bo thams cad ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'dis ni rgyud 'di'i lha thams cad yin par gsungs par 'gyur ro //

translated: Here, the lord of the mandala is to be contemplated as the transformation of the Great Vajradhara.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtogs par bya ba /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtogs par bya ba /
translated: This is to be understood from the words “in the realm of space,” etc.

analyzed: bud med sgyu ma'i mchog ldan pa //
translated: Possessing the supreme of women’s illusions

original: zhes bya ba ni bud med thams cad sprul pa rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bud med thams cad sprul pa rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that all women are the chief of the emanations.

original: spyan gyi dam tshig ni 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: spyan gyi dam tshig ni 'khor lo ste /
translated: The commitment of the eyes is the wheel.

original: de dang bcas pa ni phyag gi mchog ste /
analyzed: de dang bcas pa ni phyag gi mchog ste /
translated: Together with that, the supreme of hands is the supreme of hands.

original: 'di yod pa ni de dang ldan pa'i spyan no //
analyzed: 'di yod pa ni de dang ldan pa'i spyan no //
translated: The existence of this is the possession of that eye.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meditative concentration that has that as its object is so called.

original: nam mkha'i sgyu ma mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i sgyu ma mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme illusion of space is

analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bos sprul pa du mas 'gro ba'i don rdzogs pa la sgyu ma lta bu'i snang ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: By means of the many emanations of the essence of non-objectifying intuition, the fulfillment of the aims of beings is the illusion-like appearance, and that is so called.

analyzed: autpala sngon dmar zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i autpala de yang dmar po zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: nam mkha' gnyis su med pa ni yul gyi m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' gnyis su med pa ni yul gyi m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: The non-duality of space is the objective Mamaki.

original: de'i rnam pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin gyis so //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin gyis so //
translated: By the cloud of light rays of her form.

original: rdo rje tshim par byed pa ni gzhan la phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar ster bas byams pa chen po'i bdag nyid de bde ba gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje tshim par byed pa ni gzhan la phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar ster bas byams pa chen po'i bdag nyid de bde ba gang la yod pa'o //
translated: The vajra-satisfier is the nature of great love, bestowing benefit and happiness upon others, and that is the bliss.

original: lhag ma ni sngar gyi bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar gyi bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: sgyu ma'i rgya skyegs mchog las byung //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rgya skyegs mchog las byung //
translated: The supreme illusion is produced from lac.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma ni sprul pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma ni sprul pa rnams so //
translated: The illusion is the emanations.

original: de nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste //
analyzed: de nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste //
translated: That itself is perfect enlightenment.

original: sems can 'tshed par byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can 'tshed par byed pa'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of cooking sentient beings,

original: rgya skyegs kyi ni khu ba'o //
analyzed: rgya skyegs kyi ni khu ba'o //
translated: the juice of lac.

original: autpala dmar po phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: autpala dmar po phyag na bsnams //
translated: He holds a red lotus in his hand.

original: zhes bya ba ni padma nyid du chos kyi brdas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padma nyid du chos kyi brdas gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is said by the symbol of the Dharma in the lotus.

original: yang @238b na dmar po ni dmar po'i kha dog go //
analyzed: yang @238b na dmar po ni dmar po'i kha dog go //
translated: Or, red is the color of red.

original: autpala ni au da ka ta pa la ni sha yongs su rdzogs pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: autpala ni au da ka ta pa la ni sha yongs su rdzogs pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Lotus is the complete flesh of the utpala.

original: de ni padma nyid de /
analyzed: de ni padma nyid de /
translated: That is the lotus.

original: bzhi pa las padma nyid 'di'i mtshan mar gsungs pas so //
analyzed: bzhi pa las padma nyid 'di'i mtshan mar gsungs pas so //
translated: This is said to be the sign of the lotus in the fourth [dhyana].

original: chos kyi dam tshig ces bya ba ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dam tshig ces bya ba ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The pledge of the Dharma is Pandaravasini.

original: de'i de kho na nyid mngon par byang chub pa ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid mngon par byang chub pa ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Her reality is the great seal, etc.

original: de mthong ba rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the vajra-like samadhi of seeing that is so-called.🔽She is intoxicated by the illusion of women.

original: bud med sgyu mas myos zhes bya ba ni de yis myos pa ste /
analyzed: bud med sgyu mas myos zhes bya ba ni de yis myos pa ste /
translated: She is intoxicated by that.

original: sems can rnams mngon par byang chub pa'i snod du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams mngon par byang chub pa'i snod du byed pa'o //
translated: She is the vessel of the complete enlightenment of sentient beings.

original: de la spro ba ni sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de la spro ba ni sems dpa'o //
translated: The hero in that is the sattva.

original: 'gog pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The so-called “wheel of wrathful cessation” is as follows:

original: bgegs rnams 'gog pa ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: bgegs rnams 'gog pa ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Cessation is peace.

original: khro bo'i 'khor lo gang gis te des dkyil 'khor ba'i lha dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: khro bo'i 'khor lo gang gis te des dkyil 'khor ba'i lha dang bcas pas so //
translated: By means of the wheel of wrath, together with the deities of the maṇḍala,

original: rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi phyed pa'i ye shes grub ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi phyed pa'i ye shes grub ste /
translated: the gnosis of indivisible yoga is accomplished.

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid ces pa kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid ces pa kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is the nature of the vajra maṇḍala.

original: 'gog pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Cessation is one-pointed mind.

original: khro bo ni gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa rnams te de dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa ser po'o //🔽des na / sangs rgyas 'khor lo nges par rton //
analyzed: khro bo ni gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa rnams te de dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa ser po'o // des na / sangs rgyas 'khor lo nges par rton //
translated: Wrath is Yamāntaka and so forth. The wheel together with that is a yellow wheel with ten spokes.🔽Therefore,

original: zhes bya ba ni bka'i 'khor lo la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bka'i 'khor lo la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: “the yogin who abides in the wheel of speech should rely on the wheel of the buddhas.”

original: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi rigs kyi tshogs ma grub na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi rigs kyi tshogs ma grub na /
translated: When the assembly of one’s own family is not accomplished,

original: de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin du bka'i 'khor lo la gnas pas sgrub na nges par dngos grub thams cad 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin du bka'i 'khor lo la gnas pas sgrub na nges par dngos grub thams cad 'grub bo //
translated: At that time, if one practices by abiding in the wheel of the command just as it is, one will certainly accomplish all powers.

original: de nyid gsungs pa rdo rje dkyil 'khor zhes bya bar gzhan 'dod do //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa rdo rje dkyil 'khor zhes bya bar gzhan 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that the vajra mandala is taught in the verse “vajra samaya.”

original: rdo rje rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: The vajras are those of the Tathagatas, etc.

original: dam tshig ni rgyu ste yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: dam tshig ni rgyu ste yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The commitment is the cause, which is the three syllables.

original: de'i bkod pa ni sprul pa du ma gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bkod pa ni sprul pa du ma gnas pa'o //
translated: The array is the presence of many emanations.

original: des de kho na nyid kyi rigs lnga'i don sgom pa ni don dam par rnam par dpyad pa ste /
analyzed: des de kho na nyid kyi rigs lnga'i don sgom pa ni don dam par rnam par dpyad pa ste /
translated: By that, the meditation on the meaning of the five families of reality is the ultimate analysis.

original: de'i mngon par byang chub par rtogs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mngon par byang chub par rtogs par gyur pa ste /
translated: The realization of that is the manifest enlightenment.

original: le'u gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: le'u gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The chapter that has that is called “The Manifest Enlightenment of Vairocana.”

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dka' 'grel rgyal bas byin pas mdzad pa las le'u bcu gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dka' 'grel rgyal bas byin pas mdzad pa las le'u bcu gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the thirteenth chapter in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra called “The Manifest Enlightenment of Vairocana.”

original: // / zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rdzogs pa'i don du brjod ma thag pa'i lha rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u gsungs nas sngags dgod pa'i phyir /🔽de nas zhes bya ba @239a * //
analyzed: // / zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rdzogs pa'i don du brjod ma thag pa'i lha rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u gsungs nas sngags dgod pa'i phyir / de nas zhes bya ba @239a * //
translated: Having stated the chapter on the meditative concentrations of the deities just mentioned for the sake of completing the rites of pacification, etc., in order to set forth the mantras,

original: la sogs pa la /
analyzed: la sogs pa la /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, THEREAFTER, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po de skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po de skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pledge of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is the Great Vajra-Holder, because it generates that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag po zhes bya ba ste gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag po zhes bya ba ste gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For that very reason, it is the lord, which means the principal.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rims la sogs pa zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rims la sogs pa zhi ba'o //
translated: Pacification is the pacification of contagious diseases, etc.

original: dam tshig ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni rgyu'o //
translated: The pledge is the cause.

original: de la mchog ni gtso bo ste spyan gyi sngags so //
analyzed: de la mchog ni gtso bo ste spyan gyi sngags so //
translated: The supreme of those is the principal, which is the eye mantra.

original: de la dmigs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is also called that because it focuses on that.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni spyan gyi sngags gsungs pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni spyan gyi sngags gsungs pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: To enter into meditative equipoise on that is to one-pointedly think of the eye mantra.

original: la la dag rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin de mngon du byas nas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: la la dag rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin de mngon du byas nas zhes brjod do //
translated: Some say that one should say, “having manifested that samādhi of Vairocana.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi btsun mo zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa snying rje'i ngo bo 'dzin pas spyan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi btsun mo zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa snying rje'i ngo bo 'dzin pas spyan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Queen of all tathāgatas” means that she is called Locanā because she holds the nature of compassion, such as Vairocana.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa'i phyir de skad gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa'i phyir de skad gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not said that she is so called because she abides in union with Vairocana,

original: bsam gtan gyi dkyil 'khor la rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan dag gnyis nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dkyil 'khor la rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan dag gnyis nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that in the maṇḍala of meditation, Vairocana and Locanā would be two.

original: de bzhin du phyi ma dag la yang ci rigs par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma dag la yang ci rigs par bshad par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should explain the latter as appropriate.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje rjes su dran //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje rjes su dran //
translated: “Recollection of the vajra buddha”

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad spyan gyi rnam par mngon du byed pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad spyan gyi rnam par mngon du byed pas so //
translated: means that one should manifest the form of Locanā as Vairocana.

original: drag shul bsgrub pa la mngon spyod byed pas sangs rgyas rnams la 'gyod pa bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: drag shul bsgrub pa la mngon spyod byed pas sangs rgyas rnams la 'gyod pa bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to clear away regret for the buddhas, one should perform the rite of assault in order to accomplish the wrathful.

original: rnal 'byor ba 'dis zhi ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba 'dis zhi ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: This yoga is said to be for peace.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi zhing 'byung ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi zhing 'byung ba //
translated: The source of the field of all buddhas.

original: zhes so // las rnams thams cad rab bsgrub cing //
analyzed: zhes so // las rnams thams cad rab bsgrub cing //
translated: It is said to accomplish all activities.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i stobs kyis ji lta ba bzhin 'di nyid kyis rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i stobs kyis ji lta ba bzhin 'di nyid kyis rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by the power of intention, one accomplishes the activities of increase and so forth.

original: shi ba sos par byed par gsungs //
analyzed: shi ba sos par byed par gsungs //
translated: It is said to revive the dead.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyis brtan par byas pa'i sems dang / rig pa bzlas pas kyang ji lta ba bzhin spyan gyi sbyor ba byas nas rang gi snying ga las grub pa'i 'khor lo'i lcags kyu phyung nas shi ba gzhan du song ba'i rnam par shes pa shi ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa bsal ba'i nor bu dmar
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyis brtan par byas pa'i sems dang / rig pa bzlas pas kyang ji lta ba bzhin spyan gyi sbyor ba byas nas rang gi snying ga las grub pa'i 'khor lo'i lcags kyu phyung nas shi ba gzhan du song ba'i rnam par shes pa shi ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa bsal ba'i nor bu dmar
translated: Having stabilized the mind by subtle yoga and having performed the practice of the eye just as it is by mantra repetition, one should emanate the hook of the wheel from one's heart. Having extracted the consciousness of the dead person who has gone elsewhere, one should draw it into the red jewel that follows the form of the dead person.

original: po'i 'od can nam aa'i rnam pa'i gzugs bkug nas de'i snying gar gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: po'i 'od can nam aa'i rnam pa'i gzugs bkug nas de'i snying gar gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having summoned the form of the syllable āḥ or the form of a light, one should place it in the heart of the other.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: And that is stated:

original: @239b aa ni sems can thams cad kyi //
analyzed: @239b aa ni sems can thams cad kyi //
translated: āḥ is the life of all sentient beings,

original: rtag tu srog gyur rang phyag rgya //
analyzed: rtag tu srog gyur rang phyag rgya //
translated: one’s own seal, always.

original: yang dag bzung nas yang dag bcing //
analyzed: yang dag bzung nas yang dag bcing //
translated: Having taken it up, having bound it,

original: srog ni bsrung ba'i rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: srog ni bsrung ba'i rgyu yi phyir //
translated: for the sake of protecting the life,

original: zhes so // de la mo ha ra ti snying gar bkod la de'i 'od zer rnams kyis de'i lus mi snang bar byas nas de'i ming gi yi ge dang po tsam 'od zer dang bcas te ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi snying gar gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de la mo ha ra ti snying gar bkod la de'i 'od zer rnams kyis de'i lus mi snang bar byas nas de'i ming gi yi ge dang po tsam 'od zer dang bcas te ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi snying gar gzhug par bya ste /
translated: There, having arranged moharati in the heart, having made the body of the other invisible by means of its light rays, one should place just the first letter of its name together with light rays in one’s own heart in the proper manner.

original: spyan gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa bsgoms nas ji lta ba bzhin du phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa byas nas spyan gyi sngags kyis rtag tu de'i lus po khyab par bya'o//
analyzed: spyan gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa bsgoms nas ji lta ba bzhin du phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa byas nas spyan gyi sngags kyis rtag tu de'i lus po khyab par bya'o//
translated: Having meditated on the transformation into the form of Locanā, having performed the consecration of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on, in the proper manner, one should always pervade the body of the other with the Locanā mantra.

original: sngags de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang spel nas bzlas so //
analyzed: sngags de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang spel nas bzlas so //
translated: One should repeat the mantra, adding the name of the one to be accomplished.

original: sngon bzhin du dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga byas na shi ba yang slar rab tu sos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon bzhin du dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho ga byas na shi ba yang slar rab tu sos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs the rite of consecration, etc., as before, even the dead will be revived.

original: gang gi tshe 'chi 'dod pa'i srog srung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe 'chi bar 'dod pa'i snying ga'i padma la ming gi yi ge'am yi ge aa bltas shing padma btsums la zhags pas bcing bar bya'o //🔽yang na / rdo rje kha sbyar lte gnas pa'i //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi 'dod pa'i srog srung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe 'chi bar 'dod pa'i snying ga'i padma la ming gi yi ge'am yi ge aa bltas shing padma btsums la zhags pas bcing bar bya'o // yang na / rdo rje kha sbyar lte gnas pa'i //
translated: When one wishes to protect the life of one who wishes to die, then one should look at the name-syllable or the syllable A at the heart lotus of the one who wishes to die, close the lotus, and bind it with a noose.🔽Or else:🔽The syllable A, the color of gold,

original: aa yig gser gyi mdog can ni //
analyzed: aa yig gser gyi mdog can ni //
translated: is located at the navel, in the vajra-union.🔽Having contemplated it at the heart, one should bind the two sides

original: snying gar bsams nas logs gnyis dag / zhags pa dag gis bcing par bya //
analyzed: snying gar bsams nas logs gnyis dag / zhags pa dag gis bcing par bya //
translated: with the two nooses.

original: de nas 'dir rgyas par 'dod na de'i tshe snying ga'i padmar yi ge bam kha dog ser po bdud rtsi 'dzag pa kha thur du bltas pa bsgoms nas lte ba'i gnas su yang aa yig padma kha sbyar gyi nang du bdud rtsi dang bcas pa bsgom par bya'o
analyzed: de nas 'dir rgyas par 'dod na de'i tshe snying ga'i padmar yi ge bam kha dog ser po bdud rtsi 'dzag pa kha thur du bltas pa bsgoms nas lte ba'i gnas su yang aa yig padma kha sbyar gyi nang du bdud rtsi dang bcas pa bsgom par bya'o
translated: Then, if one wishes to perform this rite extensively, at that time one should visualize a yellow syllable vaṃ dripping nectar, upside-down, in the heart lotus, and also visualize the syllable aṃ in the navel region, inside a lotus with petals facing downward, together with nectar.

original: // yang na kham phor kha sbyar gyi nang du tsandan dkar pos rdo rje la 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma bri bar byas nas /
analyzed: // yang na kham phor kha sbyar gyi nang du tsandan dkar pos rdo rje la 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma bri bar byas nas /
translated: Or, inside a joined pair of clay bowls, one should draw with white sandalwood a vajra with an eight-petaled lotus.

original: de'i ze 'brul la h'um gi yi ge'i mgo bo la bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel nas rnam par snang mdzad kyi gdon pa'i sngags kyis bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ze 'brul la h'um gi yi ge'i mgo bo la bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel nas rnam par snang mdzad kyi gdon pa'i sngags kyis bskor bar bya'o //
translated: On the stamen of that lotus, one should write the name of the person to be subdued, connected to the head of the syllable hūṃ, and surround it with the mantra for extracting Vairocana.

original: padma'i 'dab ma la yang spyan gyi sngags kyis kyang bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma la yang spyan gyi sngags kyis kyang bskor bar bya'o //
translated: On the lotus petals, one should also write the mantra of Locanā.

original: de nas ji lta ba bzhin du dgug par byas nas nad pa'i mgo ba'i sngags su tsandan gyis byugs pa'i sa la kham phor kha sbyar gzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas ji lta ba bzhin du dgug par byas nas nad pa'i mgo ba'i sngags su tsandan gyis byugs pa'i sa la kham phor kha sbyar gzhag ste /
translated: Then, having summoned [the victim] as before, one should place the joined bowls on the ground anointed with sandalwood, on the head of the patient.

original: me tog dkar pos mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog dkar pos mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings with white flowers.

original: rang gis de la dbang bskur bar bsgoms nas de'i ming dang spel ba'i spyan gyi sngags khri phrag gcig bzlas so //
analyzed: rang gis de la dbang bskur bar bsgoms nas de'i ming dang spel ba'i spyan gyi sngags khri phrag gcig bzlas so //
translated: Having visualized oneself as empowered by her, one should repeat the mantra of her eye, which is combined with her name, ten thousand times.

original: rdo rje dam tshig @240a * //
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig @240a * //
translated: The pledge of the vajra

original: bskul mdzad ma //
analyzed: bskul mdzad ma //
translated: is the one who is implored.

original: zhes bya ba ni khu bar gyur pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gzugs yongs su gzung ba'i ched du bskul ba zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽bsrung ba'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khu bar gyur pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gzugs yongs su gzung ba'i ched du bskul ba zhes bya ba'i don to // bsrung ba'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning is that the one who is implored is the form of Great Vajradhara, who is the melted pledge.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sku gsum gyi dam tshig rdo rje khro bo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sku gsum gyi dam tshig rdo rje khro bo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Having made protection the topic, he declares, Then, etc. The pledge of the three bodies, the wrathful vajra, is Akshobhya.

original: spyos nas tshar bcad pas 'dul ba'i ched dang chos kyi sku la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyos nas tshar bcad pas 'dul ba'i ched dang chos kyi sku la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to subdue those to be subdued by scolding and punishment, and in order to complete the cause of the Dharma body, etc.

original: de nyid dngos po ni gzung ba la sogs pa brtag pa'i gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid dngos po ni gzung ba la sogs pa brtag pa'i gzugs rnams so //
translated: That reality is the forms of the imagined nature, etc.

original: de kho na nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin de nyid dam tshig rdo rje m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin de nyid dam tshig rdo rje m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: That very nature of the exalted wisdom of emptiness, which is the non-existence of things in reality, is Samaya-vajra Mamaki.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samadhi which focuses on that is called by that name.

original: 'di'i bya ba gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'di'i bya ba gsungs pa //
translated: His action is stated:

original: srung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: srung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In all ways, protection, etc.🔽means that it is not possible for anyone to overcome it.

original: thams cad du srung ba'i ni gang gis kyang gzhom par mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to /'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du srung ba'i ni gang gis kyang gzhom par mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to /'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: la la dag mi ma yin pa la sogs pas 'jigs pa la rang gi lha'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyis mgo la gyen du gnas pa'i h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa'i lte ba la m'a ma k'i gnas par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: la la dag mi ma yin pa la sogs pas 'jigs pa la rang gi lha'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyis mgo la gyen du gnas pa'i h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa'i lte ba la m'a ma k'i gnas par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: For those who are afraid of non-human beings, etc., one should meditate on oneself as the deity, with a five-pointed vajra standing upright on one's head, arisen from HUM, with Mamaki in the center of the hub.

original: m'a ma k'i'i snying ga'i ye shes kyi lha mo'i snying ga'i mtshan ma la gnas pa rang gi phreng ba'i sngags yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i'i snying ga'i ye shes kyi lha mo'i snying ga'i mtshan ma la gnas pa rang gi phreng ba'i sngags yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: The mantra rosary of Mamaki, which is in the heart of the wisdom goddess in the heart of Mamaki, is transformed.

original: rdo rje ser po phra mo'i 'od zer rnams kyis rkang pa'i mthar go cha bgos par bdag nyid bsgoms nas de ltar gang gis kyang gzhom par mi nus par srung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ser po phra mo'i 'od zer rnams kyis rkang pa'i mthar go cha bgos par bdag nyid bsgoms nas de ltar gang gis kyang gzhom par mi nus par srung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having visualized oneself as being armored to the tips of the toes with the light rays of the fine vajra, one is protected in such a way that one cannot be overcome by anyone.

original: rgyas pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa //
translated: [The rite] is taught with reference to the rite of increase.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: 'dod chags chen po'i dam tshig ces bya ba ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i dam tshig ces bya ba ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The pledge of great passion is Pandaravasini.

original: de gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni yul du byed pa ste de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon du mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni yul du byed pa ste de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon du mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: To behold her is to make her an object of one's experience. To enter into the contemplation called that is to actualize it.

original: chos rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The increase of Dharma is

original: ji lta ba bzhin du gos dkar mo'i rnal 'byor byas nas chos thams cad smon pa med pa'o zhes yid la byas /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du gos dkar mo'i rnal 'byor byas nas chos thams cad smon pa med pa'o zhes yid la byas /
translated: having performed the yoga of Pandaravasini just as it is, one should contemplate all dharmas as wishless.

original: sngar gyi bzhin du rgyas pa'i cho gas dbang bskur ba la sogs pa bdag dang gzhan la bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi bzhin du rgyas pa'i cho gas dbang bskur ba la sogs pa bdag dang gzhan la bya'o //
translated: As before, one should perform the consecration, etc., for oneself and others by means of the rite of increase.

original: de ltar yang ma lus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / ji srid du stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos @240b rnams thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma lus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / ji srid du stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos @240b rnams thob pa'o //
translated: Thus, all the roots of virtue will increase, and as long as the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on are attained, up to the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de bzhin du bsam pa'i khyad par las shin tu ring ba ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam pa'i khyad par las shin tu ring ba ni //
translated: Similarly, from the special intention, the very distant is

original: stobs dang / phongs pa rnams ni nor 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang / phongs pa rnams ni nor 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: the increase of wealth for the poor and destitute.

original: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i sgom pa dang lhan cig yang du sngags bzlas pas te phyi rol gyi cho ga dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i sgom pa dang lhan cig yang du sngags bzlas pas te phyi rol gyi cho ga dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By mere recitation means by reciting the mantra again and again together with the previously explained meditation, free from external rituals.

original: dbang du byed pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbang du byed pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: With regard to enthrallment, it is stated:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, the mantra of Amoghasiddhi is:

original: kun nas las sna tshogs byed pa'i phyir don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas las sna tshogs byed pa'i phyir don yod grub pa ste /
translated: Amoghasiddhi is so called because he accomplishes various activities.

original: de nyid snying rje'i dbang gis sgrol ma la sogs pa'i gzugs su mi phyed pa gang yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid snying rje'i dbang gis sgrol ma la sogs pa'i gzugs su mi phyed pa gang yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That samādhi is so called because it is undivided in the form of Tārā, and so on, by the power of compassion.

original: bran bzhin du byed ces bya ba ni thams cad kyang zhi ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bran bzhin du byed ces bya ba ni thams cad kyang zhi ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: “Acting like a servant” means that all should be seen as peaceful.

original: 'on kyang khyad par ni ji lta ba bzhin du kha dog dmar po dang bcas pa sgrol ma'i sbyor ba byas nas ye shes sems dpa'i snying gar zla ba dmar po las mgo gyen du bstan pa sngags kyi phreng ba dmar pos snying ga'i sa bon la bskor
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par ni ji lta ba bzhin du kha dog dmar po dang bcas pa sgrol ma'i sbyor ba byas nas ye shes sems dpa'i snying gar zla ba dmar po las mgo gyen du bstan pa sngags kyi phreng ba dmar pos snying ga'i sa bon la bskor
translated: However, the difference is that, having performed the Tārā yoga with the color just as it is, red, the mantra rosary, red, is arranged around the seed syllable in the heart of the gnosis being on a red moon at the heart of the knowledge being.

original: ba bkod nas de'i 'od zer dmar po rnams dang / rang gi mtshan ma la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyis skyes bu'i snying ga'i padma dmar po'am bud med kyi padma dmar po'i lte ba la bskul te /
analyzed: ba bkod nas de'i 'od zer dmar po rnams dang / rang gi mtshan ma la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyis skyes bu'i snying ga'i padma dmar po'am bud med kyi padma dmar po'i lte ba la bskul te /
translated: Having arranged that, the red light rays and the light rays of one’s own sign, and so on, summon the red lotus of the man’s heart or the red lotus of the woman’s heart.

original: rang gi snying ga nas padma'i lam du byung ba'i sngags kyi phreng ba khar gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga nas padma'i lam du byung ba'i sngags kyi phreng ba khar gzhug par bya ste /
translated: The mantra garland that emerges from one’s heart through the lotus path should be placed in the mouth.

original: de'i sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dmar po'i rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du blangs nas 'ongs te //
analyzed: de'i sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dmar po'i rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du blangs nas 'ongs te //
translated: One should take up the mind of the target in the form of a red moon maṇḍala and bring it in.

original: ye shes kyi lha mo'i padma la zhugs nas snying gar 'ongs te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi lha mo'i padma la zhugs nas snying gar 'ongs te /
translated: Having entered the lotus of the wisdom goddess, it comes to the heart.🔽Having made it nondual with the moon in one’s heart, one should recite the mantra and meditate that the target falls at the feet of the practitioner and obeys his command.

original: rang gi snying ga'i zla ba dang gnyis su med pa'i byas nas bzlas brjod byed cing bsgrub bya sgrub pa po yi rkang pa'i drung du lhung nas bka' nod par bsgom par bya ste nyi ma bdun pa gsum du bzlas pas de nges par dbang du 'gyur ro
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i zla ba dang gnyis su med pa'i byas nas bzlas brjod byed cing bsgrub bya sgrub pa po yi rkang pa'i drung du lhung nas bka' nod par bsgom par bya ste nyi ma bdun pa gsum du bzlas pas de nges par dbang du 'gyur ro
translated: By reciting for three seven-day periods, he will certainly be brought under control.

original: // yang na mda' 'dzin ma'i lha'i sbyor bas las 'di bya ste /
analyzed: // yang na mda' 'dzin ma'i lha'i sbyor bas las 'di bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, one should perform this rite by the yoga of the deity holding an arrow.

original: de'i tshe bskul ba'i tshig dang ldan pas rang gi sngags kyi mthar ho 'don pa na 'jigs pa dang bcas pas bka' don du gnyer ba lhur byed pa bsgrub bya'i snying ga'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe bskul ba'i tshig dang ldan pas rang gi sngags kyi mthar ho 'don pa na 'jigs pa dang bcas pas bka' don du gnyer ba lhur byed pa bsgrub bya'i snying ga'am /
translated: With fear, one should strive to accomplish the object of the command.🔽Again and again, one should strike the heart or lotus of the object to be subjugated with an arrow that is like a red utpala flower, consecrated with the mantra.

original: padma la sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i autpala dmar po dang 'dra ba'i mdas yang dang yang du brdeg cing bzlas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padma la sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i autpala dmar po dang 'dra ba'i mdas yang dang yang du brdeg cing bzlas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites, the object will be subjugated.

original: de nas gzhan gyis byas te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan gyis byas te /
translated: Then, having done that,

original: gzhan dbang du byed par 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan dbang du byed par 'dod na /
translated: if one wishes to subjugate another,🔽one should visualize oneself as the deity,

original: yang @241a * //
analyzed: yang @241a * //

original: de'i tshe dbang don du gnyer bas bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang don du gnyer bas bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa /
translated: At that time, one who strives for subjugation should perform the consecration as stated in the thirteenth chapter.

original: dbang du byed pa'i cho gas dbang bskur ba byas nas 'dir gsungs pa'i dbang du byed pa'i cho gas bya ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang du byed pa'i cho gas dbang bskur ba byas nas 'dir gsungs pa'i dbang du byed pa'i cho gas bya ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having performed the consecration with the rite of subjugation, one should meditate according to the rite of subjugation stated here.

original: rang yang sgrol ma'i rnal 'byor gyis che ge mo'i dbang du che ge mo gyis shig ces bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pa phreng ba'i sngags ho'i mtha' can bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rang yang sgrol ma'i rnal 'byor gyis che ge mo'i dbang du che ge mo gyis shig ces bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pa phreng ba'i sngags ho'i mtha' can bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should also recite the mantra of the rosary, ending with “ho,” with the words of urging, “By the yoga of Tārā, so-and-so should be brought under the power of so-and-so.”

analyzed: las thams cad la rjes su mthun pa sngags kyi mthar sa bon gzhan blta bar bya'o //

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /

analyzed: rgyas zhi dbang dang dgug pa dang // dbye dang bskrad dang mngon spyod la //

analyzed: aom sv'a h'a ho:dza:h'um phat phat sngags kyi mthar ni bskul ba yang bya'o //

original: dgug pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs ba /
analyzed: dgug pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs ba /
translated: With regard to summoning, it is stated:

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dri ma med pa'i 'od zer ni rnam par snang mdzad do //

analyzed: de nyid sprin rdo rje ste gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs can du gyur pa'o //

analyzed: gang la ting nge 'dzin yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

Having summoned and so forth,

original: h'um gi yi ge las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rdo rje lcags kyus byin gyis brlab pa g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum pas de'i snying gar bzhag nas khros pa'i bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pas sngags bzlas pas dgug pa'i tshul gyis dal gyis rkang pas🔽dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um gi yi ge las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rdo rje lcags kyus byin gyis brlab pa g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum pas de'i snying gar bzhag nas khros pa'i bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pas sngags bzlas pas dgug pa'i tshul gyis dal gyis rkang pas🔽dgug par bya'o //
translated: one should summon slowly with the feet, having placed it on the heart with the right leg extended and the left drawn in, abiding in the center of a sun maṇḍala arisen from the syllable hūṃ, blessed by the vajra hook, in the manner of summoning, with the words of the angry invocation, reciting the mantra.

original: bsgrub bya yang yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor la yi ge dzhes bteg ste bskul bar bltas nas rang gi snying ga las kyang grub pa'i 'khor lo'i lcags kyu phyung la ji lta ba bzhin du bka' bsgo ba byin nas de dgug tu btang ngo //
analyzed: bsgrub bya yang yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor la yi ge dzhes bteg ste bskul bar bltas nas rang gi snying ga las kyang grub pa'i 'khor lo'i lcags kyu phyung la ji lta ba bzhin du bka' bsgo ba byin nas de dgug tu btang ngo //
translated: Having emanated an iron hook of the wheel of accomplishment from one's heart, one should give the command just as before, and send him to summon.

original: des kyang ji lta ba bzhin du bkug nas nges par 'ongs par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang ji lta ba bzhin du bkug nas nges par 'ongs par mos par bya'o //
translated: Having summoned just as before, one should imagine that he definitely comes.

original: 'ongs pa de dang khro bo la dri bzang po dang bcas pa'i tshul yon chab sbyin no//
analyzed: 'ongs pa de dang khro bo la dri bzang po dang bcas pa'i tshul yon chab sbyin no//
translated: Having come, one should offer water for welcoming and water for the feet to him and to Krodha, along with perfume.

original: de nas de blangs nas ji ltar 'dod pa rdzogs par bya'o //🔽mi mo dgug pa ni /
analyzed: de nas de blangs nas ji ltar 'dod pa rdzogs par bya'o // mi mo dgug pa ni /
translated: Then, having accepted that, one should do whatever one wishes.

original: skra grol ba can dang gos med par bsgoms nas bya bar la la dag khyad par ro zer ro //
analyzed: skra grol ba can dang gos med par bsgoms nas bya bar la la dag khyad par ro zer ro //
translated: Some say that the special point is that one should visualize the woman with loose hair and naked when summoning a woman.

original: skyes bu dgug par 'dod na skyes pa'i thod pa la g-yon brkyang ba g-yas kyis mnan nas thams cad 'dir bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyad bar ro //
analyzed: skyes bu dgug par 'dod na skyes pa'i thod pa la g-yon brkyang ba g-yas kyis mnan nas thams cad 'dir bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyad bar ro //
translated: If one wishes to summon a man, one should extend the left foot and press down with the right foot on the skull of a man.

original: de nas dgongs pa las nges par bstan pa bu mo sgrub pa'i cho ga 'di'i man ngag bshad pa ka ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: de nas dgongs pa las nges par bstan pa bu mo sgrub pa'i cho ga 'di'i man ngag bshad pa ka ni bde ba'o //
translated: Ka is bliss.

original: p'a la zhes bya ba ni skyong ba'i phyir ka p'a la ste /
analyzed: p'a la zhes bya ba ni skyong ba'i phyir ka p'a la ste /
translated: Pāla means protecting, so kapāla is a skull cup.

original: bu mo'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bu mo'i gzugs so //
translated: It is the form of a girl.

original: ma chag ma gas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma chag ma gas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not broken, not cracked means

original: skyes pa dang ma phrad pa ste gzhon nu ma zhes pa'i @242a * //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma phrad pa ste gzhon nu ma zhes pa'i @242a * //
translated: not having had intercourse with a man, a virgin.

original: bar du'o // gzugs mdzes zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi mtshan nyid thams cad rdzogs par mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: bar du'o // gzugs mdzes zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi mtshan nyid thams cad rdzogs par mdzes pa'o //
translated: Beautiful form means beautiful in the perfection of all the characteristics of a woman.

original: yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang sdom pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang sdom pa shes pa'o //
translated: Attractive means knowing the sacred pledge and the vows.

original: rkang pas mnan pa'i tshul byas na //
analyzed: rkang pas mnan pa'i tshul byas na //
translated: Having made the gesture of stepping on the feet,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: this is what is said:

original: de ltar yon tan khyad par can bzung nas mnyam bar gzhag pa'i sems kyis ji lta ba bzhin du spyan la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rdzogs par bya ste sngar gyi bzhin du gshin rje gshed po'i rnal 'byor sngon du song ba bsgrub pa'i 'khor lo'i lcags kyus ye
analyzed: de ltar yon tan khyad par can bzung nas mnyam bar gzhag pa'i sems kyis ji lta ba bzhin du spyan la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rdzogs par bya ste sngar gyi bzhin du gshin rje gshed po'i rnal 'byor sngon du song ba bsgrub pa'i 'khor lo'i lcags kyus ye
translated: Having thus taken up the special qualities, one should complete the form of Locanā, etc., with a mind in equipoise, just as it is, as before, with the yoga of Slayer of Yama, having gone previously.

original: shes kyi spyan ma bkug nas de'i nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: shes kyi spyan ma bkug nas de'i nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having summoned the wisdom Locanā with the hook of the wheel of practice, one should place her within.

original: de ltar na rkang pas gnon pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rkang pas gnon pa ste /
translated: Thus, one should step on her with one’s foot.

original: de'i ye shes kyis mnan pa ni bkab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ye shes kyis mnan pa ni bkab par 'gyur te /
translated: Her being stepped on by her wisdom is covered.

original: spyan la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de bzhin du m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis kyang /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de bzhin du m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis kyang /
translated: The meaning is that one should complete the form of Locanā, etc.

original: gzhon nu ma'i sgrub pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i sgrub pa shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should know the practice of the maiden with the form of Māmakī, etc.

original: bskrad pa'i cho ga'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: bskrad pa'i cho ga'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: Having taken up the rite of summoning, he says:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi 'da' ba nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir dam tshig gi 'od zer ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi 'da' ba nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir dam tshig gi 'od zer ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The pledge ray is Akshobhya, because he is the very essence of the gnosis of the pledge which is never transgressed, and because he is the very essence of the utterly pure gnosis which is naturally radiant.

original: de nyid gdug pa thams cad 'dul ba'i phyir mchog ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i khro bo ste /
analyzed: de nyid gdug pa thams cad 'dul ba'i phyir mchog ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i khro bo ste /
translated: That very [Akshobhya] is the supreme wrathful one, Amṛtakuṇḍali, because he subdues all evildoers.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samadhi focused on him is called that.

original: sngags rnams kun gyi sbyor ba dang // zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa dang mngon spyod kyi las rnams ni /
analyzed: sngags rnams kun gyi sbyor ba dang // zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa dang mngon spyod kyi las rnams ni /
translated: The application of all mantras refers to the activities of pacification, enrichment, power, summoning, and destruction.

original: 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba'i bsam pa'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba'i bsam pa'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are to be accomplished by the specific intentions of the application of this [samadhi].

original: cho ga bzhin du skrod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du skrod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Expelling according to the rite means:

original: cho ga ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: cho ga ni 'di yin te /
translated: The rite is as follows:

original: bsnyen pa byas pa sngon du song ba bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sbyor pas dur khrod kyi me la myos byed kyi shing bsregs pa'i sol ba dang / dri ma dang / dug dang / nim pa'i lo ma rnams btags nas rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis lhan cig tu byas nas bya rog chen po'i sgro'i smyu gus rgyal mtshan gyi ras la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la rtsi bas brgyad pa'i ral gri'i 'khor lor bris nas de'i lte ba🔽la bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas te /
analyzed: bsnyen pa byas pa sngon du song ba bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sbyor pas dur khrod kyi me la myos byed kyi shing bsregs pa'i sol ba dang / dri ma dang / dug dang / nim pa'i lo ma rnams btags nas rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis lhan cig tu byas nas bya rog chen po'i sgro'i smyu gus rgyal mtshan gyi ras la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la rtsi bas brgyad pa'i ral gri'i 'khor lor bris nas de'i lte ba la bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas te /
translated: Having written the wheel of the sword on the cloth of the banner with the pen of the wing of a great crow, one should draw the effigy of the victim in the center of the wheel.

original: de'i snying gar bsgrub bya'i ming dang / spel @242b ba'i sngags bris nas rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo'i lte ba'i 'jim pa dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i rdul dang / lam bzhi mdo'i 'dag pa rnams kyis gzugs byas nas de'i snying gar gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i snying gar bsgrub bya'i ming dang / spel @242b ba'i sngags bris nas rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo'i lte ba'i 'jim pa dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i rdul dang / lam bzhi mdo'i 'dag pa rnams kyis gzugs byas nas de'i snying gar gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should write the name of the victim and the augmenting mantra in his heart, and having made an effigy with the clay of the center of the potter’s wheel, the dust of the victim’s feet, and the excrement of the crossroads, one should insert it in his heart.

original: de nas thod pa'i nang du bcug la dgug pa sngon du song bas che ge mo au tsa ta ya zhes bya ba'i bskul tshig dang bcas pa'i sngags kyi phreng ba brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas nas /
analyzed: de nas thod pa'i nang du bcug la dgug pa sngon du song bas che ge mo au tsa ta ya zhes bya ba'i bskul tshig dang bcas pa'i sngags kyi phreng ba brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas nas /
translated: Then, having placed it in the skull, one should enchant it one hundred and eight times with the mantra string together with the urging statement “Summon so-and-so!”

original: ma mo'i khang pa dang / lam bzhi mdo dang dur khrod du sba bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma mo'i khang pa dang / lam bzhi mdo dang dur khrod du sba bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having placed it in the skull, one should bury it in the house of a mother-goddess, at a crossroads, or in a charnel ground, having previously summoned it with the recitation of the mantra string one hundred and eight times, along with the invocation “So-and-so, come!”

original: bsgrub par bya ba yang ji lta ba'i gnas su bzhag ste yi ge yam las byung ba rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rnga mo la zhon pa /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yang ji lta ba'i gnas su bzhag ste yi ge yam las byung ba rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rnga mo la zhon pa /
translated: The one to be exorcised should be placed in the same place, and one should visualize him mounted on a camel standing on a wind mandala arisen from the syllable yaṃ,

original: rgyab nas lag nas dbyug to thogs pa'i skyes bus lho phyogs su bdas par bsgoms na nges par bskrad par 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas dag gi dpung dag kyang //
analyzed: rgyab nas lag nas dbyug to thogs pa'i skyes bus lho phyogs su bdas par bsgoms na nges par bskrad par 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas dag gi dpung dag kyang //
translated: being chased to the south by a man who follows behind and strikes him with a club. He will certainly be exorcised.🔽Even the hosts of Buddhas

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor pa'i tshogs dag kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor pa'i tshogs dag kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means even the hosts of yogins of the Buddhas.

original: 'byung po tshar bcad pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'byung po tshar bcad pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The rite for destroying bhūtas is stated:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ste dga' ba rgyas par byed pa ni rin po che ste ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ste dga' ba rgyas par byed pa ni rin po che ste ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid ni rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra is the nature of the five intuitions.

original: de nyid rtog ste gang la mi bskyod pa'i mtshan ma yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rtog ste gang la mi bskyod pa'i mtshan ma yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That itself is the concept, and it is called that because it has the sign of Akshobhya.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'od zer rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid rdo rje 'od zer rnams te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'od zer rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid rdo rje 'od zer rnams te //
translated: The vajra light rays of the buddhas are the vajra light rays of buddhahood itself.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i khro bo'i ngo bo gang la yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i khro bo'i ngo bo gang la yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samadhi that has the nature of the invincible wrath is called that.

original: las rnams cho ga bzhin du byed //
analyzed: las rnams cho ga bzhin du byed //
translated: One should perform the rites according to the rite.

original: ces bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te srin po la sogs pas bzung bar shes nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te srin po la sogs pas bzung bar shes nas /
translated: This is what is said: having recognized that one is seized by rakshasas and so forth,

original: rang gzhan gyi mi thub pa'i rnal 'byor du dmigs te /
analyzed: rang gzhan gyi mi thub pa'i rnal 'byor du dmigs te /
translated: one should visualize oneself and others as the invincible yogin.

original: srung ba yang byas nas /
analyzed: srung ba yang byas nas /
translated: And having performed the protection,

original: de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin du de bkug nas bsgrub bya'i lus la bcug ste bcings nas cho ga bzhin du sna tshogs rdo rjes mnan nas yi ge h'um las byung ba rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje gnyis kyis logs gnyis nas btsir bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin du de bkug nas bsgrub bya'i lus la bcug ste bcings nas cho ga bzhin du sna tshogs rdo rjes mnan nas yi ge h'um las byung ba rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje gnyis kyis logs gnyis nas btsir bar bya'o //
translated: At that time, having summoned him in the proper way, one should place him in the body of the victim, bind him, and press him down with a crossed vajra according to the rite. One should crush him with two five-pronged vajras arisen from the syllable hūṃ, from the two sides.

original: shin tu 'jigs pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor 'phro ba dag gis bsgrub bya'i snying ga dang lkog mar sreg par blta'o //
analyzed: shin tu 'jigs pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor 'phro ba dag gis bsgrub bya'i snying ga dang lkog mar sreg par blta'o //
translated: One should see the victim’s heart and throat being burned by the emission of a terrifying mass of fire.

original: shin tu 'bar ba dang bcas pa'i h'um las bskyed pa'i rdo rje dang 'dra ba yungs kar gyi rgyal po la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas nges par @243a * //
analyzed: shin tu 'bar ba dang bcas pa'i h'um las bskyed pa'i rdo rje dang 'dra ba yungs kar gyi rgyal po la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas nges par @243a * //
translated: One should imagine that the victim’s body is pierced by mustard seed-like vajras arisen from the syllable hūṃ, blazing with great flames.

original: phug pa'i lus su bltas nas nga rgyal dang ldan pas sngags bzlas pa sngon du song bas nges par brdegs na gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phug pa'i lus su bltas nas nga rgyal dang ldan pas sngags bzlas pa sngon du song bas nges par brdegs na gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen the body pierced, one should recite the mantra with pride. Having recited the mantra beforehand, one should definitely strike. He will be released.

original: lag pa gnyis su h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba bsgoms nas bzung ba'i lus la srin po la sogs pa bkug nas rdo rje gnyis kyi dbus su bcug ste de'i 'od zer gyis bsreg pa dang ldan pa yang lag pa gnyis kar sbyar bas shin tu
analyzed: lag pa gnyis su h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba bsgoms nas bzung ba'i lus la srin po la sogs pa bkug nas rdo rje gnyis kyi dbus su bcug ste de'i 'od zer gyis bsreg pa dang ldan pa yang lag pa gnyis kar sbyar bas shin tu
translated: Having meditated on blazing vajras arisen from hūṃ in both hands, one holds them, and having summoned rākṣasas, and so on, to one’s body, one inserts them between the two vajras and burns them with the light rays of the vajras.🔽

original: mnye zhing sngags bzlas so zhes la la dag 'dod do //
analyzed: mnye zhing sngags bzlas so zhes la la dag 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that one meditates on blazing vajras arisen from hūṃ in both hands, holds them, summons rākṣasas, and so on, to the body, inserts them in the middle of the two vajras, and through the blazing of their light, one rubs the body with the two hands and recites the mantra.

original: rkang pas sam brang gis kyang mnye bar bya'o zhes la la dag 'dod do //
analyzed: rkang pas sam brang gis kyang mnye bar bya'o zhes la la dag 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that one rubs the body with the feet or the chest.

original: yang na de nyid kyis de 'dzin par 'dod na de'i cho de nyid kyi sbyor ba nag pos nag po'i phyogs dag gis gang yang rung ba'i nyi ma la sol bas gsher ba'i gos bgos te /
analyzed: yang na de nyid kyis de 'dzin par 'dod na de'i cho de nyid kyi sbyor ba nag pos nag po'i phyogs dag gis gang yang rung ba'i nyi ma la sol bas gsher ba'i gos bgos te /
translated: If one wishes to hold him with that, one should apply the method of that, wearing clothes moistened with soot on any day of the dark fortnight with the yoga of the dark one.

original: shin tu khro bas gsal shing gis phug pa dang / mtshon gyis bsad pa dang / dbyangs pa'i thod pa la dur khrod kyi sol ba la h'um las byung ba shin tu rno ba'i mche ba gtsigs pa'i thod pa'i rgyan dang / khro bo dang bcas pa skra gyen du 'khyil ba lag pa g-yas pas phyar nas gri gug 'dzin pa lag pa g-yon pas mi'i thod pa dang sdigs mdzub byed pa bris te /🔽dur khrod kyi sol ba dang ro bsregs pa'i thal ba dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i rdul dang / lhan cig pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar sngar gyi bzhin du sngags ta la'i lo ma la bris nas gzhug ste /
analyzed: shin tu khro bas gsal shing gis phug pa dang / mtshon gyis bsad pa dang / dbyangs pa'i thod pa la dur khrod kyi sol ba la h'um las byung ba shin tu rno ba'i mche ba gtsigs pa'i thod pa'i rgyan dang / khro bo dang bcas pa skra gyen du 'khyil ba lag pa g-yas pas phyar nas gri gug 'dzin pa lag pa g-yon pas mi'i thod pa dang sdigs mdzub byed pa bris te / dur khrod kyi sol ba dang ro bsregs pa'i thal ba dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i rdul dang / lhan cig pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar sngar gyi bzhin du sngags ta la'i lo ma la bris nas gzhug ste /
translated: One should draw a very wrathful one, with a flaying knife in his right hand, holding a human skin and a threatening forefinger with his left hand, his hair matted upward, with a garland of dry skulls and a crown of live ones, with very sharp fangs, and with a wrathful face, impaled on a stake through his anus, and killed by a weapon, with charnel ground ashes from the syllable hūṃ, in the heart of the effigy of the victim, as before, having written the mantra on a palm leaf.🔽One should place it in the heart of the effigy together with charnel ground ash, burnt bone, and dust from the feet of the victim,

original: drug dang lan tshva dang ske tshe la sogs pas byugs pa'i gzugs thod pa gnyis pa'i nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: drug dang lan tshva dang ske tshe la sogs pas byugs pa'i gzugs thod pa gnyis pa'i nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: and place it in the second skull cup, smeared with the five impurities, black mustard seed, and so on.

original: gnyis ka yang dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas bris pa'i thod pa de'i stang du mgo thur du bstan la de zin pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas bris pa'i thod pa de'i stang du mgo thur du bstan la de zin pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having summoned both [the victim and the poison] and so on, one should imagine that the skull is filled with the head of the victim, with its face turned downward.

original: bsgrub bya srin po dang bcas pa de /
analyzed: bsgrub bya srin po dang bcas pa de /
translated: Having placed the victim, together with the demon,

original: rkang pas mnan par byas la dur khrod du nam phyed na shin tu che ba'i nga rgyal byas nas sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: rkang pas mnan par byas la dur khrod du nam phyed na shin tu che ba'i nga rgyal byas nas sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: under one's foot, one should recite the mantra at midnight in a charnel ground, with a very great pride.

original: des 'di 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des 'di 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one will be seized by the demon.

original: 'di nyid kyi rab tu sbyor bas rims la sogs pas kyang 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rab tu sbyor bas rims la sogs pas kyang 'dzin par byed do //
translated: By this very application, one will also be seized by fever and so on.

original: dug la sogs pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: dug la sogs pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: For the purpose of pacifying poison and so on, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshe dpag tu med pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshe dpag tu med pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: Then and so on. Amitāyus is Amitābha.

original: de las byung ba ni rta mgrin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni rta mgrin no //
translated: What arises from that is Hayagrīva.

original: mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: Because it is indivisible, it is a vajra.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la @243b yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la @243b yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samādhi that focuses on that is also called that.

original: ye shes rgyal po zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes rgyal po zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The knowledge king is Amitābha.

original: las thams cad pa nyid yin yang /
analyzed: las thams cad pa nyid yin yang /
translated: Although it is the universal agent,

original: las kyi gtso bo re zhig gsungs pa nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las kyi gtso bo re zhig gsungs pa nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la /
translated: the principal action is taught for the time being.

original: sman pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i dug gi khyad bar nyid ha la ha la'i dug go //
analyzed: sman pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i dug gi khyad bar nyid ha la ha la'i dug go //
translated: The particular poison that is not the domain of the physician is the poison of hala hala.

original: dug rnams thams cad med par byed //
analyzed: dug rnams thams cad med par byed //
translated: It makes all poisons disappear.

original: ces bya ba la 'di'i cho ga ni ji lta ba bzhin du rta mgrin gyi sbyor ba dkar pos byas nas dug sad par bya ba'i phyir du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'di'i cho ga ni ji lta ba bzhin du rta mgrin gyi sbyor ba dkar pos byas nas dug sad par bya ba'i phyir du gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the rite is performed by the white union of Hayagriva, as it is taught, in order to revive the poison.

original: bsgrub bya'i snying gar yi ge h'um ngam phreng ba'i sngags nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ste zla ba zhes bya bar la la dag 'dod do ;
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i snying gar yi ge h'um ngam phreng ba'i sngags nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ste zla ba zhes bya bar la la dag 'dod do ;
translated: Some assert that the mantra string is on a sun mandala at the heart of the victim, or on a moon.

original: / de'i steng du gnas pa'i h'um dkar po ste thur dur kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: / de'i steng du gnas pa'i h'um dkar po ste thur dur kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say that the white hum is above that, facing downward.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis der lus la song ba'i dug sbar nas lag pa g-yon pa la'am /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis der lus la song ba'i dug sbar nas lag pa g-yon pa la'am /
translated: The light rays of that hum draw out the poison that has gone into the body of the victim and place it in the left hand.

original: la la dag lag pa g-yas pa la zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: la la dag lag pa g-yas pa la zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that it is placed in the right hand.

original: yi ge bam las byung ba'i padma dkar po 'dab ma brgyad pa de'i dbus su ;
analyzed: yi ge bam las byung ba'i padma dkar po 'dab ma brgyad pa de'i dbus su ;
translated: From the syllable vaṃ arises an eight-petaled white lotus, in the center of which is

original: yi ge h'um dkar po'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'i bdud rtsi 'dzag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um dkar po'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'i bdud rtsi 'dzag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: a white syllable hūṃ, from which nectar trickles, together with light rays.

original: gzhan ni zla ba'i 'od zer gyi dbus su /
analyzed: gzhan ni zla ba'i 'od zer gyi dbus su /
translated: The other [syllable] is in the middle of the moon’s light rays.

original: aom hri:ha:h'um dza:phu: zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di bkod pa'am /
analyzed: aom hri:ha:h'um dza:phu: zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di bkod pa'am /
translated: This mantra is arranged: oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ jaḥ phuḥ.

original: ha'i yi ge bsgom zhes nye bar ston to //
analyzed: ha'i yi ge bsgom zhes nye bar ston to //
translated: It is taught that one should meditate on the syllable ha.

original: de nas phreng ba'i sngags sam /
analyzed: de nas phreng ba'i sngags sam /
translated: Then, having recited the garland mantra

original: aom hri: ha:h'um dza:phu: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod nas nyal ba'i mgo nas brtsams nas rkang pa'i bar du bya ba par bya ste /
analyzed: aom hri: ha:h'um dza:phu: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod nas nyal ba'i mgo nas brtsams nas rkang pa'i bar du bya ba par bya ste /
translated: oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ jaḥ phuḥ, one should lie down, beginning from the head to the feet.

original: de la lag pa la bkod pa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer dag gis dug gis bzung ba bsdus nas nag po'i spros pas dug gzhan du 'phos pa nyid kyis dkar por bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de la lag pa la bkod pa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer dag gis dug gis bzung ba bsdus nas nag po'i spros pas dug gzhan du 'phos pa nyid kyis dkar por bsgom par bya'o //
translated: There, the light rays from the seed syllables arranged on the hands gather the poison, and one should meditate on it as white, due to the transference of the other poison by the black smoke.

original: yang na de nyid kyi sbyor bas de'i ming spang leb dkar po la ham dang sa spel nas bris te /
analyzed: yang na de nyid kyi sbyor bas de'i ming spang leb dkar po la ham dang sa spel nas bris te /
translated: Or else, by that very method, one should write his name on a white birch bark leaf, alternating ha and sa,

original: so sor yi ge re re la nang du bcug na skad cig gcig gis dug med par byed do //
analyzed: so sor yi ge re re la nang du bcug na skad cig gcig gis dug med par byed do //
translated: If one inserts each of the syllables individually, it will render the poison powerless in an instant.

original: yang na mgo bo la yi ge hri bkod de bdud rtsi'i tshogs kyi 'o ma sbrengs pas kha dog sngon po'i dug ma lus pa bcom nas bsgrub par bya ba'i lus bltas nas phreng ba'i sngags yang dang yang bzlas na dug med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na mgo bo la yi ge hri bkod de bdud rtsi'i tshogs kyi 'o ma sbrengs pas kha dog sngon po'i dug ma lus pa bcom nas bsgrub par bya ba'i lus bltas nas phreng ba'i sngags yang dang yang bzlas na dug med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, having arranged the syllable hrīḥ on the head, one should visualize the body of the person to be benefited, and having destroyed all the blue-colored poisons with the stream of milk of the assembly of nectars, one should look at it and repeat the garland mantra again and again. The poison will be rendered powerless.

original: rengs par bya ba'i ched du phreng ba'i sngags kyi yi ge nyid kyis bcings nas mgo bo la sogs bar kha dog ser po dgod do //
analyzed: rengs par bya ba'i ched du phreng ba'i sngags kyi yi ge nyid kyis bcings nas mgo bo la sogs bar kha dog ser po dgod do //
translated: For the purpose of paralyzing, having bound with the syllables of the garland mantra, one should visualize a yellow color on the head and so forth.

original: phreng ba la ni me'i sa bon @244a * //
analyzed: phreng ba la ni me'i sa bon @244a * //
translated: The seed syllable of fire is on the garland.

original: sbrul gyis nang du zos pa'i gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sbrul gyis nang du zos pa'i gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the place where the snake has swallowed, as it is.

original: aom ni dang po tsheg drag mtha' //
analyzed: aom ni dang po tsheg drag mtha' //
translated: Om is at the beginning, and kṣa is at the end.

original: ha tha'i cho ga bzhin du sbyar //
analyzed: ha tha'i cho ga bzhin du sbyar //
translated: One should apply ha tha according to the rite.

original: dug ni 'ching bar byed pa ste //
analyzed: dug ni 'ching bar byed pa ste //
translated: The poison is bound,

original: rnal 'byor pa yis gtang yang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis gtang yang ngo //
translated: even if released by the yogin.

original: sbyar ba la sogs pa bsal ba la ha'i yi ge bsgom mo //
analyzed: sbyar ba la sogs pa bsal ba la ha'i yi ge bsgom mo //
translated: For the removal of the application of the letter HA should be cultivated.

original: de bzhin du skrangs pa dang / phol mig dang / sdom gyis bzung ba la sogs par yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skrangs pa dang / phol mig dang / sdom gyis bzung ba la sogs par yang shes par bya'o //
translated: And so for swellings, boils, and the like.

original: yang dag par bsam par rig pa rnams kyis sdig pa chen po byed pa rnams thabs gzhan gyis bsgrub par mi nus pa gzhom pa'i don du snying rje chen po dang ldan pas thams cad du gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pas bya'o zhes bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa
analyzed: yang dag par bsam par rig pa rnams kyis sdig pa chen po byed pa rnams thabs gzhan gyis bsgrub par mi nus pa gzhom pa'i don du snying rje chen po dang ldan pas thams cad du gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pas bya'o zhes bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa
translated: For those who know the right reflection, the great sinners who cannot be subdued by other means, the one endowed with great compassion should do everything with the thought of helping others. This is the meaning of the verse that begins Then.

original: / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then and so on.

original: don yod ni thams cad 'grub par byed pa 'di las grub pa ste 'dir mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: don yod ni thams cad 'grub par byed pa 'di las grub pa ste 'dir mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The accomplisher is the one who accomplishes everything, who is here Akshobhya.

original: 'byung ba ni lta ba ngan pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni lta ba ngan pa las byung ba ste /
translated: The arisen is the one arisen from bad views,

original: 'joms pa'i phyir tog bzhin du dbal gyis dbyug sngon can no //
analyzed: 'joms pa'i phyir tog bzhin du dbal gyis dbyug sngon can no //
translated: and the vanquisher is the one who conquers with the splendor of the crest-jewel, who is here Niladriva.

original: de nyid mi phyed pa nyid kyis zhes 'di gsungs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pa nyid kyis zhes 'di gsungs pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse that begins He is indivisible.

original: bzlas pas zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi bsnyen pa'i cho gas 'bum bzlas pa byas pas so //
analyzed: bzlas pas zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi bsnyen pa'i cho gas 'bum bzlas pa byas pas so //
translated: By means of recitation means by means of the rite of the prior approximation, having done the recitation of 100,000.

original: brgya rtsa brgyad ces bya ba ni gsod pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad ces bya ba ni gsod pa'i dus su'o //
translated: The 108 is at the time of killing.

original: cho ga tshul bzhin bskul ba zhes bya ba ni 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: cho ga tshul bzhin bskul ba zhes bya ba ni 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: The proper rite is as follows:

original: ji lta ba bzhin du dbyug pa sngon po can gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas dug dang khrag dang ske tshe dang / rams dang tshva dang / tsha ba gsum dang aa ri ta'i lo ma'i khu ba rnams kyis dur khrod kyi ras la mi'i rus pa'i smyu gus sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus su gnas pa me'i dkyil 'khor la bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel ba'i sngags bris nas dur khrod kyi sol ba dang /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du dbyug pa sngon po can gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas dug dang khrag dang ske tshe dang / rams dang tshva dang / tsha ba gsum dang aa ri ta'i lo ma'i khu ba rnams kyis dur khrod kyi ras la mi'i rus pa'i smyu gus sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus su gnas pa me'i dkyil 'khor la bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel ba'i sngags bris nas dur khrod kyi sol ba dang /
translated: One should write on charnel ground cloth with a human bone pen, in the center of a variegated vajra, on a fire mandala, the mantra with the name of the victim inserted, with poison, blood, black mustard seed, red arsenic, salt, and the three pungent roots, and with the juice of the leaves of the arita plant, and then, with the application of the blue club, one should burn it in a fire of charnel ground wood, and one should recite the mantra until the victim dies.

original: sha chen dang / grog mkhar gyi sa dang / phub ma dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i rdul dag gis gzugs brnyan byas la de'i snying gar bris pa'i 'khrul 'khor bcug nas dgug pa la sogs pa sngon du song bas thod pa kha sbyar byas la rkang pa g-yon pas mnan pa shin tu 'khrugs pas rus pa dang rdo ba dang
analyzed: sha chen dang / grog mkhar gyi sa dang / phub ma dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang pa'i rdul dag gis gzugs brnyan byas la de'i snying gar bris pa'i 'khrul 'khor bcug nas dgug pa la sogs pa sngon du song bas thod pa kha sbyar byas la rkang pa g-yon pas mnan pa shin tu 'khrugs pas rus pa dang rdo ba dang
translated: With great agitation, crush the bones, stones,

original: / aa ri ta'i lo ma 'cha' zhing nyi ma phyed dam nam phyed na dur khrod du gnas te /
analyzed: / aa ri ta'i lo ma 'cha' zhing nyi ma phyed dam nam phyed na dur khrod du gnas te /
translated: and ariṭa leaves, and at noon or midnight stay in a charnel ground.

original: bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pa khro ba'i tshig gis @244b sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pa khro ba'i tshig gis @244b sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Recite the mantra with words of entreaty and angry words.

original: de ltar byas na nyi ma bdun gyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na nyi ma bdun gyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do it this way, [the victim] will die in seven days.

original: gal te 'dis shi bar ma gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'dis shi bar ma gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: If he does not die by this,

original: dur khrod du phyin nas nam phyed na dur khrod kyi thal bas gru gsum gyi me thab byas nas /
analyzed: dur khrod du phyin nas nam phyed na dur khrod kyi thal bas gru gsum gyi me thab byas nas /
translated: then go to a charnel ground and at midnight make a hearth of a triangle with charnel ground ash.

original: der ji ltar rnyed pa'i shing ngam /
analyzed: der ji ltar rnyed pa'i shing ngam /
translated: There, with whatever wood you find,

original: nim pa ka'i shing rnams kyis me rab tu sbar te /
analyzed: nim pa ka'i shing rnams kyis me rab tu sbar te /
translated: Having made a fire with nimba wood,

original: dgug pa la sogs pa sngon du song ba de'i dbus su zhal 'gyur ba khro bo'i rgyal po rnam par bsams nas bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs brnyan byas nas rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dgug pa la sogs pa sngon du song ba de'i dbus su zhal 'gyur ba khro bo'i rgyal po rnam par bsams nas bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs brnyan byas nas rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung nas brtsams te /
translated: having performed the preliminary rites of summoning and so on, having visualized in the center of that fire the king of wrathful ones with a contorted face, having made an effigy of the victim, having cut it to pieces with a sharp weapon, beginning from the little toe of the left foot,

original: mtshon rnon pos bcad cing che ge mo sod cig ces bskul ba dang bcas pa'i sngags 'don cing de'i zhal du khro ba dang bcas pa'i sbyin sreg byas na nges par de nyid kyi nub mor dgra 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshon rnon pos bcad cing che ge mo sod cig ces bskul ba dang bcas pa'i sngags 'don cing de'i zhal du khro ba dang bcas pa'i sbyin sreg byas na nges par de nyid kyi nub mor dgra 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and having recited the mantra together with the incantation “Kill so-and-so,” if one performs the fire sacrifice with wrathful intent into the mouth of that [fire], then the enemy will certainly die that very night.

original: grub pa gnyis med sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: grub pa gnyis med sbyor ba yis //
translated: The union of the two accomplishments is

original: 'dir ni thams cad nyid du dran //
analyzed: 'dir ni thams cad nyid du dran //
translated: here remembered as everything.

original: de ltar de nyid nga zhes bya //
analyzed: de ltar de nyid nga zhes bya //
translated: Thus, that is called “I.”

original: gang gi grub byed de ni blo //
analyzed: gang gi grub byed de ni blo //
translated: That which accomplishes it is the mind.

original: mos pa gtso bor byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mos pa gtso bor byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the predominance of devotion,

original: ji bzhin 'di kun thams cad 'dod //
analyzed: ji bzhin 'di kun thams cad 'dod //
