translated: all of this is desired just as it is.

original: chad par 'gyur ba thams cad dang // rnal 'byor pa yis myur du 'grub //
analyzed: chad par 'gyur ba thams cad dang // rnal 'byor pa yis myur du 'grub //
translated: All the curses and the yogi's quick success.

original: char ba mi 'bab pa yang char pa dbab pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: char ba mi 'bab pa yang char pa dbab pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: Also, with regard to the absence of rain, it is said, taking control of the rain.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs ba la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs ba la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: kun nas sprin bzhin du sprin mi bskyod pa'o //🔽de la dpal gang gi yin pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas sprin bzhin du sprin mi bskyod pa'o // de la dpal gang gi yin pa ste /
translated: The cloud-like Akṣobhya is the cloud.

original: kun tu sprin gyi dpal ni stobs po che'o //
analyzed: kun tu sprin gyi dpal ni stobs po che'o //
translated: The glory of that is the glory of the cloud, which is Mahābala.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The samādhi that focuses on that is called the glory of the cloud.

original: chu yi dkyil 'khor 'bebs par byed //🔽ces bya ba la 'di'i cho ga ni ji lta ba bzhin du khro bo chen po stobs po che'i sbyor bas mtshan ma ma byung ba'i bar du sngar bsnyen pa byas pas sems brtan po'i stobs po che'i sbyor bas so ma btang ba'i kham phor la rams kyi
analyzed: chu yi dkyil 'khor 'bebs par byed // ces bya ba la 'di'i cho ga ni ji lta ba bzhin du khro bo chen po stobs po che'i sbyor bas mtshan ma ma byung ba'i bar du sngar bsnyen pa byas pas sems brtan po'i stobs po che'i sbyor bas so ma btang ba'i kham phor la rams kyi
translated: It is said, it causes the water maṇḍala to fall.

original: khu bas ral gri'i 'khor lo'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bri bar byas nas te /
analyzed: khu bas ral gri'i 'khor lo'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bri bar byas nas te /
translated: Here, the procedure is that, by the method of the wrathful Mahābala, one should perform the prior approximation until the signs arise. With the method of the firm-minded Mahābala, one should draw an eight-petaled lotus in the center of a sword cakra on an unbroken clay bowl with the juice of turmeric.

original: la la dag rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la dag rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is a five-pointed vajra.

original: de'i steng du ral pa gcig ma'i sngags dus dang rjes su mthun pa bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang spel nas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du ral pa gcig ma'i sngags dus dang rjes su mthun pa bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang spel nas bri bar bya'o //
translated: On top of that, one should write the mantra of Ekajaṭī, Oṃ nīlāmbāyai svāhā, along with the name of the person to be accomplished, in accordance with the time.

original: de bzhin du rnam par rgyal ba sgrub pa'i rgyud chen po las /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par rgyal ba sgrub pa'i rgyud chen po las /
translated: Similarly, the great Tantra of the Accomplishment of Jayā states:

original: dbyar zla tha chungs stobs kyi rgyu //🔽ston zlar ba dung skyong ngo //
analyzed: dbyar zla tha chungs stobs kyi rgyu // ston zlar ba dung skyong ngo //
translated: The last summer month is the period of Varuṇa.🔽The first autumn month is the period of Śaṅkhapāla.

original: @245a * // ston zla 'bring po 'jog por shes //
analyzed: @245a * // ston zla 'bring po 'jog por shes //
translated: The middle autumn month is known as the period of Takṣaka.

original: ston zla tha chungs nor rgyas so //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs nor rgyas so //
translated: The last autumn month is the period of Vāsuki.

original: zhes so // 'di nyid dpyid zla ra ba la sogs pa rnams la go rims bzhin du char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes so // 'di nyid dpyid zla ra ba la sogs pa rnams la go rims bzhin du char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the period of rain in the first spring month, and so on, in sequence.

original: de nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid du gsungs so //
translated: It is stated in that very text:

original: de las gzhan pa'i kham phor so ma btang ba dang / de kha sbyar nas srad bu sngon pos kun du bcings te //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i kham phor so ma btang ba dang / de kha sbyar nas srad bu sngon pos kun du bcings te //
translated: One should take another unfired clay pot, and having joined the two mouths together, tie it all around with a blue thread.

original: ji lta bar ni mdung can ma bkug nas mchod de bka' bsgo la klu la sogs pas brlabs pa'i chu mig tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta bar ni mdung can ma bkug nas mchod de bka' bsgo la klu la sogs pas brlabs pa'i chu mig tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: As before, having summoned Ekajaṭī, worship her and give her a command.

original: yang na ta la'i lo ma la snag tshad rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa sngags kyi tshig dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o /
analyzed: yang na ta la'i lo ma la snag tshad rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa sngags kyi tshig dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o /
translated: Then, on a palm leaf, write with vermillion the five-pointed vajra together with the mantra.

original: de'i rdo rje la me 'bar ba dang 'dra bar rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: de'i rdo rje la me 'bar ba dang 'dra bar rnam par bsams la /
translated: Visualize that vajra blazing with fire.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: From that,

original: ral pa gcig ma 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa lta bu klu thams cad shin tu bskrad par bsgoms te /
analyzed: ral pa gcig ma 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa lta bu klu thams cad shin tu bskrad par bsgoms te /
translated: imagine Ekajaṭī, who has the appearance of a single braid of hair, and meditate on her as expelling all nāgas.

original: mchod nas kye bcom ldan 'das ma bdag gis che ge mo'i dgos pa mdzad du gsol zhes bka' bsgo ba byin la klu'i chu mig tu gzhug go /
analyzed: mchod nas kye bcom ldan 'das ma bdag gis che ge mo'i dgos pa mdzad du gsol zhes bka' bsgo ba byin la klu'i chu mig tu gzhug go /
translated: Having worshipped her, give her a command, “O Blessed One, please do this and that for me.”

original: de nas char pa dbab pa'i sa la stobs po che'i sbyor ba byas nas me'i dkyil 'khor de'i dbus su rlung gi dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de nas char pa dbab pa'i sa la stobs po che'i sbyor ba byas nas me'i dkyil 'khor de'i dbus su rlung gi dkyil 'khor /
translated: Then, having performed the practice of Mahābala on the ground where rain is to fall, in the center of a maṇḍala of fire, there is a maṇḍala of wind.

original: de'i dbus su chu'i dkyil 'khor bris nas de la padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su chu'i dkyil 'khor bris nas de la padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, one should draw a water maṇḍala, and on that, an eight-petaled lotus.

original: de'i dbus su chu'i lha dkar po gdengs ka bdun gyis brgyan pa skyes bu'i gdong can ral gri dang / klu'i zhags pa lag na thogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su chu'i lha dkar po gdengs ka bdun gyis brgyan pa skyes bu'i gdong can ral gri dang / klu'i zhags pa lag na thogs pa'o //
translated: In the middle of that, one should draw white Varuṇa, adorned with seven hoods, with a human face, holding a sword and a noose in his hands.

original: shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs rnams su go rims bzhin du mtha' yas dang / nor skyong dang / 'jog po dang / stobs kyi rgyu ste ;
analyzed: shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs rnams su go rims bzhin du mtha' yas dang / nor skyong dang / 'jog po dang / stobs kyi rgyu ste ;
translated: In the east, south, west, and north, one should draw Ananta, Vāsuki, Takṣaka, and Kulika, respectively.

original: de rnams go rims bzhin du autpala bzhin sngo bsangs te /
analyzed: de rnams go rims bzhin du autpala bzhin sngo bsangs te /
translated: They are all blue like the color of a sapphire,

original: dkar po dang / dmar po dang / nag po rnams so //
analyzed: dkar po dang / dmar po dang / nag po rnams so //
translated: white, red, and black, respectively.

original: me'i mtshams dang bden bral dang / rlung dang dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma rnams la padma dang / padma chen po dang / dung skyong dang / rigs ldan rnams dkar po dang / ser skya dang ser po dang / kha dog sna tshogs rnams bri bar bya'o /
analyzed: me'i mtshams dang bden bral dang / rlung dang dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma rnams la padma dang / padma chen po dang / dung skyong dang / rigs ldan rnams dkar po dang / ser skya dang ser po dang / kha dog sna tshogs rnams bri bar bya'o /
translated: On the petals of Agni, Nirṛti, Vāyu, and Indra, one should draw Padma, Mahāpadma, Śaṅkhapāla, and Kulika, white, pale yellow, yellow, and multicolored, respectively.

original: de nas yi ge nam gyis klu thams cad rdzogs par cad pa'i rang gi sngags nga rgyal dang bcas pas bzla byas nas bu ram dang 'o ma dang / mar la sogs pa la klu la 'os pa'i lha bshos phu:'i yi ge'i sngags kyis de dbul lo //
analyzed: de nas yi ge nam gyis klu thams cad rdzogs par cad pa'i rang gi sngags nga rgyal dang bcas pas bzla byas nas bu ram dang 'o ma dang / mar la sogs pa la klu la 'os pa'i lha bshos phu:'i yi ge'i sngags kyis de dbul lo //
translated: Then, having recited the mantra of the letter Nam, which is the perfection of all nāgas, with pride, one should offer to the nāgas a bali of molasses, milk, ghee, etc., with the mantra of the letter Nam.

original: me tog sngon po de bzhin dri //
analyzed: me tog sngon po de bzhin dri //
translated: Blue flowers, likewise scent,🔽blue garments, banners,

original: gos @245b sngon po dang ba dan dang // chu sngon dag gis yongs gang ba'i //
analyzed: gos @245b sngon po dang ba dan dang // chu sngon dag gis yongs gang ba'i //
translated: and a vase filled with blue water

original: bum pa yang ni dbul bar bya //🔽zhes bya'o // sardza dang / ta ka ra dang / kun du ru dang / na kham dang / yungs kar ser po dang / klu'i me tog rnams sha ka ra dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa yang ni dbul bar bya // zhes bya'o // sardza dang / ta ka ra dang / kun du ru dang / na kham dang / yungs kar ser po dang / klu'i me tog rnams sha ka ra dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: should also be offered.🔽One should offer mustard seed, white mustard seed, and nāga flowers mixed with sugar.

original: yang na n'a ga ge sar gyi snying po sha ka ra dang bcas pa las byas pa'i spos dang / mar gyi mar me rnams la mngon par sngags shing sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na n'a ga ge sar gyi snying po sha ka ra dang bcas pa las byas pa'i spos dang / mar gyi mar me rnams la mngon par sngags shing sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Or one should offer incense made from the essence of ironwood flowers mixed with sugar, and butter lamps, empowered with the mantra.

original: de nas dza:nam dza:zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis sam yid kyis rdo rje lcags kyu spros nas klu thams cad bkug nas rang rang gi gnas su bzhugs te mchod yon dbul ba dang / yang dag par mchod nas bdag cag la dga' ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas klu chen po khyed rnams kyis char dbab tu gsol zhes gsol ba btab bo //
analyzed: de nas dza:nam dza:zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis sam yid kyis rdo rje lcags kyu spros nas klu thams cad bkug nas rang rang gi gnas su bzhugs te mchod yon dbul ba dang / yang dag par mchod nas bdag cag la dga' ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas klu chen po khyed rnams kyis char dbab tu gsol zhes gsol ba btab bo //
translated: Then, one should request them, “By the power of the Blessed One, you great nāgas, please send down rain.”

original: de nas kun du char pa 'bebs pa lhur byed par klu rnams dmigs nas char 'bebs su gzhug go //
analyzed: de nas kun du char pa 'bebs pa lhur byed par klu rnams dmigs nas char 'bebs su gzhug go //
translated: Then, one should visualize the nāgas who are intent on bringing rain and urge them to send rain.

original: bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pas sngags bzlas pas de nas char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pas sngags bzlas pas de nas char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting the mantra with the words of urging, then rain will fall.

original: de bzhin du yang char pa mi 'bebs na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang char pa mi 'bebs na /
translated: If it still does not rain,

original: mi thab zlum po de nyid du dkyil 'khor bris te /
analyzed: mi thab zlum po de nyid du dkyil 'khor bris te /
translated: one should draw the maṇḍala in that very place, the round maṇḍala without a door.

original: der bkug nas de rnams kyi lce la yi ge nam bsgoms nas yon chab la sogs pa sngon du song ba'i sbyin sreg gi chogs re zhig dang por bu ram dang / 'o ma dang mar gyi dgang blugs gsum sbyin no //
analyzed: der bkug nas de rnams kyi lce la yi ge nam bsgoms nas yon chab la sogs pa sngon du song ba'i sbyin sreg gi chogs re zhig dang por bu ram dang / 'o ma dang mar gyi dgang blugs gsum sbyin no //
translated: First one should offer three handfuls of oblations of molasses, milk, and ghee.

original: aom nam sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom nam sv'a h'a /
translated: With the mantra Om nam svāhā,

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bu ram dang / 'o ma la sogs pa sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bu ram dang / 'o ma la sogs pa sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: one should offer oblations of molasses, milk, and so forth.

original: de ltar tshim nas char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshim nas char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having thus satisfied them, they will bring rain.

original: de ltar na yang char pa mi 'bebs na rim pa 'dis chad pas bcad de /
analyzed: de ltar na yang char pa mi 'bebs na rim pa 'dis chad pas bcad de /
translated: If they still do not bring rain, one should punish them with this procedure.

original: sngar bzhin klu'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bzhin klu'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the maṇḍala of the nāgas as before.

original: 'on kyang dang por rlung gi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang dang por rlung gi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ste /
translated: However, first one should draw the wind maṇḍala.

original: rang yang blos padma'i dbus su bskal pa'i me 'bar ba'i rnam pa lta bur klu thams cad 'jigs par byed pa ji lta ba bzhin stobs po che'i rnal 'byor du byas nas klu thams cad kyi mjug ma'i tshogs thams cad g-yon brkyang ba'i zhabs kyis mnan te /
analyzed: rang yang blos padma'i dbus su bskal pa'i me 'bar ba'i rnam pa lta bur klu thams cad 'jigs par byed pa ji lta ba bzhin stobs po che'i rnal 'byor du byas nas klu thams cad kyi mjug ma'i tshogs thams cad g-yon brkyang ba'i zhabs kyis mnan te /
translated: One should also visualize oneself in the middle of a lotus, like the appearance of the fire of the aeon, terrifying all the nagas, just as it is, in the yoga of Mahakala.

original: klu'i snying po yi ge so sor bar du bcad pa'i rang gi sngags nga rgyal dang bcas pas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i snying po yi ge so sor bar du bcad pa'i rang gi sngags nga rgyal dang bcas pas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having stepped on the heads of all the nagas with one's left foot, one should recite one's own mantra with pride, with the essence of the nagas, the individual syllables, interrupted in between.

original: de nas rlung gis bskul ba'i me'i 'od zer rnams kyis padma rnying par @246a * //
analyzed: de nas rlung gis bskul ba'i me'i 'od zer rnams kyis padma rnying par @246a * //
translated: Then, by the light rays of the fire urged by the wind, one should visualize the old lotus

original: blta'o // de nas 'og nas sreg cing /
analyzed: blta'o // de nas 'og nas sreg cing /
translated: burning below and

original: steng du khro bo'i mes mnan pa shin tu nyam thag par 'gyur te chu skyug par mos par byas na klu'i tshogs nges bar char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: steng du khro bo'i mes mnan pa shin tu nyam thag par 'gyur te chu skyug par mos par byas na klu'i tshogs nges bar char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: being pressed down by the fire of the wrathful one above, becoming extremely distressed and vomiting water.

original: de ltar yang ma phebs na /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma phebs na /
translated: If even that does not bring rain,🔽one should visualize a cloth struck by weapons

original: mtshon gyis brgyab pa'i ras sam /
analyzed: mtshon gyis brgyab pa'i ras sam /
translated: Or else, a piece of cloth on which a weapon has been used.

original: dur khrod kyi ras la dug dang ske tshe dang / tsha ba'i mar khu rnams kyis rtsibs brgyad pa'i ral gri'i 'khor lo bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi ras la dug dang ske tshe dang / tsha ba'i mar khu rnams kyis rtsibs brgyad pa'i ral gri'i 'khor lo bri bar bya'o //
translated: On a cloth from a charnel ground, one should draw with poison, black mustard seed, and hot butter a wheel of an eight-spoked sword.

original: de'i lte ba la padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris nas 'dab ma re re la klu'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de'i lte ba la padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris nas 'dab ma re re la klu'i snying po'o //
translated: In its center, one should draw an eight-petaled lotus, and on each petal, the essence of the nāgas.

original: dbus su yi ge bam h'um yig dag gi nang du spel la bri bar byas nas chu bo'i phar ngos tshur ngos kyi sa 'am /
analyzed: dbus su yi ge bam h'um yig dag gi nang du spel la bri bar byas nas chu bo'i phar ngos tshur ngos kyi sa 'am /
translated: In the center, one should write the syllable vaṃ and the syllable hūṃ, and having doubled them, one should write them. Having taken earth from the near or far bank of a river,

original: klu'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i chu'i rten gyi 'dag pa dang / dur khrod dang / grog mkhar gyi sa dang / shing gcig gi rtsa ba'i sa dang bcas pas klu'i gzugs byas nas bris pa 'khrul 'khor de nyid kyi snying gar gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i chu'i rten gyi 'dag pa dang / dur khrod dang / grog mkhar gyi sa dang / shing gcig gi rtsa ba'i sa dang bcas pas klu'i gzugs byas nas bris pa 'khrul 'khor de nyid kyi snying gar gzhug par bya'o //
translated: or earth from a nāga-blessed place, or earth from a charnel ground, an anthill, or the root of a tree, one should make a nāga image and place the written wheel in its heart.

original: dgug pa'i de ma thag tu shin tu 'bar ba'i bskal pa'i me dang 'dra pa'i stobs po che'i rnal 'byor byas pas klu'i gzugs brnyan rkang pa g-yon pas mnan nas sngar bzhin du nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i sngags bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgug pa'i de ma thag tu shin tu 'bar ba'i bskal pa'i me dang 'dra pa'i stobs po che'i rnal 'byor byas pas klu'i gzugs brnyan rkang pa g-yon pas mnan nas sngar bzhin du nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i sngags bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra with pride, as before, pressing down with one’s left foot on the image of the nāga.

original: nam mkha'i ngos la yang thams cad du klu'i rigs kyis 'khrigs pa chu'i rgyun chen po 'bebs par bsams na char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngos la yang thams cad du klu'i rigs kyis 'khrigs pa chu'i rgyun chen po 'bebs par bsams na char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one visualizes a great rain of water falling everywhere in the sky, filled with the types of nāgas, it will rain.

original: des kyang char pa mi 'bebs na de'i tshe klu'i gzugs brnyan nyid tsha ba gsum dang / ske tshe la sogs pas byug par byas nas me thab gru gsum gyi drung du bzhag la dur khrod kyi shing la me spar nas shin tu khros pas sngags brgya rtsa brgyad kyis yang dang yang du bzlas pa'i yungs kar brdegs na nges par char pa 'bebs par
analyzed: des kyang char pa mi 'bebs na de'i tshe klu'i gzugs brnyan nyid tsha ba gsum dang / ske tshe la sogs pas byug par byas nas me thab gru gsum gyi drung du bzhag la dur khrod kyi shing la me spar nas shin tu khros pas sngags brgya rtsa brgyad kyis yang dang yang du bzlas pa'i yungs kar brdegs na nges par char pa 'bebs par
translated: If it still does not rain, then at that time one should smear the image of the nāga with the three pungent substances, mustard seed, etc., place it in front of a triangular hearth, light a fire with charnel ground wood, and, with intense anger, strike it with mustard seed enchanted one hundred and eight times with the mantra.

original: 'gyur ro // de nas kyang char pa mi 'bab na de'i tshe klu'i gzugs 'di nyid ske tshe dang / tshva dang / dug dang / myos byed kyi shing las byas pa las seng ldeng gi phur pa sor dgu pas snying gar btab nas rkang pa g-yon pas mgo bo mnan te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de nas kyang char pa mi 'bab na de'i tshe klu'i gzugs 'di nyid ske tshe dang / tshva dang / dug dang / myos byed kyi shing las byas pa las seng ldeng gi phur pa sor dgu pas snying gar btab nas rkang pa g-yon pas mgo bo mnan te /
translated: If it does not rain even after that, then at that time, one should make an effigy of the nāga from black mustard, salt, poison, and intoxicating wood, and with a khaḍga stake of nine fingerbreadths, one should stab the heart.🔽One should press down on the head with the left foot, face south or west, and crush it.

original: lho phyogs su kha bltas pa 'am nub phyogs su kha bltas pas btsir bas char pa 'bab pa'i tshul gyi me thab gru gsum du dur khrod kyi me phu yig gis sbar te /
analyzed: lho phyogs su kha bltas pa 'am nub phyogs su kha bltas pas btsir bas char pa 'bab pa'i tshul gyi me thab gru gsum du dur khrod kyi me phu yig gis sbar te /
translated: One should light a funeral pyre fire in a triangular hearth with charnel ground kindling.🔽In the middle of that, one should visualize Bhagavān Mahābala, and with the yoga of wrath, one should offer into his mouth, marked with hūṃ on the tongue, the entire effigy, and recite the mantra.

original: de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das stobs po che bsgoms nas de'i zhal du lce la h'um gis mtshan @246b pa la khro bo'i rnal 'byor gyis 'chol ba dang mtha' dag sngags bzlas shing mjug ma nas brtsams te mtshon rnon pos gtub cing gtub cing brgya rtsa brgyad kyi
analyzed: de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das stobs po che bsgoms nas de'i zhal du lce la h'um gis mtshan @246b pa la khro bo'i rnal 'byor gyis 'chol ba dang mtha' dag sngags bzlas shing mjug ma nas brtsams te mtshon rnon pos gtub cing gtub cing brgya rtsa brgyad kyi
translated: Beginning from the tail, one should cut it with a sharp weapon, and offer it in the fire one hundred and eight times.

original: bar du sbyin sreg byas na char pa 'bebs so //
analyzed: bar du sbyin sreg byas na char pa 'bebs so //
translated: If one performs the homa, it will rain.

original: de ltar na yang char pa mi 'bab na stobs po che'i nyes pa yin par shes nas rang gnod mdzes kyi rnal 'byor du byas nas ske tshe la sogs pa las stobs po che'i gzugs brnyan byas te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang char pa mi 'bab na stobs po che'i nyes pa yin par shes nas rang gnod mdzes kyi rnal 'byor du byas nas ske tshe la sogs pa las stobs po che'i gzugs brnyan byas te /
translated: If it still does not rain, knowing that it is the fault of Maheśvara, one should perform the yoga of pleasing him, and make an effigy of Maheśvara from mustard seed, and so on.

original: rkang pas mnan nas rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rkang pas mnan nas rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung nas brtsams te /
translated: Having trampled it with one's feet, beginning with the little toe of the left foot,

original: de bzhin du gtub cing gtub cing mngon spyod kyi thab khung na gnas pa'i gnod mdzes kyi zhal du sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtub cing gtub cing mngon spyod kyi thab khung na gnas pa'i gnod mdzes kyi zhal du sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: one should cut it up and cut it up, and offer it into the fire in the hearth of fierce action, into the mouth of Sumbha.

original: de bzhin du khri phrag gcig tu sbyin sreg byas na stobs po ches nges par char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du khri phrag gcig tu sbyin sreg byas na stobs po ches nges par char pa 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs the burnt offering in that way one hundred thousand times, Maheśvara will certainly cause it to rain.

original: char pa chad par 'dod na klu la sogs pa rnams zhi ba'i don du zhi ba'i thab khung du spyan ma ji lta ba bzhin du bsgoms nas zhi ba'i cho gas mar dang 'o ma la sogs pa dang ldan pas sbyin sreg khri bya'o //
analyzed: char pa chad par 'dod na klu la sogs pa rnams zhi ba'i don du zhi ba'i thab khung du spyan ma ji lta ba bzhin du bsgoms nas zhi ba'i cho gas mar dang 'o ma la sogs pa dang ldan pas sbyin sreg khri bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to stop the rain, for the sake of appeasing the nāgas and so on, one should meditate on Locanā in the hearth of pacification, and perform a burnt offering of ghee, milk, and so on, with the rite of pacification one hundred thousand times.

original: gal te klu gdug pa rnams char pa gcod par mi byed na de'i tshe sngar gsungs pa'i mngon spyod kyi thab khung du mngon spyod kyi cho gas dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phul ba'i me tog rnying pa dang / ras bal gyi sa bon dang bcas pa'i sbyin sreg byas na nges par char pa gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te klu gdug pa rnams char pa gcod par mi byed na de'i tshe sngar gsungs pa'i mngon spyod kyi thab khung du mngon spyod kyi cho gas dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phul ba'i me tog rnying pa dang / ras bal gyi sa bon dang bcas pa'i sbyin sreg byas na nges par char pa gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the evil nāgas do not stop the rain, then at that time, in the previously mentioned wrathful fire pit, by the rite of wrathful action, one should offer into the fire the old flowers offered to glorious Vajrasattva, together with cotton seeds.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sbyor bas dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sbyor bas dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: The summoning by the method of Kāmarāja is taught.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod pa rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis 'dod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod pa rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis 'dod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Kāmarāja means the one who is the king of desires, by the fact of fulfilling the desires of all the Tathāgatas.

original: ji skad du sdom pa las ;
analyzed: ji skad du sdom pa las ;
translated: As it is said in the Saṃvarodaya:

original: takki rtag tu 'dod par bshad //
analyzed: takki rtag tu 'dod par bshad //
translated: Takki is always said to be desire.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: And:

original: ling+ga zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma ste bsgrub bya'i gzugs so //
analyzed: ling+ga zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma ste bsgrub bya'i gzugs so //
translated: Liṅga is the sign, the form of the victim.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the union of Vajrasattva,

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: This is by the yoga of non-duality.

original: la la dag rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po las byung ba 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sbyor bas zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: la la dag rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po las byung ba 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sbyor bas zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some maintain that it is by the yoga of the king of desire arisen from the Great Vajra Holder.

original: sngags kyi 'khor los zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du sprul pa'i bka'i 'khor los zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngags kyi 'khor los zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du sprul pa'i bka'i 'khor los zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mantra wheel is the wheel of the command emanation.

original: dgug par 'gyur zhes bya ba las 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dgug par 'gyur zhes bya ba las 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that one should summon.

original: bka'i 'khor lo la gnas nas 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i rnal 'byor gyis @247a * //
analyzed: bka'i 'khor lo la gnas nas 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i rnal 'byor gyis @247a * //
translated: Having remained in the wheel of the command, by the yoga of the king of desire,

original: rang gi sngags bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pas bzlas la gshin rje gshed po dgug pa'i cho ga dang bcas pas rang gi snying ga las grub pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu spros nas bsgrub par bya ba dgug ste gong bu dgug pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sngags bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pas bzlas la gshin rje gshed po dgug pa'i cho ga dang bcas pas rang gi snying ga las grub pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu spros nas bsgrub par bya ba dgug ste gong bu dgug pa'o //
translated: one should recite one's mantra with the words of invocation. Having emanated the vajra hook created from one's heart together with the rite of summoning Yamantaka, one should summon the victim. This is the summoning of the aggregate.

original: rkang pa dgug pa yang /
analyzed: rkang pa dgug pa yang /
translated: The summoning of the feet is also

original: padmo'i snod kyi dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris nas de'i dbus su rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: padmo'i snod kyi dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris nas de'i dbus su rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
translated: Having drawn an eight-petaled lotus in the center of a lotus vessel, one should write a vajra hook in its center.

original: de'i rdo rje steng du bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel nas 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sngags yung ba dang srin lag gi khrag gi wang dang bcas pas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje steng du bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel nas 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sngags yung ba dang srin lag gi khrag gi wang dang bcas pas bri bar bya'o //
translated: Above that vajra, one should write the name of the victim, along with the mantra of Kāmarāja, with saffron and the blood of a ring finger.

original: padma'i 'dab ma rnams la sgrol ma'i sngags bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma rnams la sgrol ma'i sngags bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should write the Tārā mantra on the lotus petals.

original: de'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge rnams myos byed kyi khu ba dang / gi wang dag gis bris la padma'i 'dab ma'i rtse mo la gshin rje gshed kyi sngags mdzub mo'i khrag dang dug gis bsgrub bya'i ming dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge rnams myos byed kyi khu ba dang / gi wang dag gis bris la padma'i 'dab ma'i rtse mo la gshin rje gshed kyi sngags mdzub mo'i khrag dang dug gis bsgrub bya'i ming dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In its center, one should write the syllables of the victim's name with liquor and bovine orpiment, and on the tips of the lotus petals, one should write the mantra of Yamāntaka with the blood of a ring finger and poison, along with the name of the victim.

original: de bzhin du padma'i snod gzhan bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du padma'i snod gzhan bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw another lotus vessel in the same way.

original: dur khrod kyi ras la yang 'di nyid kyis 'khor lo bris nas /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi ras la yang 'di nyid kyis 'khor lo bris nas /
translated: On a cloth from a charnel ground, one should draw this very wheel.

original: rdza mkhan gyi lag ba phyis pa'i 'dag pa la gzugs brnyan byas nas snying gar bcug ste /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi lag ba phyis pa'i 'dag pa la gzugs brnyan byas nas snying gar bcug ste /
translated: Having made an image of the potter's wheel on a clean cloth, and placed it on the heart,

original: dgug pa la sogs pa sngon du song bas thod pa gnyis kha sbyar nas /
analyzed: dgug pa la sogs pa sngon du song bas thod pa gnyis kha sbyar nas /
translated: having performed the summoning, etc., the two skulls are joined together,

original: seng ldeng gi me la sro zhing sngags re re brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na de ltar na zhag bdun gyis khugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: seng ldeng gi me la sro zhing sngags re re brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na de ltar na zhag bdun gyis khugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and heated over a khadira fire. If one repeats the mantra one hundred and eight times, then in that way, in seven days, [the skull] will be drawn in.

original: lha la sogs pa yang dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa yang dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The summoning of gods, etc., is stated: Then, etc.

original: rnam par dag pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'i srad bus cha shas thams cad mdud pa las phreng ba'i ye shes ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'i srad bus cha shas thams cad mdud pa las phreng ba'i ye shes ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
translated: The knowledge of the rosary is the Great Vajra Holder, from the knot of all the parts with the thread of pure knowledge, etc.

original: de nyid mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis de'i gdul bya thams cad kyi tsha ba thams cad 'phrog pa'i phyir chu bzhin dmigs te gang la ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis de'i gdul bya thams cad kyi tsha ba thams cad 'phrog pa'i phyir chu bzhin dmigs te gang la ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That itself is observed as water, by the nature of being immovable, because it takes away all the heat of all the disciples of that [Vajra Holder]. That samadhi is so-called because of that.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Since all afflictions are unable to disturb it, it is unmoving.

original: gdug pa thams cad gdul ba'i phyir rdo rje gtum po'o //
analyzed: gdug pa thams cad gdul ba'i phyir rdo rje gtum po'o //
translated: Since it subdues all evildoers, it is Vajra Wrath.

original: kha sbyar gyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: kha sbyar gyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas so //
translated: The union of the two is the cultivation of nondual yoga.

original: la la dag ni chung ma dang bcas pa dgug par bya zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: la la dag ni chung ma dang bcas pa dgug par bya zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some desire to summon even those who are married.

original: 'di gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor gyis rkang pa g-yas pa'i srin lag gi khrag dang / tshva dang / tsha ba gsum rnams lha chen @247b po la sogs pa gang 'dod par rang gi chung ma dang bcas pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du bris nas /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor gyis rkang pa g-yas pa'i srin lag gi khrag dang / tshva dang / tsha ba gsum rnams lha chen @247b po la sogs pa gang 'dod par rang gi chung ma dang bcas pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du bris nas /
translated: By the yoga of the unmoving, with the blood of the ring finger of the right foot, salt, and the three pungent substances, whatever one desires, such as Maheśvara, along with one's own wife, is summoned.

original: rang gi sngags bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pa brjod nas gshin rje gshed kyis dgug par gsungs pa'i cho gas dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sngags bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas pa brjod nas gshin rje gshed kyis dgug par gsungs pa'i cho gas dgug par bya'o //
translated: Having drawn them as they are, one should recite one's own mantra with the words of invocation, and summon them with the ritual taught for summoning by Yamāntaka.

original: spyan la sogs pa dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa /🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa /🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For the purpose of summoning Pṛthivī and so forth, it is said:🔽Then, having recited the mantra of the great hero, one should summon the earth goddess with the ritual taught for summoning by Yamāntaka.

original: dam tshig ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
translated: The pledge is the Great Vajra Holder.

original: kun du zhes bya ba'i tshig la ni /
analyzed: kun du zhes bya ba'i tshig la ni /
translated: The word “everywhere”

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pas de nyid gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pas de nyid gsungs pa'o //
translated: means that since the nature of all things is the nature of the realm of phenomena, he is that.

original: rnam par 'phrul zhes bya ba ni gnod mdzes te /
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul zhes bya ba ni gnod mdzes te /
translated: “Emanation” is Akṣobhya.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya ste mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya ste mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditative stabilization that focuses on him is called that, because it is indivisible.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i zhabs kyis mnan //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i zhabs kyis mnan //
translated: “Vajrasattva’s foot is pressed down”

original: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi phyir mi bskyod pas dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi phyir mi bskyod pas dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: means that because it is concordant with the exalted wisdom of the realm of phenomena, it is endowed with the consecration of Akṣobhya.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun bdag po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun bdag po //
translated: “The lord of all the transcendent lords”

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that he is in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: rdo rje bu mo dgug par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje bu mo dgug par bya //
translated: “The vajra girl is summoned”

original: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: means the following.

original: gnod mdzes kyi rnal 'byor du byas nas shin tu sngags pa'i bud med kyi thod pa la rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis spyan la sogs pa'i nang nas gang 'dod pa bris nas rdo rje lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas de'i🔽chu skyes mnan nas g-yon brkyang ba dang ldan pas /
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyi rnal 'byor du byas nas shin tu sngags pa'i bud med kyi thod pa la rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis spyan la sogs pa'i nang nas gang 'dod pa bris nas rdo rje lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas de'i chu skyes mnan nas g-yon brkyang ba dang ldan pas /
translated: One presses down on her lotus with one’s left foot, which is blessed by the vajra hook, and one is in the left-extended posture.🔽With the hook of one’s right hand, one pierces her heart, and one binds her throat with a noose.

original: lag pa g-yas pa'i lcags kyus snying ga phug pa dang / mgrin pa zhags pas kyang bcings nas bskul tshig dang ldan pa'i sngags zlos shing dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa'i lcags kyus snying ga phug pa dang / mgrin pa zhags pas kyang bcings nas bskul tshig dang ldan pa'i sngags zlos shing dgug par bya'o //
translated: One should summon her while reciting the mantra with the words of entreaty.

original: yang de nyid bsdus pa las /🔽rab tu byung bar mig bskul zhing /
analyzed: yang de nyid bsdus pa las / rab tu byung bar mig bskul zhing /
translated: Again, the Compendium of Principles states:🔽One should summon a renunciate

original: mig gi rdzi ma 'gugs byed pa //
analyzed: mig gi rdzi ma 'gugs byed pa //
translated: by moving one’s eye and the corners of one’s eyes.

original: lta ba gzi can yin par bshad //
analyzed: lta ba gzi can yin par bshad //
translated: This is explained as the gaze of blazing fire.

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'gugs byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'gugs byed pa'o //
translated: It summons all migrating beings.

original: zhes pa ni 'bar ba'i lta ba ste 'gugs pa'i las thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'bar ba'i lta ba ste 'gugs pa'i las thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is the gaze of blazing fire. It should be applied to all activities of summoning.

original: bcu gcig pa las bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa las bsgrub par bya //
translated: The eleventh is to be accomplished by action.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The eleventh is to be accomplished by action.

original: rdo rje dgug pa sgrub pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: rdo rje dgug pa sgrub pa'i skabs su /
translated: In the context of accomplishing the vajra hook,

original: bstan pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'gugs pa gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: bstan pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'gugs pa gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: it is clearly stated that the buddhas and so forth are summoned.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: dam tshig chen po zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la ste /🔽byang chub kyi sems @248a * //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la ste / byang chub kyi sems @248a * //
translated: The great commitment is Akṣobhya,🔽because the essence of the thought of awakening

original: kyi ngo bos thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi ngo bos thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: is the cause of everything.

original: de 'byung ba ni mi phyed pa ste /
analyzed: de 'byung ba ni mi phyed pa ste /
translated: Its emergence is indivisible,

original: gang du ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: wherever one enters into the meditative concentration.

original: dam tshig chen po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
translated: The great commitment is the Great Vajradhara,

original: de nyid sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum gyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum gyi gsang ba'o //
translated: because he is the nature of the three vajras, the body vajra, etc.

original: de nyid kyis tshig gi brda las phyin ci ma log par don ston cing rtogs par byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ngag gi dam tshig gi de kho na nyid kyis gnas las byung ba'o //🔽sangs rgyas rdo rje'i sku gsum la //
analyzed: de nyid kyis tshig gi brda las phyin ci ma log par don ston cing rtogs par byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ngag gi dam tshig gi de kho na nyid kyis gnas las byung ba'o // sangs rgyas rdo rje'i sku gsum la //
translated: The reality of the pledge of speech is that it arises from the abode of the speech of all Tathagatas, because it is endowed with the power to show and to make understood the meaning without error from the verbal sign.

original: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa'i bdag nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams la'o //🔽rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa'i bdag nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams la'o // rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par bsgom //
translated: In the three vajra bodies of the Buddhas means in the bodies, speech, and minds which are the nature of the Emanation Body, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa'i /
translated: Meditate on Vajrasattva means meditate on oneself as white, etc., like Vajrasattva.

original: bdag nyid rdor je lcags kyu bsgom //🔽zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid rdor je lcags kyu bsgom // zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Meditate on Vajra-ankusa means meditate on oneself as Vajra-ankusa.🔽Vajra-paśa, Vajra-sphoṭa, and Vajra-ghanta means meditate on oneself as Vajra-paśa, etc.

original: zhags pa rdo rje kyo ba 'dzin //🔽zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhags pa rdo rje kyo ba 'dzin // zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of Vajra-ankusa is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dgug pa la ji lta ba bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i sbyor ba byas nas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dgug pa la ji lta ba bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i sbyor ba byas nas ni /
translated: Having performed the yoga of Akṣobhya just as in the case of summoning the Tathagatas, one should visualize oneself as Vajra-ankusa, white in color, with three faces, six arms, and four legs.

original: snying ga nas rdo rje lcags kyu rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rnam pa phyung nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgug go zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: snying ga nas rdo rje lcags kyu rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rnam pa phyung nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgug go zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say that from the heart, a vajra hook emerges in the form of a great vajra holder, and all tathāgatas are summoned.

original: gnod mdzes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa de'i rnal 'byor gyis de'i sngags brjod cing spros pa'i gnod mdzes kyi sprin lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas thams cad dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa de'i rnal 'byor gyis de'i sngags brjod cing spros pa'i gnod mdzes kyi sprin lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas thams cad dgug par bya'o //
translated: In the center of the mandala of Sumbha, abiding in that yoga, reciting that mantra, the clouds of Sumbha emanated, holding hooks and lassos, all buddhas are summoned.

original: zhes gsungs so 'dir yang dgug pa dang / spyan drang ba dang / 'dren par dkyil 'khor gyi sgrub pa la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so 'dir yang dgug pa dang / spyan drang ba dang / 'dren par dkyil 'khor gyi sgrub pa la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, summoning, inviting, and leading should be understood in the context of the mandala practice.

original: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba bcu drug pa las /
analyzed: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba bcu drug pa las /
translated: Also, regarding the sixteen topics to be explained,

original: khro bo'i rgyal pos dgug nas ni //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal pos dgug nas ni //
translated: the King of Wrath summons

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mchod par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mchod par bya //
translated: and all buddhas are worshipped.

original: zhes so // rdo rje 'dzin pa dgug pa yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // rdo rje 'dzin pa dgug pa yang gsungs pa /
translated: Also, summoning the vajra holder is stated:

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With buddhas and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni snang ba mtha' yas so ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni snang ba mtha' yas so ;
translated: The speech of the Buddha is Amitābha.

original: / sku ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: / sku ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The body is Vairocana.

original: 'di gnyis kyi nang nas gang yang rung ba'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi nang nas gang yang rung ba'i sbyor bas so //
translated: By the application of either of these two.

original: 'khor lo chen po'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: 'khor lo chen po'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of the great wheel.

original: zhes bya ba ni bka'i 'khor los te rang gi dkyil 'khor lo zhes kha cig 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bka'i 'khor los te rang gi dkyil 'khor lo zhes kha cig 'dod do //
translated: This is the wheel of the word, and some believe it is one’s own maṇḍala.

original: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ji lta ba @248b bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i bdag po'i sbyor ba byas nas 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba @248b bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i bdag po'i sbyor ba byas nas 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa dgug par bya'o //
translated: Having performed the application of the lord of whichever is desired, Vairocana and so forth, one should summon Vajradhara with the hook of the wheel and so forth.

original: da ni rigs kyi dbye ba dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rigs kyi dbye ba dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the summoning of the division of the families is taught:

original: 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The wheel, etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / mi bskyod pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / mi bskyod pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By Vairocana, Amitābha, and Akṣobhya.

original: mi phyed rdo rje gsum bsgoms nas //
analyzed: mi phyed rdo rje gsum bsgoms nas //
translated: Having meditated on the three indivisible vajras,

original: zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa thogs pa'i lha'i gzugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa thogs pa'i lha'i gzugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one should visualize oneself in the form of a deity holding a wheel-hook, etc., which are the nature of the three bodies.

original: rdo rje kyo ba'i khyad par gyis //🔽zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor byas nas 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa 'dzin par rang gi kha dog dang 'dra ba'i lha spros pa rnams kyis rang gi
analyzed: rdo rje kyo ba'i khyad par gyis // zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor byas nas 'khor lo'i lcags kyu la sogs pa 'dzin par rang gi kha dog dang 'dra ba'i lha spros pa rnams kyis rang gi
translated: By the special vajra hook🔽This is what is being said: Having performed the yoga of Vairochana, etc., in the center of one's own mandala, one should summon all the deities of one's own

original: rigs thams cad kyi lha dgug par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi lha dgug par bya'o zhes so //
translated: family with emanated deities holding a wheel-hook, etc., who are the same color as oneself.

original: da ni 'khrul 'khor la ma ltos par rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyis gang 'dod pa'i bu mo dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'khrul 'khor la ma ltos par rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyis gang 'dod pa'i bu mo dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to summon any desired girl without relying on a machine, it is stated for all yogis:

original: rang sngags skyes bu bsgoms nas ni //
analyzed: rang sngags skyes bu bsgoms nas ni //
translated: Having visualized the being born from one's mantra,

original: zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i gzugs su rang gi sngags kyis bdag nyid bsgoms nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i gzugs su rang gi sngags kyis bdag nyid bsgoms nas so //
translated: One should visualize oneself in the form of any desired deity, such as Yamantaka, by means of one's own mantra.

original: thams cad rdo rje'i dngos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rdul phra rab las byas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad rdo rje'i dngos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rdul phra rab las byas pa'o //
translated: All vajra substances means made of the atoms of all Buddhas.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni bud med kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //🔽snying gar rdor rje kyo ba sbyar //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni bud med kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o // snying gar rdor rje kyo ba sbyar //
translated: Supreme means endowed with the characteristics of a woman.🔽One should join the vajra hook at the heart.

original: zhes bya ba ni snying gar rdo rje lcags kyus phug nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snying gar rdo rje lcags kyus phug nas so //
translated: One should pierce the heart with the vajra hook.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of the wind mandala.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rang gi lha'i sbyor bas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas te /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i sbyor bas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas te /
translated: One should stand in the center of the mandala by the yoga of one's deity.

original: gang 'dod pa'i bu mo rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zhon pa des kyang mngon du bskul bar bsams te /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i bu mo rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zhon pa des kyang mngon du bskul bar bsams te /
translated: One should imagine that the desired girl, mounted on the wind mandala, is urged on.

original: rang gi lha'i gzugs zhags pa dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa rnams kyis de ji lta ba'i rang gi gnas nas bcings te khyer nas 'ongs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i gzugs zhags pa dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa rnams kyis de ji lta ba'i rang gi gnas nas bcings te khyer nas 'ongs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that one’s deity in the form of a noose and a hook binds and carries away the victim just as he is from his abode.

original: dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis kyang de dgug par lhur bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis kyang de dgug par lhur bya'o //
translated: The members of the maṇḍala should also strive to summon him.

original: rang yang de'i ming dang spel ba'i sbyor bar rang gi sngags dza'i mtha' can bzlas nas dgug par bya'o //🔽dgug pa'i bsgrub bya rdo rje'i @249a * //
analyzed: rang yang de'i ming dang spel ba'i sbyor bar rang gi sngags dza'i mtha' can bzlas nas dgug par bya'o // dgug pa'i bsgrub bya rdo rje'i @249a * //
translated: One should also summon him, repeating one’s own mantra with the addition of the name, ending with jaḥ.

original: rlung gis bskams pas dub par 'gyur ba 'di gsungs pa /
analyzed: rlung gis bskams pas dub par 'gyur ba 'di gsungs pa /
translated: The victim to be summoned, exhausted by the vajra wind, is dried up. This is stated:

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Vairocana,” etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the form of the moon, which is the transformation of the great seal of Vairocana.

original: de la sha rtsi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la sha rtsi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The nectar of the moon” there

original: de zla ba'i steng du bsgrub par bya ba la spyan gyis bdud rtsis dbang bskur bar bsam par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de zla ba'i steng du bsgrub par bya ba la spyan gyis bdud rtsis dbang bskur bar bsam par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that one should imagine that the victim is consecrated with the nectar by the eye.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
translated: This is taught:🔽By the yoga of vajra nectar.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: ring po nas blangs pa'i bsgrub bya'i mgo bo la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa spyan ji lta ba bzhin kha dog dkar po bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'i mchog bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ring po nas blangs pa'i bsgrub bya'i mgo bo la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa spyan ji lta ba bzhin kha dog dkar po bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'i mchog bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize the head of the victim, who is brought from afar, as a moon disk, which is the nature of Vairocana, with eyes just like one’s own, white in color, the supreme nectar-dripper.

original: rdo rje rlung rdzogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje rlung rdzogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The vajra wind is taught as complete:

original: rdo rje lcags kyu gzugs po che //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu gzugs po che //
translated: The vajra hook is the great body.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs so //
translated: The great body is the form of the great seal.

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The vajra circle is

original: rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs su yongs su gyur par bsgoms nas de la bskyon nas dgug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs su yongs su gyur par bsgoms nas de la bskyon nas dgug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the form of the vajra wind circle. Having visualized it, one should mount it and summon, this is the meaning.

original: nam mkha'i bu mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i bu mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The daughter of space is

original: nam mkha' gang dgug par bya ba ni de 'di nyid dgug pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: nam mkha' gang dgug par bya ba ni de 'di nyid dgug pa'i mchog go //
translated: the space that is summoned. This is the supreme summoning.

original: gang 'dir rdo rje lcags kyu 'di 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs par yang la la dag brjod de ;
analyzed: gang 'dir rdo rje lcags kyu 'di 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs par yang la la dag brjod de ;
translated: Here, some have called this the Vajra Hook, the King of Desire, and so on.

original: de 'di lan gnyis smos pa'i phyir 'brel pa med de //
analyzed: de 'di lan gnyis smos pa'i phyir 'brel pa med de //
translated: But since it is mentioned twice, it is not connected.

original: sa 'og gi bu mo dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: sa 'og gi bu mo dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: It is stated for the purpose of summoning the daughters of the underworld.

original: khro bo'i rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: khro bo'i rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The wrathful vajra and so on.

original: khro bo'i rdo rje ni khro bo rdo rje ste gnod mdzes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khro bo'i rdo rje ni khro bo rdo rje ste gnod mdzes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The wrathful vajra is the wrathful Vajra, meaning Sumbha.

original: de nyid dam tshig ste 'da' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid dam tshig ste 'da' bar mi bya'o //
translated: That itself is the commitment, which should not be transgressed.

original: gang rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By whom?

original: gtso bo nyid kyi phyir rdo rje sa 'og gnas pa la ni drug pa'i don gyis gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid kyi phyir rdo rje sa 'og gnas pa la ni drug pa'i don gyis gnyis pa'o //
translated: Because of being the principal one, the second is by the sixth case for the vajra dwelling in the underworld.

original: yang na dam tshig ni thams cad kyi yin la rdo rje yang ste gdug pa thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na dam tshig ni thams cad kyi yin la rdo rje yang ste gdug pa thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the commitment is of all, and it is the vajra, because it conquers all evildoers.

original: sa 'og gnas par byed pa ni sa 'og tu gnas pa dag gnod mdzes nyid do//
analyzed: sa 'og gnas par byed pa ni sa 'og tu gnas pa dag gnod mdzes nyid do//
translated: The maker of the underworld is the one who makes the underworld, Sumbha himself.

original: de bsgoms nas zhes sngar brjod pa'i tshig dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de bsgoms nas zhes sngar brjod pa'i tshig dang 'brel to //
translated: Meditating on that is connected with the previously stated words.

original: sh'u la rdo rje kyo zhags kyis //
analyzed: sh'u la rdo rje kyo zhags kyis //
translated: With the Vajra-noose, the Yaksa girl.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsung pa yin te /🔽gnod mdzes kyi rnal 'byor gyis rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas la rang gi snying gnas bdag nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i khro bo 'khor lo @249b spro bar bya ste 'on kyang rdo rje lcags kyu dang ral gri dang / rtse gsum dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsung pa yin te / gnod mdzes kyi rnal 'byor gyis rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas la rang gi snying gnas bdag nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i khro bo 'khor lo @249b spro bar bya ste 'on kyang rdo rje lcags kyu dang ral gri dang / rtse gsum dang /
translated: In this regard, it is said:

original: zhags pa lag na thogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhags pa lag na thogs pa ste /
translated: Dwelling in the center of one's mandala through the yoga of Sumbha, one should emit from one's heart a wrathful one who is similar to oneself, but with a vajra-hook, sword, trident, and noose in his hands.

original: des ji lta ba bzhin du lha ma yin gyi bu mo dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: des ji lta ba bzhin du lha ma yin gyi bu mo dgug par bya'o //
translated: With that, one should summon the Yaksa girl in the proper way.

original: btsag la sogs pa'i sgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: btsag la sogs pa'i sgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: The prescription for the accomplishment of vermilion, etc.

original: btsag ces bya ba la sogs pa la kyang gi sgras gi wang la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: btsag ces bya ba la sogs pa la kyang gi sgras gi wang la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word also in vermilion, etc. includes guggulu, etc.

original: rdo rje kyo ba'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje kyo ba'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: With the yoga of the Vajra-noose, it is said:

original: mtshan ma thob pas 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i sbyor ba byas nas zla ba gzas zin pa la yi ge h'um las rdo rgyus la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rdo rje lcags kyu'i gzugs su mos par byas nas khar zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pas 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i sbyor ba byas nas zla ba gzas zin pa la yi ge h'um las rdo rgyus la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rdo rje lcags kyu'i gzugs su mos par byas nas khar zhes bya ba ni
translated: When the moon is eclipsed, one should imagine that the subtle particles of the chalk, and so on, are in the form of a vajra hook from the syllable hūṃ.

original: rang gi rig ma dang gnyis su med par gyur pas phyi'i rig ma'i padmar bcug nas rdo rjes kha bcad nas /
analyzed: rang gi rig ma dang gnyis su med par gyur pas phyi'i rig ma'i padmar bcug nas rdo rjes kha bcad nas /
translated: One should insert the external knowledge woman into one’s own lotus of nonduality with the knowledge woman.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du grub pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu'i lha nang du gzhug pa dang spro ba la sogs pa byas nas gang gi tshe bzlas pa byas te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du grub pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu'i lha nang du gzhug pa dang spro ba la sogs pa byas nas gang gi tshe bzlas pa byas te /
translated: Having closed the mouth with the vajra, one should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the vajra hook deity, just as it is, and perform the rite of entering and emanating, and so on.

original: zla ba gzas zin pa btang gi bar du'o //
analyzed: zla ba gzas zin pa btang gi bar du'o //
translated: When one recites the mantra, one should do so until the moon is released from the eclipse.🔽Then, having understood the signs of accomplishment, such as heat, and so on, in sequence, one should take them and guard them.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the hook.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the noose.

original: de nas dro ba la sogs pa rim gyis dngos grub kyi mtshan ma shes nas de blangs te bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dro ba la sogs pa rim gyis dngos grub kyi mtshan ma shes nas de blangs te bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the fetters.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the bell.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the sword.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the eye ointment.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the ear ointment.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the foot ointment.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the pill.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the collyrium.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the sword.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the flying ointment.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the invisibility.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the elixir.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the sword.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the eye ointment.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the ear ointment.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the foot ointment.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the pill.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the collyrium.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the sword.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the flying ointment.🔽One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the invisibility.

original: 'jigs shing skrag nas 'ong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jigs shing skrag nas 'ong bar 'gyur //
translated: One should perform the rite of the accomplishment of the elixir.

original: zhes pa la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: One should

original: de ltar sgrub pa'i rdzas kyis drag po la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i ming bris nas zhabs kyis mnan te /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa'i rdzas kyis drag po la sogs pa gang 'dod pa'i ming bris nas zhabs kyis mnan te /
translated: Having written the name of the one desired, such as Rudra, etc., with the substances of the accomplishment, one should step on him with one's foot.

original: snga ma bzhin ming dang spel ba'i sbyor ba'i sngags bzlas pa na de yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zhon nas 'ong bar bsgoms na /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin ming dang spel ba'i sbyor ba'i sngags bzlas pa na de yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zhon nas 'ong bar bsgoms na /
translated: If one repeats the mantra of the procedure of the name and the repetition, as before, and meditates on him coming, mounted on the wind mandala,

original: nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will certainly come.

original: gnod sbyin mo dgug pa gsungs pa rnam pa'i mchog kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo dgug pa gsungs pa rnam pa'i mchog kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The summoning of the yakṣiṇī is stated by “all the best aspects,” etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'jam pa'i rdo rje bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'jam pa'i rdo rje bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on oneself as Mañjuvajra in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: khro bo chen po gshin rje gshed //
analyzed: khro bo chen po gshin rje gshed //
translated: The great wrathful one, Yamāntaka,

original: ces bya ba ni rang gi snying gar nyi ma la gshin rje gshed lag na lcags kyu thogs pa de'i sngags kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rang gi snying gar nyi ma la gshin rje gshed lag na lcags kyu thogs pa de'i sngags kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: is at one’s heart on a sun, meditating on Yamāntaka holding a hook, with his mantra.

original: bskal pa bsreg pa'i 'khor lo che //
analyzed: bskal pa bsreg pa'i 'khor lo che //
translated: The great wheel of the eon fire

original: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: is stated as follows.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i sbyor ba byas nas /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i sbyor ba byas nas /
translated: Having performed the yoga of Mañjuvajra just as before,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi snying gnas 'bar ba'i phreng ba can lcags kyu lag na thogs pa gshin rje gshed po phyung ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi snying gnas 'bar ba'i phreng ba can lcags kyu lag na thogs pa gshin rje gshed po phyung ste /
translated: Just as before, blazing garland, holding a hook in her hand, Yamāntaka emerges from one's heart.

original: gnod sbyin mo'i snying gar gzhug pa 'am mgo bo'i steng du gzhag ste /🔽de @250a * //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo'i snying gar gzhug pa 'am mgo bo'i steng du gzhag ste / de @250a * //
translated: He enters the heart of the yakṣiṇī or is placed on top of her head.

original: yang de'i 'od zer rnams kyis bskal pa'i me bzhin du thams cad sreg pa dang ldan par rang la mngon par phyogs pa bsil ba'i lan nas 'jam pa'i rdo rje la skyabs su 'gro ba'i bsam pas 'ong bar bsam par bya zhing /
analyzed: yang de'i 'od zer rnams kyis bskal pa'i me bzhin du thams cad sreg pa dang ldan par rang la mngon par phyogs pa bsil ba'i lan nas 'jam pa'i rdo rje la skyabs su 'gro ba'i bsam pas 'ong bar bsam par bya zhing /
translated: Then, one should imagine that she comes, with a mind of refuge to Mañjuvajra, her entire body blazing like the fire at the end of the eon, burning with the light rays of Yamāntaka, and cooling off in front of oneself.

original: gshin rje gshed po'i sngags dang spel ba'i k'im gi yi ge zlos shing ji lta pa bzhin du dgug la nye bar longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed po'i sngags dang spel ba'i k'im gi yi ge zlos shing ji lta pa bzhin du dgug la nye bar longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: Reciting the syllable kīṃ, combined with the mantra of Yamāntaka, one should summon her just as before and enjoy her.

original: srin mo dgug pa'i cho ga yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: srin mo dgug pa'i cho ga yang de bzhin te /
translated: The rite of summoning a rākṣasī is also like that.

original: 'on kyang 'di 'ongs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di 'ongs par 'gyur na /
translated: However, if she comes,

original: sha dang khrag gi yon chab sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sha dang khrag gi yon chab sbyin par bya'o //
translated: one should offer her a libation of flesh and blood.

original: gnod sbyin mo la me tog dkar po dri'i chu dang bsres pas so //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo la me tog dkar po dri'i chu dang bsres pas so //
translated: For the yakṣiṇīs, with white flowers mixed with fragrant water.

original: klu mo rnams la 'o mas so //
analyzed: klu mo rnams la 'o mas so //
translated: For the nāgīs, with milk.

original: gzhan rnams la ni bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga dang dri chu bsres pas yon chab sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga dang dri chu bsres pas yon chab sbyin par bya'o //
translated: For the others, one should offer water for the feet with the five nectars mixed with fragrant water.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i zur gyi lhag ma gsungs pa /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i zur gyi lhag ma gsungs pa /
translated: The remainder of the concluding section is stated:

original: kun gyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyag rgya'i khyad par ni 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: kun gyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyag rgya'i khyad par ni 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan gyi khyad par ro //
translated: The special mudrā of all, etc. The special mudrā is the special hand implement such as a wheel, etc.

original: sngags kyi khyad par ni sa bon dang rig pas khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi khyad par ni sa bon dang rig pas khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: The special mantra is distinguished by the seed syllable and knowledge mantra.

original: dgug pa dag gi gnas su gsungs //
analyzed: dgug pa dag gi gnas su gsungs //
translated: They are taught as the places of summoning.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gang gi sngags dang phyag rgya las bskyed pa'i gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor byas nas /
analyzed: gang gi sngags dang phyag rgya las bskyed pa'i gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor byas nas /
translated: Having performed the yoga of Yamāntaka, etc. generated from the mantra and mudrā,

original: de'i sngags nyid bsgoms pas rang gi rigs kyi bdag po'i rtsa ba'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'i lcags kyu la sogs pa'i rnam pas gshin rje gshed la sogs pas bsgrub bya dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sngags nyid bsgoms pas rang gi rigs kyi bdag po'i rtsa ba'i mtshan mas mtshan pa'i lcags kyu la sogs pa'i rnam pas gshin rje gshed la sogs pas bsgrub bya dgug par bya'o //
translated: By meditating on just that mantra, one should summon the victim with the form of a hook marked with the root sign of one's own clan lord, etc.

original: gzhan du byas na 'jigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du byas na 'jigs par 'gyur //
translated: Otherwise, there is fear.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar ma byas par gzhan gyi sngags dang gzhan gyi rnal 'byor gyis byas na de'i tshe sbyor ba nyams pas dngos grub mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar ma byas par gzhan gyi sngags dang gzhan gyi rnal 'byor gyis byas na de'i tshe sbyor ba nyams pas dngos grub mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that if one does not do it in that way, but does it with the mantra of another and the yoga of another, then at that time the practice is impaired and one does not accomplish the powers.

original: thun mong gi cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: thun mong gi cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The common rite is stated:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With the vajra mind, etc.

original: bskul bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bskul bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should summon means

original: las thams cad nyid la de'i tshe rdzogs kyi bar du yang dang yang du gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa chen por dmigs te bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: las thams cad nyid la de'i tshe rdzogs kyi bar du yang dang yang du gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa chen por dmigs te bsgom par bya'o //
translated: that one should meditate again and again on the Great Vajra Holder, who is characterized by nondual intuition, until the time of the completion of all the rites.

original: de yang bco brgyad pa las /
analyzed: de yang bco brgyad pa las /
translated: And that is stated in the Aṣṭa:

original: sku gsung thugs kyi de nyid las //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi de nyid las //
translated: From the reality of body, speech, and mind,

original: sad par bya ba bskul bar bshad //
analyzed: sad par bya ba bskul bar bshad //
translated: the arousing of the one to be awakened is explained.

original: ces so // 'dis ni byang chub kyi sems @250b bsgoms pas sems brtan par gyur pas /
analyzed: ces so // 'dis ni byang chub kyi sems @250b bsgoms pas sems brtan par gyur pas /
translated: This means that by cultivating the thought of awakening, the mind becomes firm.

original: sems tsam du khams gsum du shes nas las byed pa ni dngos grub bo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems tsam du khams gsum du shes nas las byed pa ni dngos grub bo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Having understood the three realms to be mind only, one performs the rite, which is the attainment.

original: de bzhin du le'u bcu bdun pa las /🔽'chad par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du le'u bcu bdun pa las / 'chad par 'gyur ba /
translated: Similarly, the seventeenth chapter says:

original: nam mkha'i khams su gnas pa ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ni dngos grub po zhes so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams su gnas pa ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ni dngos grub po zhes so //
translated: The one who abides in the realm of space is the Blessed One, the Tathagata of all Tathagatas, the vajra of body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas, the attainment.

original: ji ltar gzhan bskul bas gzhan 'dir 'grub par 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan bskul bas gzhan 'dir 'grub par 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is it that one is accomplished here by arousing another? It is said:🔽The one who is called the king, etc.

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la lha thams cad skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la lha thams cad skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because he generates all the gods,

original: rgyal po ni bdag po ste lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyal po ni bdag po ste lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the king is the lord, meaning he has the nature of all the gods.

original: de yang sgyu 'phrul dra ba las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang sgyu 'phrul dra ba las gsungs pa /
translated: Also, it is stated in the Net of Illusory Manifestations:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
translated: Vajrasattva, the great being,

original: thams cad sems ni yongs rdzogs pa //
analyzed: thams cad sems ni yongs rdzogs pa //
translated: the mind of all is totally perfected,

original: yang dang yang du bskul ba nyid //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bskul ba nyid //
translated: is the one who is repeatedly urged.

original: rgyal po thams cad gnas la gnas //
analyzed: rgyal po thams cad gnas la gnas //
translated: The king of all abides in the abode.

original: zhes so// dngos grub bsgrub pa'i dus su rang gi cod pan la rdo rje 'dzin pa bsam mo zhes la la dag 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes so// dngos grub bsgrub pa'i dus su rang gi cod pan la rdo rje 'dzin pa bsam mo zhes la la dag 'dod do //
translated: At the time of accomplishing the powers, some assert that one should imagine Vajradhara on one's crown.

original: de'i snying po bar dang bar du brjod do zhes la la dag 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i snying po bar dang bar du brjod do zhes la la dag 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that one should recite his essence mantra in the middle.

original: klu'i bu mo dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: klu'i bu mo dgug pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: The following is stated for the purpose of summoning the naga maidens:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun nas te thams cad byas nas rdzogs par byed bas rnam par 'phrul pa shin tu 'jug pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun nas te thams cad byas nas rdzogs par byed bas rnam par 'phrul pa shin tu 'jug pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Then, having done everything, having completed the creation, the knowledge of the total engagement of the emanation

original: bya ba 'grub par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba 'grub par bshad pa'o //
translated: is explained as the accomplishment of activities.

original: de nyid mi phyed pa ste ral gcig ma'i gzugs su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pa ste ral gcig ma'i gzugs su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That very indivisible, single-crested form is the samadhi called by that name.

original: dam tshig rdo rje zhes bya ba ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje zhes bya ba ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The one called “Vajra Commitment” is Amoghasiddhi.

analyzed: de nyid kyi mchog ni gang gi bdag po nyid kyis de ral gcig mar bshad do //

original: bkug nas nye bar spyad par bya //
analyzed: bkug nas nye bar spyad par bya //
translated: Having summoned, one should enjoy.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: bdag nyid zhal gsum pa kha dog sngon po phyag drug pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid zhal gsum pa kha dog sngon po phyag drug pa /
translated: One should imagine oneself as having three faces, a blue color, and six arms.

analyzed: dbu skra ser skya gyen du 'khyil ba lto ba che ba /

translated: The one who is summoned is
